original: me nye ba la sngar rgyu ma gtugs pa can nyid kyang khong du chud par bya'i de nyid na yod na rgyu rnams kyang ma tshang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: me nye ba la sngar rgyu ma gtugs pa can nyid kyang khong du chud par bya'i de nyid na yod na rgyu rnams kyang ma tshang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Also, it should be understood that when fire is nearby, cold to the touch is not experienced because its cause is impaired, but when fire is not nearby, the cause of cold is not impaired.

original: de lta ma yin na me nye ba yod na yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na me nye ba yod na yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then even when fire is nearby, cold to the touch would be experienced because its cause is not impaired.

original: me dmigs na de las de la nye ba nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: me dmigs na de las de la nye ba nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: When fire is not perceived, it is said that it is nearby.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni grang ba dmigs pa las dus phyis med dmigs pa na /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni grang ba dmigs pa las dus phyis med dmigs pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means that when cold to the touch is perceived, later, when fire is not perceived,

original: de nye ba nyid yin te me nye ba nyid rgyu mtshan du byas nas grang ba ma mthong pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: de nye ba nyid yin te me nye ba nyid rgyu mtshan du byas nas grang ba ma mthong pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: it is nearby because the non-perception of cold to the touch is due to the presence of fire nearby.

original: de ni tshad nyid min zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshad nyid min zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not a valid means of knowledge‚Äù is the s≈´tra.

original: mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-perception‚Äù is the explanation of that.

original: khyed kyis snang ba mthong ba med pa 'gal ba sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i ming can gyi ming gi rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed kyis snang ba mthong ba med pa 'gal ba sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i ming can gyi ming gi rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason you have stated to prove that the non-seeing of an appearance is contradictory is itself a synonym for non-apprehension, which is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir rang sgras kyang brjod pa dper na mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di na du ba med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'di na shing sha pa med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang sgras kyang brjod pa dper na mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di na du ba med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'di na shing sha pa med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also expressed by the term ‚Äúnon-apprehension,‚Äù just as in the example of ‚Äúnon-apprehension.‚Äù For example, ‚ÄúThere is no smoke here because it is not apprehended,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThere is no shasha tree here because it is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i sgra ni rang gi sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sgra ni rang gi sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúnon-apprehension‚Äù is itself the term for ‚Äúnot apprehended.‚Äù

original: @174b kyang gi sgra rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @174b kyang gi sgra rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be connected in order.

original: kyang gi sgra rim par sbyar ba na don gzhan ston par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra rim par sbyar ba na don gzhan ston par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the term ‚Äúalso‚Äù is connected in order, it indicates a different meaning.

original: de ni med pa dang de'i tha snyad kyi ci rigs par sgrub byed yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni med pa dang de'i tha snyad kyi ci rigs par sgrub byed yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is the proof of the non-existence and the convention of that, as appropriate.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin zhing khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni med pa dang de'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //üîΩdes ni de dang 'gal don gyi //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin zhing khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni med pa dang de'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no // des ni de dang 'gal don gyi //
translated: The non-apprehension of intrinsic nature establishes the term non-existence, and the non-apprehension of the pervasion, etc. , establish non-existence and the term for it.üîΩThe statement of the effect of the contradictory of that

original: 'bras bu brjod pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba'i rang bzhin de dang 'gal ba'i don gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba'i rang bzhin de dang 'gal ba'i don gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the effect of whatever object is contradictory to the intrinsic nature of the object of negation is stated.

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, in the case of ‚Äúhere there is no cold touch,‚Äù

original: grang ba dang 'gal ba ni me yin la de'i 'bras bu ni du ba yin no //
analyzed: grang ba dang 'gal ba ni me yin la de'i 'bras bu ni du ba yin no //
translated: fire is contradictory to cold and its effect is smoke.

original: mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa /
translated: Non-apprehensionüîΩis applied to all, only the effect is stated,

original: kun la sbyor ba 'ba' zhig dag / tha dad don la tha dad med //
analyzed: kun la sbyor ba 'ba' zhig dag / tha dad don la tha dad med //
translated: and the different objects are not different.

original: ces bya ba de la re zhig sbyor ba tha dad pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba de la re zhig sbyor ba tha dad pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In that regard, the cause of the difference in application is the non-apprehension of the effect, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the perception of something incompatible with it, etc.

original: de la rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa la dngos su mi dmigs pa ston pa med do zhes bya ba de ni gsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa la dngos su mi dmigs pa ston pa med do zhes bya ba de ni gsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: In that regard, the perception of something incompatible with it, etc., is the clear perception of the non-perception of the object to be refuted.

original: dgag pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa byed pa na gal te yang 'bras bu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ston par byed pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa byed pa na gal te yang 'bras bu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ston par byed pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Even though the non-perception of the effect, etc., is indicated by way of negation,

original: dngos su dgag bya'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ston pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su dgag bya'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ston pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the non-perception of the object to be refuted is not directly indicated.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa la ni rang gi sgras mi dmigs pa brjod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa la ni rang gi sgras mi dmigs pa brjod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the non-perception of the cause, etc., non-perception is accepted because the non-perception is stated by the words themselves.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa la ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa la ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it in the case of the perception of something incompatible with it, etc.?

original: mi dmigs pa 'phen par byed pa'i don bsgrub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'phen par byed pa'i don bsgrub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúby way of the establishment of the meaning that is implied by the non-perception,‚Äù etc.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba brjod pa yang go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /üîΩrgyu 'gal ba brjod pa ni dper na 'di na spu long zhes byed pa'i bye brag yod pa ma yin te gdung ba'i bye brag nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba brjod pa yang go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / rgyu 'gal ba brjod pa ni dper na 'di na spu long zhes byed pa'i bye brag yod pa ma yin te gdung ba'i bye brag nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The expression of a contradiction with a cause or a pervader is also an expression of the contradictory of the probandum.üîΩThe expression of a contradiction with a cause is like, for example, ‚ÄúHere, the particular of a mass of hair does not exist because the particular of a mirage is near.‚Äù

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba brjod pa ni 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med di me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba brjod pa ni 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med di me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The expression of a contradiction with a pervader is like, for example, ‚ÄúHere, the touch of snow does not exist because fire exists.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'di ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas don gzhan dgag pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag dang @175a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas don gzhan dgag pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag dang @175a * //
translated: Therefore, this is the expression of the contradictory of the probandum when, by way of establishing a contradiction with a nature, etc., one is engaged in the negation of something else.

original: 'gal ba bstan pa yod na de brjod pa ni dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba bstan pa yod na de brjod pa ni dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: When there is the teaching of a contradiction, the expression of that is a valid means of knowledge for establishing a negation.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas dgag pa sgrub pa gang yin pa de dag la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas dgag pa sgrub pa gang yin pa de dag la /
translated: As for the establishment of a negation by the non-observation of a nature, cause, or pervader,

original: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dag mi dmigs par ston par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dag mi dmigs par ston par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If it were the case that the non-apprehension of those which have the character of the apprehended object were taught,

original: rang gi sgras mi dmigs pa tshad ma nyid yin par brjod pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi sgras mi dmigs pa tshad ma nyid yin par brjod pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: then at that time, by the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù it would be said that non-apprehension is a valid cognition.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa la 'gal ba ma bstan pa dang / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ma bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa la 'gal ba ma bstan pa dang / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ma bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When the contradiction of the contradictory nature, etc. is not taught, and when the non-apprehension of nature, etc. is not explained in the non-apprehension of nature, etc.,

original: dgag pa la mi dmigs pa tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'gal ba brjod pa med pa dang / de yang thabs bcas bsgrubs med par //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa smos so //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba dgag la tshad //
analyzed: dgag pa la mi dmigs pa tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'gal ba brjod pa med pa dang / de yang thabs bcas bsgrubs med par // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa smos so // bsgrub par bya ba dgag la tshad //
translated: in order to show that negation is not a valid cognition of non-apprehension, the verse ‚ÄúAnd that is not established with means‚Äù is stated.

original: smra gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: smra gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe measure of the object of negation‚Äù is explained by ‚ÄúThe one who speaks‚Äù and so on.

original: 'gal ba gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy two contradictions‚Äù means by the characteristic of non-coexistence and by the characteristic of mutual exclusion.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ltar bcos pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ltar bcos pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the semblance of the perception of contradiction in nature.

original: des ni rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbor ba la yang rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i sbyor ba yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: des ni rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbor ba la yang rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i sbyor ba yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: By the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúone should understand the application of the non-perception of an effect contradictory to the cause, etc.,‚Äù one should understand the inclusion of the application of the perception of a contradiction in the cause and the pervader.

original: de dag kyang gang gi tshe 'gal ba'i don ston par mi byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang gi tshe 'gal ba'i don ston par mi byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: And when they do not show a contradictory meaning,

original: gzugs brnyan nyid yin gyi yang dag pa'i tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan nyid yin gyi yang dag pa'i tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: they are only reflections, not valid cognitions.

original: de yang bsgribs med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba la bsgribs med par zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsgribs med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba la bsgribs med par zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: And that is to be supplied with the words ‚Äúwithout obstruction.‚Äù

original: de la 'gal ba ma brjod cing de yang bsgribs pa med pa zhes bya ba de ltar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'gal ba ma brjod cing de yang bsgribs pa med pa zhes bya ba de ltar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should apply the expression unobstructed in this way.

original: gang zhig rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba'i don de bsgribs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba'i don de bsgribs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That object which is to be established as nonexistent by the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is the same as the object called unobstructed.

original: bsgribs pa yang gang yin ci de dag dgag pa la bsgribs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis brjod ce na /
analyzed: bsgribs pa yang gang yin ci de dag dgag pa la bsgribs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis brjod ce na /
translated: What is obstructed? Is it the negation? Is it being called unobstructed by this?

original: bsgribs med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩbsgribs pa med par zhes bya ba'i dgag pa'i bsdu ba 'di la /
analyzed: bsgribs med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bsgribs pa med par zhes bya ba'i dgag pa'i bsdu ba 'di la /
translated: He says unobstructed and so on.üîΩIn this compound unobstructed, the word unobstructed is taught by the word obstructed in the previous compound.

original: tshig gong ma bsgribs pa bstan par bya bas mi dmigs @175b pa bstan pa yin no //üîΩgal te de nyid kyang ji ltar thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gong ma bsgribs pa bstan par bya bas mi dmigs @175b pa bstan pa yin no // gal te de nyid kyang ji ltar thob pa yin zhe na /
translated: The word non-apprehension is taught by the word apprehension.

original: bsgribs pa'i don la mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i don la mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If that is so, how is it obtained? He says because there is no seeing of the obstructed object and so on.

original: nye bar btags nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa la 'bras bu med pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar btags nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa la 'bras bu med pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy imputation‚Äù means that the effect is imputed in the absence of a cause.

original: de mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa mi byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not do so‚Äù means that non-apprehension does not do so.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no other world‚Äù means that there is no future birth.

original: snga na med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos dang chos ma yin pa brjod do //
analyzed: snga na med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos dang chos ma yin pa brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù refers to virtue and vice.

original: snga na med pa dang lha nyid dang mtho ris la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang lha nyid dang mtho ris la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence, godhead, heaven, etc.‚Äù is a disjunctive compound.

original: smra ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshig dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smra ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshig dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSpeech and omniscience‚Äù means ‚Äúspeech and omniscience.‚Äù

original: de ltar na snang ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na snang ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúthe entity that appears,‚Äù etc.

original: de las gzhan dmigs pa'i rkyen yod na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan dmigs pa'i rkyen yod na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the condition of apprehension exists, other than that,‚Äù etc.

original: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa'i nus pa rnams yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa'i nus pa rnams yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if there is the capacity to engage the eye, form, light, and so on.

original: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin par rung ba nyid kyi phyir dgag par bya ba'i dngos po de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa la sgrub pa po'i mngon sum bshad do //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin par rung ba nyid kyi phyir dgag par bya ba'i dngos po de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa la sgrub pa po'i mngon sum bshad do //
translated: Because it is suitable to be apprehended by the direct perception of the proponent, the object of negation is explained to be the direct perception of the proponent, which has the characteristic of being observed.

original: de ltar gal te yod na mngon sum du 'gyur zhing de las sgrub pa po'i mngon sum log na med pa'i tha snyad du 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gal te yod na mngon sum du 'gyur zhing de las sgrub pa po'i mngon sum log na med pa'i tha snyad du 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If it exists in that way, it would be direct perception, and from that, the direct perception of the proponent would cease. The convention of nonexistence would be engaged.

original: dmigs pa log pas nye bar mtshon pa'i bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs la ldog pa'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs pa log pas nye bar mtshon pa'i bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs la ldog pa'i sgras bstan to //
translated: The place devoid of a vase, which is illustrated by the cessation of observation, is indicated by the word ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum de lta bu de'i khyad par ni ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed 'das pa dang da ltar gyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum de lta bu de'i khyad par ni ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed 'das pa dang da ltar gyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristic of that kind of direct perception of the proponent is ‚Äúthe formations of mindfulness that are not confused about the past and present.‚Äù

original: mthong bas bsgos pa'i med pa'i tha snyad kyi dran pa'i sa bon ni dran pa'i 'du byed yin na ;
analyzed: mthong bas bsgos pa'i med pa'i tha snyad kyi dran pa'i sa bon ni dran pa'i 'du byed yin na ;
translated: The seed of memory of the convention of non-existence, which is colored by seeing, is the formative force of memory.

original: de sgrub pa po'i mngon sum gang la rmongs pa med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de sgrub pa po'i mngon sum gang la rmongs pa med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The direct perception of the establisher, which is not confused with regard to that, is called that.

original: sngar mthong ba bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs 'das pa dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar btags nas 'das pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs 'das pa dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar btags nas 'das pa zhes bstan to //
translated: The past is taught by metaphorically designating the place devoid of a previously seen pot as the same as the established and the pleasant.

original: de bzhin du da ltar mthong ba da ltar gyi bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa can shes pa gcig dang 'dre ba can nyid kyis nye bar btags nas da ltar du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar mthong ba da ltar gyi bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa can shes pa gcig dang 'dre ba can nyid kyis nye bar btags nas da ltar du bstan to //
translated: Similarly, the present is taught by metaphorically designating the place devoid of a presently seen pot as the same as the established and the pleasant, which is mixed with a single cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na de la dang po dang tha mar med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ci ltar na 'das pa'am da ltar du 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de la dang po dang tha mar med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ci ltar na 'das pa'am da ltar du 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the non-existence of a pot, which does not exist at the beginning and end, be the object of the convention of non-existence, which is past or present?

original: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum ma 'ongs pa zhes @176a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum ma 'ongs pa zhes @176a * //
translated: The future direct perception of the establisher is not confused with regard to that.

original: bstan pa ni de log na nges par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa ni de log na nges par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because if that is not reversed, it cannot be ascertained.

original: de ltar na re zhig gang gi tshe yul gyi chos dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩsgrub pa po'i mngon sum gyi sgras bum pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa brjod cing /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gang gi tshe yul gyi chos dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe / sgrub pa po'i mngon sum gyi sgras bum pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa brjod cing /
translated: Thus, first, when the object-property is observed,üîΩthe term ‚Äúestablishment‚Äù is used to describe the characteristic of the observation of a pot,

original: log pa'i sgras nges dben pa'i sa phyogs bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i sgras nges dben pa'i sa phyogs bshad pa yin no //
translated: and the term ‚Äúreversed‚Äù is used to describe the knowledge of a place that is free from that pot.

original: gang gi tshe yul can gyi chos nyid dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul can gyi chos nyid dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the subject-property is observed,

original: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum snang ba'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i mngon sum snang ba'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: the term ‚Äúestablishment‚Äù is used to describe the knowledge that has the appearance of the object,

original: de log pa yang nges dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de log pa yang nges dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: and the term ‚Äúreversed‚Äù is used to describe the knowledge of a place that is free from that pot.

original: de med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the term ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is used.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar yang ci 'dra bar gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar yang ci 'dra bar gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is the case with the past and present?

original: kho bos bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs mthong ba de la bum pa med par gyur pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar snang ba gang yin pa de la bum pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kho bos bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs mthong ba de la bum pa med par gyur pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar snang ba gang yin pa de la bum pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement In the place devoid of pot, the pot is absent means that the pot is not present in the place that is now visible.

original: skyes bu ci lta bur gyur pa med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu ci lta bur gyur pa med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of person would engage in the convention of non-existence?

original: ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The statement the formative force of mindfulness without delusion is made.

original: de ni de las grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du 'dod pa'i yul mngon sum gyi tshad ma de las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de las grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du 'dod pa'i yul mngon sum gyi tshad ma de las grub pa yin no //
translated: That is established from that means that the object of desire is established from the valid knowledge of perception.

original: de yang gal te bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang gal te bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If that is also the case, then the statement the counter-pervasion by the counter-object and so on is made.

original: bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa la gtan tshigs 'jug pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug pa nges sgrub par byed pa'i de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa rtags gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa la gtan tshigs 'jug pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug pa nges sgrub par byed pa'i de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa rtags gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That reason which is a valid cognition that contradicts the application of the probandum to the subject is said to be a reason that has the nature of the property of the counter-pervasion, which is the necessary relation of the application of the probandum to the subject.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rtags lkog tu gyur pa'i don gang la yod pa de ni de dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rtags lkog tu gyur pa'i don gang la yod pa de ni de dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: That which has such a reason for a hidden object is said to possess it.

original: des ni rang bzhin gyi rtags dang ldan pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: des ni rang bzhin gyi rtags dang ldan pa nyid bshad do //
translated: This explains the possession of an essential reason.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu mi skyed pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu mi skyed pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By way of the cessation of the effect means by way of the non-production of the effect, such as the eye consciousness, at some time.

original: de nyid ni dper na de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni dper na de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: That itself is clarified by the example, ‚ÄúFor example, from that . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi 'bras bu nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi 'bras bu nyid du'o //
translated: Since it is asserted to be its effect means since it is asserted to be the effect of the self.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa med pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa med pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since there is no reversal that is consistent with reason,üîΩ

original: 'di ltar rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no reversal that is consistent with reason‚Äù means the following.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa la blo la sogs pa yod cing bdag 'ba' zhig pa de'i tshe dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa la blo la sogs pa yod cing bdag 'ba' zhig pa de'i tshe dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: If a pot and so on had cognition and so forth, and if there were only a self, then exhalation and so on would not arise.

original: bdag @176b log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag @176b log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: This is a reversal that is consistent with reason.

original: 'on kyang blo la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang blo la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: However, exhalation and so on do not exist in cognition and so on.

original: de med pa nyid kyi phyir de la dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa log pa yin gyi bdag med pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pa nyid kyi phyir de la dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa log pa yin gyi bdag med pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no //
translated: Because they do not exist, exhalation and so on are reversed, not because the self does not exist.

original: 'gal ba med pa'i don de 'dra bas ldog pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i don dang / smra ba nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba med pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i don de 'dra bas ldog pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i don dang / smra ba nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba med pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nonexistence of omniscience, etc., is not established by the nonexistence of speech, etc.

original: skye ba 'jig pa dang ldan pa dag ni rtag pa las gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te gnas skabs gcig gis gnas skabs gzhan de dang des 'byung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs gzhan 'jig cing phyis 'byung ba
analyzed: skye ba 'jig pa dang ldan pa dag ni rtag pa las gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te gnas skabs gcig gis gnas skabs gzhan de dang des 'byung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs gzhan 'jig cing phyis 'byung ba
translated: ‚ÄúBecause that which is produced and destroyed is established as being different from the permanent‚Äù means that if one maintains that one state is produced and destroyed by another state, then the previous state is destroyed and the subsequent state

original: ni skye ba yin no //
analyzed: ni skye ba yin no //
translated: is produced.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs de dag ni rtag pa'i gnas skabs de las gzhan nyid yin par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs de dag ni rtag pa'i gnas skabs de las gzhan nyid yin par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Those states that are produced and destroyed are maintained to be different from the permanent state.

original: de lta ma yin na rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, permanence would be undermined.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag gzhan nyid yin pas gnas pa po ther zug tu gnas par 'gyur ba de ltar na gang las 'byung ba dang 'jig par rtog pa yin /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par dag gzhan nyid yin pas gnas pa po ther zug tu gnas par 'gyur ba de ltar na gang las 'byung ba dang 'jig par rtog pa yin /
translated: Since the difference of the states is another, the enduring thing would endure eternally. In that case, from what would it originate and be destroyed?

original: gzhan gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gis gzhan gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa rtog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gis gzhan gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa rtog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Origination and destruction are not possible for another, because of the error of infinite regress.

original: de nyid ni de lta ma yin na thal ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni de lta ma yin na thal ches par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If it were not so, there would be the error of overpervasion.

original: de nyid ces 'dod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pas na ngo bo 'gal ba la gcig tu bden pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces 'dod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pas na ngo bo 'gal ba la gcig tu bden pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would not be tenable that it is just that, because it is not true, since it is not possible for that which is essentially contradictory to be truly one.

original: de'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni smra ba po'i 'dod pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its assertion‚Äù means by the assertion of the proponent.

original: gzhan nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni dngos po la 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug par mi 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni dngos po la 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug par mi 'gyur na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not be understood as another‚Äù means that it would not be engaged by the power of assertion with regard to the thing.

original: de ltar na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa ste bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa ste bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, because it is either a similar or dissimilar example, sound is impermanent, like a pot.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du nye bar bstan pas de nyid kyi tshe smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du nye bar bstan pas de nyid kyi tshe smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is taught as impermanent, at that time, by the power of the speaker's intention, because it is either a similar or dissimilar example,

original: sgra rtag pa yin te nam mkha' bzhin no zhes rtag pa'i sgo nas kyang nye bar bstan nus pa yin no //üîΩ'dis kyang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'dren mar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la yang 'bras bu @177a * //
analyzed: sgra rtag pa yin te nam mkha' bzhin no zhes rtag pa'i sgo nas kyang nye bar bstan nus pa yin no // 'dis kyang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'dren mar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la yang 'bras bu @177a * //
translated: sound is permanent, like space. Thus, it can be taught as permanent.

original: la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa'i sgras bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa'i sgras bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This also shows that nonobservation of a cause and a pervader are similar. The meaning is that because a cause is also a pervader of an effect, it is taught by the term pervader.

original: de bzlog pa la khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba 'jug pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug pas so //
analyzed: de bzlog pa la khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba 'jug pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug pas so //
translated: In order to reverse that, when there is no pervasion, the valid cognition that contradicts the engagement of the pervaded engages.

original: de tsam dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba ni khyab bya nyid tsam dang 'brel pas so //
analyzed: de tsam dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba ni khyab bya nyid tsam dang 'brel pas so //
translated: By the mere connection with that, means by the mere connection with the pervaded.

original: gang la khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the established entity of the pervader is called that.

original: 'bras bu'i yang yin no zhes bya ba na ldog pa rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yang yin no zhes bya ba na ldog pa rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: And also the effect, means that it is the occasion for understanding the reverse.

original: don gyis khyab par byed pa yang mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: don gyis khyab par byed pa yang mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The non-observation of the pervader is also taught by implication, means

original: don gyis khyab par byed pa yang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin smos pas gzung bar byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gyis khyab par byed pa yang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin smos pas gzung bar byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By mentioning the nature, the pervader is also included, because it has the same nature as that.

original: de la mngon sum nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mngon sum nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the nature of impermanence is understood by direct perception itself, means

original: rgyun chad pa'i dus na skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba dang ldan pas des dben pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi yul can la dmigs pa na kha dog la sogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i dus na skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba dang ldan pas des dben pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi yul can la dmigs pa na kha dog la sogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is no continuity, the object-possessor that is devoid of that is the object of observation, because impermanence of color, etc. is realized.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas nges pa las kyang dus phyis zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas nges pa skad cig ma dang por 'byung ba'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de las dus phyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas nges pa las kyang dus phyis zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas nges pa skad cig ma dang por 'byung ba'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de las dus phyis te /
translated: Similarly, with regard to ascertainment by inference, ‚Äúlater‚Äù means that which arises in the first moment and has the aspect of ascertainment by inference.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa dag la nges pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa dag la nges pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Later than that, in the second moment, ascertainment is also not valid cognition because it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: de bas na dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthings have the nature of disintegration.‚Äù

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because impermanence is a different object.

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyis 'jig par byed pa na bdag nyid mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyis 'jig par byed pa na bdag nyid mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can /
translated: Therefore, when destroyed by another, it is by nature unmoving.

original: la'am g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can la byed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: la'am g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can la byed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, when it is destroyed by another, it would be the self that is the cause of its destruction, whether it is by nature at rest or by nature moving.

original: de la phyogs dang po ni bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this, the first possibility is addressed in the lines: ‚ÄúIf the self is by nature at rest . . .‚Äù

original: gnyis pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can yin na yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can yin na yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The second possibility is addressed in the lines: ‚ÄúIf the self is by nature moving . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar na rang gi sde pa dag gis sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na rang gi sde pa dag gis sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
translated: How is it that our own schools have presented suffering and so on as not to be described as either the same or different?

original: de'i phyir gang yang de nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang de nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: To answer this, the text says: ‚ÄúWhatever is . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra'i don de blo la bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni chos gang yin pa de sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du brtags pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i don de blo la bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni chos gang yin pa de sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du brtags pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving posited the meaning of the term in the mind‚Äù means that the mind has ascertained that the phenomenon in question is the referent of the term.

original: rang gi mtshan gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa @177b de yang de nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa @177b de yang de nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: And that impermanence which is the intrinsic identity of that is also to be expressed as that.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù is the meaning of the word.

original: de'i ngo bo dang dben pas zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid dang dben pas te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang dben pas zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid dang dben pas te /
translated: ‚Äú Because of being devoid of its intrinsic reality‚Äù means because of being devoid of its intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third reason.

original: de nyid dam gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú As that or as something else‚Äù means as that or as something else, having the character of being such.

original: de'i ngo bos ni de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bos ni de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
translated: ‚Äú By its intrinsic reality‚Äù means as that.

original: des dben pa la ltos nas ni gzhan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: des dben pa la ltos nas ni gzhan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú In dependence on being devoid of that‚Äù means as something else.

original: chos kyi sgra ni chos can las don gzhan ma yin pa ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi sgra ni chos can las don gzhan ma yin pa ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word ‚Äúdharma‚Äù indicates that the meaning is not different from the basis of the property.

original: gal te chos can las chos gzhan yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bum pa las snam bu'i sgra bzhin du chos kyi sgra ni chos can las gzhan don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ston par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos can las chos gzhan yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bum pa las snam bu'i sgra bzhin du chos kyi sgra ni chos can las gzhan don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ston par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If the word ‚Äúquality‚Äù were different from the substratum of quality, then the word ‚Äúquality‚Äù would indicate a meaning that is different from the substratum of quality, just like the word ‚Äúblanket‚Äù is different from the word ‚Äúpot.‚Äù But that is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir sgra'i brjod par bya ba de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin ta /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra'i brjod par bya ba de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin ta /
translated: The reason is that the referent of the word is not expressible as either the same as or different from the referent of the word ‚Äúquality.‚Äù But the referent of the word ‚Äúquality‚Äù is expressible as either the same as or different from the substratum of quality.

original: ldog pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi sgra tshogs pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po du ma can gyi ngo bo brjod bya ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tha dad pa nyid kyi sgra tshogs pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po du ma can gyi ngo bo brjod bya ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúquality‚Äù is a collection of the words ‚Äúthat which is different from the substratum of quality.‚Äù Therefore, the word ‚Äúquality‚Äù does not express a thing that has many natures that are its own characteristics.

original: dngos po du ma can zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa can gyi zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po du ma can zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa can gyi zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The commentary explains the phrase ‚Äúthat has many natures‚Äù as ‚Äúthat has different natures.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ngo bo tha dad pa can nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ngo bo tha dad pa can nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is contradictory for something to have different natures that are its own characteristics.

original: des na tha dad pa'i khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa'i khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, even in terms of a single difference, it is said that ‚Äúthe various natures are grasped.‚Äù

original: gal te ba lang la sogs pa khyad par dang ldan pa tha dad pa yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te ba lang la sogs pa khyad par dang ldan pa tha dad pa yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: If cows, etc., are different in possessing a difference,

original: khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang khyad par dang ldan pa 'di bzung ba na /
analyzed: khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang khyad par dang ldan pa 'di bzung ba na /
translated: then when one possessing a difference is grasped in terms of a single difference,

original: khyad par de la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par de la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du gzung bar bya'o //
translated: it should be grasped as having a nature that benefits that difference.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa phan 'dogs par byed pa de nyid kyang khyad par thams cad la ltos nas gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa phan 'dogs par byed pa de nyid kyang khyad par thams cad la ltos nas gcig nyid yin no //
translated: That very benefit which is possessed by the difference is one in reliance on all differences.

original: de bas na bdag nyid tha dad pa nyid kyi khyad par ma lus pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du bzung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid tha dad pa nyid kyi khyad par ma lus pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du bzung ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is grasped as having a nature that benefits all differences, which are different from itself.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de mngon sum gyis bzung ba na khyad par dang ldan pa de'i nges par yongs su ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin can mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de mngon sum gyis bzung ba na khyad par dang ldan pa de'i nges par yongs su ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin can mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When such a thing is apprehended by direct perception, it is not tenable that it has a nature that is not ascertained as having a specific attribute.

original: zlos gar mkhan gyi rtsed mo'i don du kha dog dang dbyibs mtshungs pa'i gong bu la sgong gi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: zlos gar mkhan gyi rtsed mo'i don du kha dog dang dbyibs mtshungs pa'i gong bu la sgong gi sgras bstan to //
translated: For the sake of the play of an actor, a ball of clay is called a ‚Äúdoll.‚Äù

original: rgyu'i nus pa'i dngos po las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩnus pa dang ldan pa des nus pa de la phan mi @178a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa'i dngos po las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / nus pa dang ldan pa des nus pa de la phan mi @178a * //
translated: ‚Äú It is not different from the entity that is the capacity of the cause‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dogs pa'i phyir nus pa dang ldan pa de'i nus pa de yin no zhes 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i phyir nus pa dang ldan pa de'i nus pa de yin no zhes 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the entity that possesses the capacity does not benefit that capacity, it is not established that ‚Äúthat capacity belongs to that entity that possesses the capacity.‚Äù

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa dag la 'brel pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa dag la 'brel pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no connection whatsoever between that which is benefited and that which benefits.

original: nus pa rnams la nus pa dang ldan pa phan 'dogs par byed pa yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nus pa rnams la nus pa dang ldan pa phan 'dogs par byed pa yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚Äú Capacities benefit entities that possess capacities‚Äù and so on.

original: nus pa tha dad pa gang gis sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed na nus pa de dag la sa bon la sogs pa phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe nus pa dang ldan pa gang
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa gang gis sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed na nus pa de dag la sa bon la sogs pa phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe nus pa dang ldan pa gang
translated: If different potencies generate such things as sprouts from such things as seeds, and if you accept that such things as seeds assist those potencies, then what assists the potency that possesses the potency?üîΩThat which assists the potency that possesses the potency assists the potency that assists the potency that generates such things as sprouts.

original: gis nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa nus pa dang ldan pa las nus pa de las phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa de myu gu la sogs pa 'grub par byed pa de'i nus pa dang 'dra bar tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gis nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa nus pa dang ldan pa las nus pa de las phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa de myu gu la sogs pa 'grub par byed pa de'i nus pa dang 'dra bar tha dad pa yin no //
translated: That which assists the potency that generates such things as sprouts is similar to the potency that generates such things as sprouts.

original: nus pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa yang tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: nus pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa yang tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If the potency that assists the potencies is also different,

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it will not be related to them.

original: de la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa rtogs par byed na /
analyzed: de la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa rtogs par byed na /
translated: If you imagine that it assists them,

original: nus pa gzhan tha dad par thal ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa gzhan tha dad par thal ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then since another different potency would be inferred, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de nyid ni ji srid ji srid tha dad pa dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni ji srid ji srid tha dad pa dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That itself is stated as ‚Äúas long as they are different from each other,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu la yang nus pa tha dad pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang nus pa tha dad pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúEven in the effect, there is no difference in potency‚Äù meansüîΩjust as the potency that benefits the potency is itself, in the same way, the potency that is in the effect, such as the sprout, is not different from that which possesses the potency.

original: ji ltar nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de ltar myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la yang nus pa gang yin pa de nus pa dang ldan pa las tha dad pa med pa nyid nus pa yinüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de ltar myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la yang nus pa gang yin pa de nus pa dang ldan pa las tha dad pa med pa nyid nus pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is the potency.

original: de yul du gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: de yul du gyur pa yin na /
translated: If that is the object,

original: 'bras bu la rmongs zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la nus pa gang yin pa de yul du gyur pa ste bzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu la rmongs zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la nus pa gang yin pa de yul du gyur pa ste bzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äúdeluded about the effect‚Äù means that the potency that is in the effect is the object, the meaning of which is ‚Äúapprehended.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni rgyu mthong ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni rgyu mthong ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That itself is explained by ‚Äúwhen the cause is seen,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo gros chen pos zhes bya ba ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen pos zhes bya ba ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù means seeing the object that is beyond the senses.

original: ji skad du brjod ces bya ba ni brda ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod ces bya ba ni brda ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: As to what is said, it is in accordance with the conventional symbol.

original: blo ni spobs pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni spobs pa'o //
translated: The mind is the eloquence.

original: shes pa med pa na zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'gags pa na'o //
analyzed: shes pa med pa na zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'gags pa na'o //
translated: When there is no cognition, it is when the cognition has ceased.

original: rigs pa la sogs pa ni gsal byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa la sogs pa ni gsal byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason and so on are the expressive and so on.

original: mtha' gnyis chod yod dang / 'brel pa brjod pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni 'dir mtha' gnyis ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis chod yod dang / 'brel pa brjod pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni 'dir mtha' gnyis ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'o //
translated: The two extremes are the non-existence prior to and the non-existence after the destruction.

original: de la chod par byed pa ni da ltar gyi dngos po yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chod par byed pa ni da ltar gyi dngos po yod pa yin te /
translated: The existence is the present entity, which is the severance of those two.

original: 'dis de nyid la chod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis de nyid la chod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it severs those two, it is called existence.

original: mtha' gnyis chod pa yod @178b ba dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis chod pa yod @178b ba dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The existence of the severance of the two extremes is a dvandva compound.

original: 'brel pa yang nye ba'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i yod pa nyid kyi 'phrod pa 'du ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang nye ba'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i yod pa nyid kyi 'phrod pa 'du ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The connection is the proximity, and it is shown that the existence as explained is the conjunction of the connection.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgra gang la de dag brjod pa'i dang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgra gang la de dag brjod pa'i dang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the mode of expression of those words impermanence is so called.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag gis da ltar rnam par ma chod pa'i yod pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag gis da ltar rnam par ma chod pa'i yod pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: That which is not prior and not posterior is the present, which is not interrupted by that which is not existent.

original: de'i 'phrod pa 'du ba gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde nyid ni mtha' yang de yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'phrod pa 'du ba gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de nyid ni mtha' yang de yin la /
translated: Or, that which is the collection of that is to be expressed by the word impermanence.

original: gnyis kyang yin pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis kyang yin pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That itself is the end and also the two, thus it is said and so on.

original: chod pa ni chod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don brjod pa tsam du byas kyi chod pa'i sgra 'di ni byed pa bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: chod pa ni chod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don brjod pa tsam du byas kyi chod pa'i sgra 'di ni byed pa bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of interrupted is merely stated as the word interrupted, but this word interrupted is a verbal noun.

original: de ltar na yod pa nyid dang gzhi mthun par bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa nyid dang gzhi mthun par bstan te /
translated: Thus, existence is taught to be common locus.

original: da ltar dang 'brel pa can gyi chod pa yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni mtha' gnyis kyi chod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'brel pa can gyi chod pa yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni mtha' gnyis kyi chod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The characteristic of that which is related to the present is the characteristic of that which is separated from the two extremes.

original: da ltar dang 'brel ba can chod par byed pa nges mtha' de dag la chod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'brel ba can chod par byed pa nges mtha' de dag la chod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the present is that which separates from those two extremes.

original: yang na da ltar gyi mtha' gnyis gang yin pa de la chod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na da ltar gyi mtha' gnyis gang yin pa de la chod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, that which is related to the present is that which is separated from the two extremes.

original: sogs pa smos pas bdun pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid gnas pa dang / dngos po dag las mi rtag pa nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas bdun pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid gnas pa dang / dngos po dag las mi rtag pa nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the analysis of the seventh and so on, such as the statement, ‚ÄúImpermanence is a property of entities and impermanence is different from entities.‚Äù

original: mtha' de ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: mtha' de ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i smra ba'i'o //
translated: How can there be an end? This is the view of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: gal te med pa'i phyir dngos po la drug pa la sogs pa mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te med pa'i phyir dngos po la drug pa la sogs pa mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If you say that the sixth and so on are not possible because they do not exist, this is the view of the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: de yod pa nyid dam zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa nyid la sbyor ba na zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid dam zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa nyid la sbyor ba na zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat existence‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthe existence of a thing,‚Äù and ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthat which is cut off.‚Äù

original: dper na snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag la chod par byed pa yod pa nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag la chod par byed pa yod pa nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúthat which is cut off‚Äù is connected with the existence of a thing that is nonexistent before and after.

original: de dang 'brel pa'am zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid 'phrod pa 'du ba la mtha' dag gi chod par byed pa ni yod pa nyid 'phrod pa 'du ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'am zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid 'phrod pa 'du ba la mtha' dag gi chod par byed pa ni yod pa nyid 'phrod pa 'du ba 'di yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is connected with it‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthat which is cut off,‚Äù which is the existence of a thing that is present.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid la brten pa'i dngos po la snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa de dag gi bar na gnas pa da ltar ba chod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid la brten pa'i dngos po la snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa de dag gi bar na gnas pa da ltar ba chod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn other cases‚Äù refers to the existence of a thing that is present, which is cut off by the prior nonexistence and subsequent nonexistence of a thing.

original: de ltar na mtha' de dag la drug pa la sogs pa sbyor ba mthong ba gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mtha' de dag la drug pa la sogs pa sbyor ba mthong ba gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the application of the sixth case, etc., to those limits is not seen.

original: dngos po bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dngos po la dngos po med @179a * //
analyzed: dngos po bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dngos po la dngos po med @179a * //
translated: Because they are not different from things.

original: pa de tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar dngos po med pa la yang dngos po tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa de tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar dngos po med pa la yang dngos po tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as a nonthing does not exist as the cause of difference in a thing, so too a thing does not exist as the cause of difference in a nonthing.

original: gnyi ga la yang med par khyad par med pa'i phyir de bas na mtha' gnyis kyi chod pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang med par khyad par med pa'i phyir de bas na mtha' gnyis kyi chod pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so /
translated: Because they are not different in being nonexistent, therefore it is not the case that the two extremes are eliminated.

original: yang snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag la zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: yang snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag la zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdun pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the phrase ‚Äúin the case of prior nonexistence and posterior nonexistence‚Äù is the seventh characteristic of existence.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag sbyor ba byed pas na /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag sbyor ba byed pas na /
translated: Since the terms prior nonexistence and posterior nonexistence are applied,

original: de dang ldan pa las yod pa nyid dang de dang 'brel pa las drug pa la sogs pa sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa las yod pa nyid dang de dang 'brel pa las drug pa la sogs pa sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: existence is applied to that which possesses them and the sixth case is applied to that which is related to them.

original: mtha' dag la yod pa nyid dam 'phrod pa 'du ba khyad par med par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dag la yod pa nyid dam 'phrod pa 'du ba khyad par med par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: and the existence of all things would be indistinguishable, without any distinction of contact or non-contact.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no distinction, just like the entities.

original: ji ltar bum pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba med pas tha dad pa ma byas pa de ltar yod pa nyid la sogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba med pas tha dad pa ma byas pa de ltar yod pa nyid la sogs pa yang yin te /
translated: Just as the so-called impermanence of a pot is not made different by non-existence, so too is existence, etc.

original: med pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that non-existence is the same as not being the cause of difference.

original: gdon mi za bar snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid la 'dod par bya'i /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid la 'dod par bya'i /
translated: One must certainly accept the distinction of prior non-existence and post-destruction non-existence in the case of existence.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid rnam par gcod par byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid rnam par gcod par byas par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the existence of space, etc. be eliminated?

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa nyid kyi mtha' gnyis dag gis yod pa nyid du khyad par du byas pa sel bar byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa nyid kyi mtha' gnyis dag gis yod pa nyid du khyad par du byas pa sel bar byas nas /
translated: Having eliminated the distinction of existence by the two extremes accepted by others,

original: da ni dngos po'i gnas thabs nyid bsal bar bzhed nas gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni dngos po'i gnas thabs nyid bsal bar bzhed nas gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to clarify the abiding mode of entities, he says ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po la snga na med pa dag dang lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dngos po la snga na med pa dag dang lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to ‚Äúprior non-existence of entities, simultaneous,‚Äù and so on,

original: gzhan gyi thams cad du dngos po nyid ldog pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod na dngos po'i snga na med pa dngos po dang 'brel par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi thams cad du dngos po nyid ldog pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod na dngos po'i snga na med pa dngos po dang 'brel par mi 'dod do //
translated: if you assert that the non-existence of entities is the cause of the cessation of entities, then you do not assert that the prior non-existence of entities is related to entities.

original: de ltar na dngos po ni snga na med pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po ni snga na med pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would not be the case that ‚Äúentities are prior non-existents.‚Äù

original: ci ste 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i snga na med pa 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i snga na med pa 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you assert the prior non-existence of entities because you are an advocate of the existence of effects,

original: dngos po'i snga na med pa 'di yin no zhes rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis blo rnam par gzhag pa'i 'brel pa de ldog pa'i rgyu 'bras brjod pa gang gis bzlog par nus /
analyzed: dngos po'i snga na med pa 'di yin no zhes rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis blo rnam par gzhag pa'i 'brel pa de ldog pa'i rgyu 'bras brjod pa gang gis bzlog par nus /
translated: then how could you refute the relation that is the basis of the cognition ‚ÄúThis is the prior non-existence of entities‚Äù in any way?

original: de skad du rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid sgra rnams kyi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de skad du rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid sgra rnams kyi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that whatever is not the object of conceptualization is not the object of words.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'brel pa yod na yang snga na @179b med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'brel pa yod na yang snga na @179b med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Even if there were some sort of relationship, nonexistence prior to and subsequent to destruction would be impermanent.

original: don gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: don gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of imagining some other object?

original: de byed pa yang yin pa de'i phyir bum pa'i snga na med pa khas blang par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de byed pa yang yin pa de'i phyir bum pa'i snga na med pa khas blang par mi bya'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of that, the prior nonexistence of the pot should not be accepted.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: de ltar na rigs pa de dngos po snga na med pa 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs pa de dngos po snga na med pa 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, that reasoning does not accept prior nonexistence of things.

original: de'i zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i tha snyad rigs pa ma yin pa nyid la de dang lhan cig 'brel pa nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i tha snyad rigs pa ma yin pa nyid la de dang lhan cig 'brel pa nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is that the conventional expression of the ultimate is not reasonable, because it is not pervaded by the mere relationship with that.

original: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nonexistence of that in this is the nonapprehension of the pervader.

original: gang zhig snga na med pa yod pa ma yin pa de ni skye ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig snga na med pa yod pa ma yin pa de ni skye ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: That which is not existent prior to arising does not arise.

original: skye ba snga na med pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: skye ba snga na med pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: Arising is pervaded by non-existence prior to arising.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang snga na med pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //üîΩyod pa nyid dang rang gi rgyu nyid ni /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang snga na med pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // yod pa nyid dang rang gi rgyu nyid ni /
translated: And the contradiction of that is freedom from non-existence prior to arising. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.üîΩExistence and its own cause

original: yod nyid rang rgyu ste /
analyzed: yod nyid rang rgyu ste /
translated: are the existence of its cause.

original: de dang lhan cig 'bras bu 'brel par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'bras bu 'brel par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to the effect simultaneously with that.

original: de nyid ni khyed kyis ci 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni khyed kyis ci 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That very [existence] is explained by what kind of... and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is also not related, because it is permanent.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba yang gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba yang gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that contact is permanent.

original: gang med pa de byas pa yin na /
analyzed: gang med pa de byas pa yin na /
translated: If that which does not exist is produced,

original: 'bras bur 'dod pa gang yin pa snga na med pa rgyus bskyed par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bur 'dod pa gang yin pa snga na med pa rgyus bskyed par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if that which is asserted to be the effect is that which is produced by the cause, which did not exist previously.

original: de nyid ni bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: That itself is explained by ‚Äúthat which does not exist by itself,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang 'bras bu ma yin pa de ni mi rtag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu ma yin pa de ni mi rtag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second syllogism is: Whatever is not an effect is not impermanent, and so on.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la 'bras bu nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la 'bras bu nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: Impermanence is pervaded by being an effect.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of something contradictory with that is the observation of something contradictory with the pervader, which is not an effect.

original: sgra gang dag la tha dad pa med pa de ltar na /
analyzed: sgra gang dag la tha dad pa med pa de ltar na /
translated: With regard to those sounds that are not different,

original: tha dad med don mngon 'dod can //
analyzed: tha dad med don mngon 'dod can //
translated: those who desire the meaning of nondifference

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad la med par khyad par med pa yin na snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa la sogs pa dag la don tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad la med par khyad par med pa yin na snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa la sogs pa dag la don tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: say that if there is no difference in the absence of all, then there is no difference in meaning in the absence of that which did not exist previously, that which no longer exists, and so on.

original: / rgyas par zhes bya ba ni rnam par spros nas so //
analyzed: / rgyas par zhes bya ba ni rnam par spros nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn detail‚Äù means having analyzed.

original: mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'gags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par la brten pa 'di tsam nyid kyis ni spyi nyams pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa yin na yang me ma yin par bcad pa'i @180a * //
