analyzed: mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'gags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // khyad par la brten pa 'di tsam nyid kyis ni spyi nyams pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa yin na yang me ma yin par bcad pa'i @180a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is seen is ceased‚Äù means that it is momentary.

original: spyi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this much alone, the universal is not destroyed, which is based on the particular‚Äù means that even though it is related to a particular object, the universal is understood as excluding what is not fire.

original: des skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni aa ka ru'i du ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni aa ka ru'i du ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the production of that‚Äù means by the production of the smoke of agarwood, etc.

original: de ltar na aa ka ru'i du ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi spyi nyid rtogs pa'i sgo nas mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na aa ka ru'i du ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi spyi nyid rtogs pa'i sgo nas mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the universal of being a producer of the smoke of agarwood, etc. is understood through the exclusion of what is not a producer.

original: 'di nyid kyis grub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba'i shes pa'i yul gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis grub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba'i shes pa'i yul gyi sgo nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is established by this alone‚Äù means that it is established by the object of the cognition that sees the particular.

original: mthong ba zhes bya 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa yul nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa yul nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the explanation of the phrase ‚Äúthis very seeing.‚Äù

original: 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de'i yul nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de'i yul nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it exists as the very object of the cognition ‚Äúthis is it.‚Äù

original: mthong ba ba'i yul can gyi mthong ba dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mthong ba ba'i yul can gyi mthong ba dran pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The formative forces that are the memory of seeing are the cause of the cognition ‚Äúthis is it.‚Äù

original: mthong bas bsgos pa'i dran pa'i sa bon ni mthong ba dran pa'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: mthong bas bsgos pa'i dran pa'i sa bon ni mthong ba dran pa'i 'du byed do //
translated: The seed of memory that is imbued by seeing is the formative forces that are the memory of seeing.

original: de yang nyams su myong ba'i yul la dran pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i yul can zhes brjod do //üîΩde'i yang skyon bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: de yang nyams su myong ba'i yul la dran pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i yul can zhes brjod do // de'i yang skyon bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa yin na /
translated: And because it generates memory of the experienced object, it is said to have the object of seeing.üîΩThe error of that has already been explained.

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes so /
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes so /
translated: If they are different in nature, the cognition ‚Äúthat is this‚Äù would be erroneous.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel ba bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel ba bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gsum pa /
translated: Thirty-five

original: mngon sum cig shos la gcig phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum cig shos la gcig phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The other direct perception is for the sake of the one.

original: mngon sum ni gang sngar mthong ba yin la ;
analyzed: mngon sum ni gang sngar mthong ba yin la ;
translated: With respect to the passage, ‚ÄúDirect perception is that which was seen previously,‚Äù

original: cig shos ni gang phyis de nyid 'di yin no zhes khyad par mthong ba'i sgo nas gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni gang phyis de nyid 'di yin no zhes khyad par mthong ba'i sgo nas gzung ba yin te /
translated: the other is that which is apprehended later through the perception of the difference, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is just that.‚Äù

analyzed: gcig la grub pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga la yang yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúWhatever is established for one is established for both‚Äù is that.

original: tshul gsum med pa'i phyir ra zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba la khyad par gyi sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: tshul gsum med pa'i phyir ra zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba la khyad par gyi sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the trimodal condition does not exist‚Äù means that if the perception of the difference does not have concomitance through the difference,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med na yang gang las tshul gsum nyid yin /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med na yang gang las tshul gsum nyid yin /
translated: then, even if there is no concomitance, from what would the trimodal condition be?üîΩ‚ÄúThrough seeing the object, etc., and through mentioning what is familiar‚Äù is an

original: yul la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'dris pa kun brjod pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'dris pa kun brjod pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: etymology of the word ‚ÄúanumƒÅna.‚Äù

original: yul la sogs pa de ni de'i ma 'khrul pa'i rtags kyang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i yul la sogs pa'i sgo nas skye bar phyir de ni ngo shes pa nyid kyi rtags ma yin la //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa de ni de'i ma 'khrul pa'i rtags kyang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i yul la sogs pa'i sgo nas skye bar phyir de ni ngo shes pa nyid kyi rtags ma yin la //
translated: That is to say, memory also arises by way of the object, etc., as explained. Therefore, it is not the sign of recognition.

original: de bas na dran pa yang la lar gyi phyi rol la ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na dran pa yang la lar gyi phyi rol la ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because memory arises in some cases in dependence on the external,

original: de la yang na yul la sogs pa de ni de'i ma 'khrul pa'i rtags kyang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa dran pa med par yang la lar @180b mthun pa'i 'bad rtsol gyi ngo shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang na yul la sogs pa de ni de'i ma 'khrul pa'i rtags kyang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa dran pa med par yang la lar @180b mthun pa'i 'bad rtsol gyi ngo shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and in some cases that object, etc. are not even the sign of its non-error. That is to say, recognition arises in some cases without memory of the object, etc., because of the effort to conform.

original: de bas na dran pa la yang phyi dang nang gi rgyu mtshan la ltos pa de yod pa de ltar na ngo shes pa la dran pa nyid 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dran pa la yang phyi dang nang gi rgyu mtshan la ltos pa de yod pa de ltar na ngo shes pa la dran pa nyid 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, memory also depends on the internal and external reasons. As such, there is no contradiction in recognition being memory.

original: de'i phyir gal te sngar bshad pa dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te sngar bshad pa dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if you remember what was said earlier, then this is a mistake.

original: mtshan gzhi bstan to zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ni mtshon par bya ba'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi bstan to zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ni mtshon par bya ba'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of the characteristic has been taught, because direct perception is the very basis of what is to be characterized.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba can zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon sum mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba can zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon sum mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is characterized by direct perception, because it is characterized by the characteristic of being free from conceptual thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtog pa dang bral ba nyid bstan nas mngon sum nyid ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtog pa dang bral ba nyid bstan nas mngon sum nyid ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, having taught freedom from conceptual thought, he teaches direct perception.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa ni mngon sum gyi ming can yin no zhes ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa byad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa ni mngon sum gyi ming can yin no zhes ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa byad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he teaches the connection between the name and the bearer of the name, saying that a cognition free from conceptual thought is called direct perception.

original: rtog pa las bral ba zhes bya ba ni bye ba dang bral ba dang / grol ba zhes bya bas lnga pa de'i skyes bu yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa las bral ba zhes bya ba ni bye ba dang bral ba dang / grol ba zhes bya bas lnga pa de'i skyes bu yin te /
translated: Free from conceptual thought means free from conceptual differentiation, free from conceptual multiplicity, and free from conceptual bondage. These are the five aspects of the person who is free from conceptual thought.

original: bral zhing bye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bral zhing bye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of free and differentiated.

original: 'di la rtog pa dang bral ba can zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rtog pa dang bral ba can zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: The compound ‚Äúfree from conceptual differentiation‚Äù is a bahuvrƒ´hi compound.

original: rtog pas bral ba zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pas bral ba zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The compound ‚Äúfree from conceptual differentiation‚Äù is a t·πõtiya compound.

original: so so rang gis rig bya yin //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig bya yin //
translated: It is to be personally experienced.

original: zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rang gi gzhung las bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rang gi gzhung las bstan to //
translated: This is taught in our scriptures, following the knowledge of the wise.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung gis yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung gis yin te /
translated: By another cognition means by the scriptures of others.

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyis shes pa nyams su myong bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyis shes pa nyams su myong bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because others desire to experience the knowledge of others.

original: gang gi tshe sgra las rnam par rtog pa skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra las rnam par rtog pa skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: When a conceptual differentiation arises from a word, then

original: gang la ming gi rten yod pa zhes bya ba don gzhan ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la ming gi rten yod pa zhes bya ba don gzhan ston pa yin no //
translated: it is a word that has a referent, which is to say, it is a word that has another referent.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa las sgra skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa las sgra skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: When a word arises from a conceptual differentiation, then

analyzed: ming gi rten zhes bya ba drug pa'i de'i skyes bu yin no //
translated: it is a word that has a name, which is to say, it is a word that has a name as its referent.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that kind of transformation?

original: rnam par rtog pa brjod pa dang 'drer rung pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa brjod pa dang 'drer rung pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúsuitable for being mixed with verbalization‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyi'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyi'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúhaving a general aspect of conceptualization‚Äù means the inclusive object.

original: spyi'i rnam pa kho na brjod pa la 'drer rung ba snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa kho na brjod pa la 'drer rung ba snang ba yin gyi /
translated: Only the general aspect is expressed, and it appears as suitable for being mixed with verbalization.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the aspect of the particular intrinsic identity.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the characteristic of the conceptualization that immediately precedes it.

original: mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba la ste gnyis su snang ba nyid yin na yang brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba la ste gnyis su snang ba nyid yin na yang brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the seeing‚Äù means in the experience. Even though there is the appearance of duality, there is no appearance of the verbalization that is suitable for being mixed with it.

original: 'dis med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'dis med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context for saying that it does not establish nonexistence.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù means in the Ascertainment of Valid Knowledge.

original: @181a * // de phyir de las khyad par can //
analyzed: @181a * // de phyir de las khyad par can //
translated: Therefore, it is superior to that.

original: dmigs pa de yang dmigs med yin //
analyzed: dmigs pa de yang dmigs med yin //
translated: That object is also nonapprehended.

original: de phyir mi dmigs pa 'di ni //
analyzed: de phyir mi dmigs pa 'di ni //
translated: Therefore, this non-apprehension

original: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin //
translated: is established by direct perception.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpyad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpyad zin to //
translated: This has been analyzed in detail.

original: mig gi blo nyid la nye bar btags nas mig ces brjod do //
analyzed: mig gi blo nyid la nye bar btags nas mig ces brjod do //
translated: The eye is designated in relation to the eye consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi zhes bya ba de'i rnam par 'grel pa ni mig gi dbang po'i blo gang yin pas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi zhes bya ba de'i rnam par 'grel pa ni mig gi dbang po'i blo gang yin pas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúby the eye‚Äù is explained as ‚Äúby the consciousness of the eye faculty.‚Äù

original: yang na mig gis zhes bya ba de nyid ni byed pa'i gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mig gis zhes bya ba de nyid ni byed pa'i gsum pa yin te /
translated: Or, the phrase ‚Äúby the eye‚Äù itself is the third case, the instrumental.

original: mig gi dbang po'i blo gang yin pas zhes bya ba de khong nas phyung nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i blo gang yin pas zhes bya ba de khong nas phyung nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the consciousness of the eye faculty‚Äù is extracted from the above phrase.

original: mig byed par gyur pa'i sgo nas mig gi dbang po'i blo gang gis gzugs la lta ba de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: mig byed par gyur pa'i sgo nas mig gi dbang po'i blo gang gis gzugs la lta ba de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is this: The eye consciousness, which sees visible form by means of the eye as its dominant condition, is the consciousness that arises from the eye faculty.

original: yang cung zad cig rnam par rtog pa /
analyzed: yang cung zad cig rnam par rtog pa /
translated: Now, a little bit of speculation.

original: kho bo'i rnam rtog de 'drar 'gyur //
analyzed: kho bo'i rnam rtog de 'drar 'gyur //
translated: My speculation is as follows.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi gnas skabs 'das pa dran par byed pa na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi gnas skabs 'das pa dran par byed pa na /
translated: In such passages, when one recalls the past state of the mind,

original: gnas skabs gang gis rnam par rtog pa skye ba de'i tshe kho bo'i rnam par rtog pa de 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bya ba de lta bu dran pa'i shes pas rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang gis rnam par rtog pa skye ba de'i tshe kho bo'i rnam par rtog pa de 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bya ba de lta bu dran pa'i shes pas rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: one knows through the knowledge of memory, ‚ÄúWhen such and such a state of mind arose, at that time my thought was of such and such a kind.‚Äù

original: de bas na rtog pa rang gis rig pa dang ji ltar rig pa bzhin du dran pa yin no zhes rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa rang gis rig pa dang ji ltar rig pa bzhin du dran pa yin no zhes rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one thinks, ‚ÄúI know the thought by myself, and I remember it as I have known it,‚Äù

original: nyams su ma myong ba dran pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba dran pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to remember what has not been experienced.

original: nyams su myong ba yang rang rig pas yin gyi /üîΩshes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yang rang rig pas yin gyi / shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And the experience is by means of reflexive awareness,

original: thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: not by means of another cognition, because that would lead to an infinite regress.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: If it were the state of the collection of thoughts,

original: dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de la yang rig pa dang ji ltar rig pa bzhin du dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de la yang rig pa dang ji ltar rig pa bzhin du dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: And with regard to the conceptual cognition of the sense perception, there is memory in accordance with the awareness and in accordance with the cognition.

original: de nyid ni de gal te dbang po'i shes pa de yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni de gal te dbang po'i shes pa de yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If that itself were the sense perception, he says,

original: sngar yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na yang rig pa dang de'i nus pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi dran pas nges par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: sngar yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na yang rig pa dang de'i nus pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi dran pas nges par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If it were the case that there is ascertainment by the memory that has the nature of awareness and the potentiality of that, even in the case of the collection of conceptual cognitions,

original: sngar bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas bzlog pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: sngar bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas bzlog pa ston par byed do //
translated: he shows the refutation by the words ‚Äúpreviously explained‚Äù and so on.

original: sngar bshad gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: sngar bshad gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the words ‚Äúin the previous context‚Äù is

original: rnam par rtog pa bsdus pas gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bsdus pas gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the context of the collection of conceptual cognitions.

original: de'i ming de dang 'dres pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni gang la sgra sbyor ba'i don de'i ming de dang 'dres pas yul du gyur pa 'dzin par 'dod @181b pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: de'i ming de dang 'dres pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni gang la sgra sbyor ba'i don de'i ming de dang 'dres pas yul du gyur pa 'dzin par 'dod @181b pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur na'o //
translated: If the consciousness that is mixed with the name of that object were to apprehend it, then the consciousness that is asserted to apprehend the object that is mixed with the name of that object to which the word is applied would apprehend it.

original: don sgra ma sbyar ba can brjod pa dang 'dres pa gzung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don sgra ma sbyar ba can brjod pa dang 'dres pa gzung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to apprehend an object that is not mixed with the expression of a word.

original: 'di sbyor ba yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di sbyor ba yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: If this were the case, then the word would be applied to it.

original: 'gyur ba ni 'dod mod kyi spyi dngos por gyur pa ste yod pa de yang dbang po'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba yin na de la yang sgra dgod pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa brjod pa dang 'dres pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni 'dod mod kyi spyi dngos por gyur pa ste yod pa de yang dbang po'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba yin na de la yang sgra dgod pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa brjod pa dang 'dres pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Although it is asserted that the universal would be the object of the word, if the universal were an existent thing and were apprehended by a sense consciousness, then the sense consciousness would be mixed with the expression of the word that designates it.

original: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god pa ma yin pas na 'di grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god pa ma yin pas na 'di grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Since the word is not applied to the particular, this is a proof of what is already established.

original: de'i phyir spyi la sgra 'god pa khas len pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi la sgra 'god pa khas len pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven one who accepts that a word is applied to a universal,‚Äù etc.

original: snga ma nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩkhyad par gcig la mthong ba ni //
analyzed: snga ma nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / khyad par gcig la mthong ba ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThe former position is established‚Äù is the position

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe seeing of one particular,‚Äù etc.

original: mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i sgra'i don zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i sgra'i don zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word that appears in a seeing consciousness‚Äù means that which appears in an experienced consciousness,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the meaning of ‚Äúhaving the nature of a particular‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúhaving the nature of a particular.‚Äù

original: de dag la sbyor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i sgra'i don la sbyor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: de dag la sbyor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i sgra'i don la sbyor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not applied to that‚Äù means that they are not applied to the meaning of a word that appears in a seeing consciousness.

original: so sor nges pa'i yul can nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pas na'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i yul can nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are the subjects of determinate objects‚Äù means because they are the subjects of particulars.

original: de dag la 'brel pa shes pa med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'brel pa shes pa med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the intrinsic identity does not appear in the cognition that has the nature of analysis.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni don gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni don gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the object.

original: rta'i sgra dang don dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rta'i sgra dang don dag ces bya ba la /
translated: The word ‚Äúhorse‚Äù and the object,

original: rta'i sgra dang don dag ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rta'i sgra dang don dag ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúhorse‚Äù and the object are a compound.

original: don gsal bar snang ba can zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba can no //
analyzed: don gsal bar snang ba can zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba can no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the appearance of the object‚Äù means having the appearance.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no convention in regard to the intrinsic identity, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid smos pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid smos pa la /
translated: Even though the object is beyond what is seen and heard,

original: mthong ba dang thos pa las 'das pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba mthong ba las 'das pa dang / rjod par byed pa thos pa las 'das pa yin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa las 'das pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba mthong ba las 'das pa dang / rjod par byed pa thos pa las 'das pa yin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the object is beyond what is seen and heard‚Äù means that the object is beyond what is seen, which is the expressed, and the word is beyond what is heard, which is the expresser.

original: gang gi tshe don gzhan zhig dmigs pa na ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe don gzhan zhig dmigs pa na ;
translated: When another object is perceived,

original: de la rjod par byed pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la rjod par byed pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one applies the terms that express those objects,

original: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa rtogs pa med par phyis bdag nyid rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig gis nye bar mtshon nas sgra dang don 'das pa dag gi 'brel pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa rtogs pa med par phyis bdag nyid rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig gis nye bar mtshon nas sgra dang don 'das pa dag gi 'brel pa med pa yin na /
translated: if one does not understand the relationship between the terms and their referents, later, for some reason, one might be reminded of the past terms and referents, but there would be no relationship between them.

original: de la gang las rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba yin zhing gang gis na brda byed pa @182a * //
analyzed: de la gang las rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba yin zhing gang gis na brda byed pa @182a * //
translated: In that case, what would appear to be the intrinsic character of the referent, and what would be the basis for the use of the term?

original: yin ; don nye ba la yang brda la byad pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa pos sgra'i sbyor ba tha snyad kyi don du byas pa dmigs nas don de la sngar brdar ma byas pa can skyes bu rang nyid kyis dpyad nas brda byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin ; don nye ba la yang brda la byad pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa pos sgra'i sbyor ba tha snyad kyi don du byas pa dmigs nas don de la sngar brdar ma byas pa can skyes bu rang nyid kyis dpyad nas brda byed pa'i phyir /
translated: When the referent is present, the person who uses the term observes the application of the term to the referent and, having analyzed the referent, he uses the term.

original: dpyod pa'i dus na yang rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i dus na yang rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Since at the time of analysis the intrinsic character is not seen,

original: gang gis na de la brda byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de la brda byed par 'gyur /
translated: what would be the basis for the use of the term?

original: dbang po bya ba med pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul la dbang po la sogs pa 'jug pa med pa can mun pa na gnas pas 'ga' zhig gis brda byed pa na rang nyid kyi yid kyis 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po bya ba med pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul la dbang po la sogs pa 'jug pa med pa can mun pa na gnas pas 'ga' zhig gis brda byed pa na rang nyid kyi yid kyis 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the sense faculty is not functioning‚Äù means when the sense faculty and so on are not engaged with their objects, as when one is in the dark.

original: 'dis kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la brda byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la brda byed pa ma yin no //
translated: This also does not indicate a convention that is based on an object that is an intrinsic identity.

original: mthong bzhin du sgra shes par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa de ltar sgra las byung ba'i shes pas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong bzhin du sgra shes par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa de ltar sgra las byung ba'i shes pas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it would follow that sound would be known while seeing,‚Äù means that just as the visual consciousness apprehends, so also the consciousness that arises from sound would apprehend.

original: de ltar na long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: de ltar na long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
translated: Thus, it is thought that the blind and so on would not exist.

original: /'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gal te yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba yin pa de lta na yang gsal bar snang ba dang 'brel pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: /'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gal te yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba yin pa de lta na yang gsal bar snang ba dang 'brel pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is true that [the object] is desired to be a transformation, but even if the conceptual consciousness is unclear, the object would still be just the particular that is connected with the appearance of clarity.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, [the root text] says, ‚ÄúEven when the appearances are different . . .‚Äù

original: khyad par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe differentiator‚Äù is that which posits the differences.

original: gal te mthong ba dang mnyan pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba dang mnyan pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is from seeing and hearing . . .‚Äù

original: gang zhig 'das pa de ma thag pa yin pa de lta na yang brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa mthong pa dang thos pa las 'das pa yin na yang /
analyzed: gang zhig 'das pa de ma thag pa yin pa de lta na yang brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa mthong pa dang thos pa las 'das pa yin na yang /
translated: Even if what is past is immediately preceding, the seen and the heard are past with regard to the expressed and the expresser.

original: phyis 'ga' zhig las nye bar mtshon nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de 'dis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis 'ga' zhig las nye bar mtshon nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de 'dis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLater, having been indicated by someone . . .‚Äù and so forth is what is set forth by this [root text].

original: gang gi tshe rtogs pa pos rtogs par bya ba la sogs pa la mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po bstan nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtogs pa pos rtogs par bya ba la sogs pa la mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po bstan nas /
translated: When the one who understands points out to the one who does not understand such things as the object of understanding, etc.,

original: don 'di'i rtogs par byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don 'di'i rtogs par byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which are present in front of him, he says, ‚ÄúThis is the means of understanding this object.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga la yang rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that the intrinsic identity of both is the nature of the expressed and the expresser.

original: de yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the object of the consciousness of the one who explains and the one who listens,

original: de dag gis kyang brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro // mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: because they determine the nature of the expressed and the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,

original: rna ba'i rnam par @182b shes pa'i yul ni rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no //üîΩmig gi don snang ba la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par @182b shes pa'i yul ni rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no // mig gi don snang ba la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.üîΩThe object of visual consciousness is the expressed,üîΩand the object of auditory consciousness is the nature of the expresser.

original: mig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: mig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The object of visual consciousness is the expressed,

original: de la rna ba la yang sgra'i rang bzhin snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rna ba la yang sgra'i rang bzhin snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of sound appears to the ear.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi dbang po dang rna ba'i dbang po zhes 'chad par byed do //üîΩde skad du gal te yang ji skad du bshad pa'i brda'i dus na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi dbang po dang rna ba'i dbang po zhes 'chad par byed do // de skad du gal te yang ji skad du bshad pa'i brda'i dus na /
translated: That is why the eye faculty and the ear faculty are explained.

original: mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag gis brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa de lta na yang de las phyis byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i phyir snang
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag gis brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa de lta na yang de las phyis byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i phyir snang
translated: Thus, even if the eye and ear consciousnesses apprehend the intrinsic identity of the expressed and the expresser, as explained above, the mental consciousness that arises later from that, which is the appearance of the expressed and the expresser,

original: ba can skye ba gang yin pa de ni spyi'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis brdar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ba can skye ba gang yin pa de ni spyi'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis brdar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: is the convention that apprehends the general aspect,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the intrinsic identity.

original: de nyid ni gzhan shes par byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan shes par byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúthat itself is the other‚Äôs cognition‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po bya ba med pa can zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bstan par bya ba mig 'dzums pa can no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po bya ba med pa can zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bstan par bya ba mig 'dzums pa can no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äúthe sense faculty is not operative‚Äù is ‚Äúthe object of instruction is closed.‚Äù

original: bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gang la don de brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gang la don de brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The object of instruction is that which is to be expressed.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni nye ba na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni nye ba na gnas pa'o //
translated: The other is that which is near.

original: mthong ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Like seeing means like the sense consciousness.

original: mthong ba'i sgra ni de'i nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sgra ni de'i nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word seeing is used because it illustrates that.

original: sgra dang don sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir sbyor ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang don sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir sbyor ba byed pa'o //
translated: The one who connects is the one who connects the word and the object.

original: snang ba gsal ba nyid kyi phyir mthong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba gsal ba nyid kyi phyir mthong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who causes to see is the one who causes to see because of the clarity of the appearance.

original: 'jug pa rgyun chad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rgyun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa rgyun chad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rgyun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The one who causes the continuum to arise is the one who causes the continuum to arise because the engagement is uninterrupted.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te shes pa gcig snang ba gsal ba rnam par rtog pa rgyun gyis 'byung ba mi 'dod pa de'i tshe mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te shes pa gcig snang ba gsal ba rnam par rtog pa rgyun gyis 'byung ba mi 'dod pa de'i tshe mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, that is, if one did not accept that a single cognition is the appearance of the clear, discursive thought that arises in a continuum, then seeing would be interrupted.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dus na mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dus na mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because there is no seeing at the time of discursive thought.üîΩDiscursive thought would be interrupted.

original: / rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad par 'gyur te zhes bya ba rtags rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad par 'gyur te zhes bya ba rtags rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The reason should be applied by changing the terms.

original: mthong ba'i dus na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / cig car shes pa gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dus na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / cig car shes pa gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Because there is no discursive thought at the time of seeing and because two cognitions are not possible simultaneously.

original: mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad pa de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yin pas na mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad pa de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yin pas na mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to establish that very interruption of seeing and discursive thought, he says, because it is discursive thought, it is not seeing, etc.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba la gsal bar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'dod pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yin pas na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba la gsal bar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'dod pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yin pas na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proponents of tenets do not assert that a clear appearance is a conception, therefore, because it is a conception, it is not seen.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dus na mthong ba rnam par chad pa de'i phyir @183a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dus na mthong ba rnam par chad pa de'i phyir @183a * //
translated: Because at the time of conception, seeing is interrupted,

original: mthong ba yin pas na rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba yin pas na rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: therefore, because it is seeing, it is not a conception.

original: mthong ba'i dus na rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dus na rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad pa yin no //
translated: At the time of seeing, conception is interrupted.

original: gal te mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car skye pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car skye pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because the consciousnesses of seeing and conception arise simultaneously,

original: de gnyis lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: de gnyis lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúBecause those two do not operate together.‚Äù

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag go //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose two‚Äù refers to seeing and conception.

original: snang ba tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu ni snang ba tha dad pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin tha dad du zin kyang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu ni snang ba tha dad pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin tha dad du zin kyang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even though the nature of conceptual and nonconceptual consciousnesses is different, they are not different in terms of the appearance of objects.

original: de ltar na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsal ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yin la rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'brel pa mi gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsal ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yin la rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'brel pa mi gsal ba yin na /
translated: Thus, the clarity of aspects such as blue and yellow is nonconceptual consciousness, and the connection with conceptual thought is the connection with verbal conceptualization, which is unclear.

original: shes pa gcig la sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba dang sgra'i snang ba'i skabs yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba dang sgra'i snang ba'i skabs yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In one consciousness, the appearance of blue and so on and the appearance of sound are not possible.

original: snang ba tha dad pa ni shes pa tha dad pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa ni shes pa tha dad pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference in appearance is the cause of the difference in consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, eye consciousness and ear consciousness would be the same.

original: de ma mthong bar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog par med pa dag gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ma mthong bar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog par med pa dag gi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout seeing that‚Äù refers to the difference between the conceptual and the non-conceptual.

original: gang gi tshe 'di yin pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di yin pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it is‚Äù refers to seeing.

original: ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba'i yul la mngon sum du 'jug pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba'i yul la mngon sum du 'jug pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the direct perception of a cow, etc., engages an object that is near‚Äù and so on.

original: thag nye ba'i zhes pa ni mdun na gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: thag nye ba'i zhes pa ni mdun na gnas pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNear‚Äù means in front.

original: yul la zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa shes pa skyed par rung ba ste /
analyzed: yul la zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa shes pa skyed par rung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúObject‚Äù means a cow, etc., that is suitable to produce a cognition.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa nyid yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa nyid yin par 'dod do //
translated: That engagement of direct perception, etc., is asserted to be the conceptualization of another.

original: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa de yod na ba lang la sogs pa mdun na snang ba las don gzhan gang yin pa de'i yul can de'i rigs ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa de mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba na ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa de yod na ba lang la sogs pa mdun na snang ba las don gzhan gang yin pa de'i yul can de'i rigs ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa de mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba na ste /
translated: When that engagement of direct perception exists, the object of that which has a different object from the cow, etc. that appears in front, that conceptualization of a different type, is directed toward that.

original: gang gi tshe ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba na mthong ba na gzhan 'ga' zhig la rnam par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba na mthong ba na gzhan 'ga' zhig la rnam par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one sees a cow, for example, nearby, one may think of another cow.üîΩThe meaning is that when there is a manifest conceptual thought that is not related to the nature of the object, even though the object is present,

original: don 'di rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mngon du gyur pa yod na yang zhes bya ba la don 'di zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: don 'di rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mngon du gyur pa yod na yang zhes bya ba la don 'di zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: the object is the appearance of a cow, etc.

original: ba lang @183b la sogs pa snang bar gyur pa ldog pa'i sgo nas dngos po gzhan dpyod pa gang yin pa de'i yul can rjod par byed pa de nyid don de'i rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: ba lang @183b la sogs pa snang bar gyur pa ldog pa'i sgo nas dngos po gzhan dpyod pa gang yin pa de'i yul can rjod par byed pa de nyid don de'i rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bshad de /
translated: The object of the cognition that analyzes another entity by way of the negation of the appearance of a cow, etc., is said to be the nature of the non-expression of that object.

original: don gzhan du grags pa'i brjod pa yin pas na don gzhan brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du grags pa'i brjod pa yin pas na don gzhan brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the expression of an object known elsewhere, it is not the expression of another object.

original: rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo de dang rjes su 'brel cing rjes su bsgyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gang yin pa de mngon du gyur pa yod na ste /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo de dang rjes su 'brel cing rjes su bsgyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gang yin pa de mngon du gyur pa yod na ste /
translated: When there is the manifestation of another conceptual thought that is related to and transformed by that inexpressible nature,

original: gang gi chos dngos po snang bar gyur pa'i rjod par byed pa bor nas /
analyzed: gang gi chos dngos po snang bar gyur pa'i rjod par byed pa bor nas /
translated: then, having abandoned the expression of the thing that is the object of that conceptual thought,

original: rjod par byed pa gzhan gyis dngos po gzhan gcod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa gzhan gyis dngos po gzhan gcod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is said that another expression eliminates another thing.

original: gzhung 'dis ni rigs tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhung 'dis ni rigs tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This passage clarifies the meaning of ‚Äúthe manifestation of conceptual thoughts of different types.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi yul gzhan la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs 'dir da ltar gyi yul 'dzin pa'i dang tshul can ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul gzhan la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs 'dir da ltar gyi yul 'dzin pa'i dang tshul can ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin
translated: In this situation, when the conceptual thought that is the basis of the other‚Äôs object manifests, the conceptual consciousness that engages the cow that is the object of the present mode of apprehension, which is nearby,

original: pa de yang dngos po mthong bar khas len pa yin te /
analyzed: pa de yang dngos po mthong bar khas len pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, you accept that you see things,

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid mthong ba nyid yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid mthong ba nyid yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that you see just the conceptualization.

original: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa de /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa de /
translated: That is not direct perception,

original: ji ltar min gzhan gyi yang chod pa ma yin rnam pa gnyis ni cig car yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar min gzhan gyi yang chod pa ma yin rnam pa gnyis ni cig car yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because the two aspects do not exist simultaneously.

original: de bas na don gzhan la rten yod kyi rnam par rtog pa yod na mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po la mthong ba rnam par chad pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na don gzhan la rten yod kyi rnam par rtog pa yod na mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po la mthong ba rnam par chad pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when there is conceptualization, the seeing of the object that is in front of you is not interrupted.

original: de nyid ni chod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni chod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúeven when it is obstructed.‚Äù

original: des stong pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni mthong bas stong pa na'o //
analyzed: des stong pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni mthong bas stong pa na'o //
translated: When it is empty of that means when it is empty of seeing.

original: de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dag gi'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dag gi'o //
translated: The two means the two seeings.

original: de'i mtshams sbyor ba'i bar chad byed pa'am zhes bya ba ni mthong ba de dag 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshams sbyor ba'i bar chad byed pa'am zhes bya ba ni mthong ba de dag 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: The obstruction that interrupts them means the obstruction that destroys those seeings.

original: rgyun gyis mthong ba rgyun gyis 'byung ba rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis mthong ba rgyun gyis 'byung ba rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that one realizes the arising of the vision of the stream.

original: dbus na gnas pa'am mthong ba med pas mthong ba gnyis pa nye bar bcom pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: dbus na gnas pa'am mthong ba med pas mthong ba gnyis pa nye bar bcom pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the second vision is destroyed by the absence of a middle or end,

original: lhan cig skye ba thob pa ma yin na gang las mthong ba dag gi mtshams sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba thob pa ma yin na gang las mthong ba dag gi mtshams sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: then since the innate is not attained, from what is the connection of the visions?

original: de'i phyir mthong ba la gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba la gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is harmful to the vision.‚Äù

original: mthong ba nyid skye ba la gags bya ba'i phyir nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid skye ba la gags bya ba'i phyir nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible for the vision itself to arise because it is obstructed.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong bzhin no //üîΩ@184a * // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong bzhin no // @184a * // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the circle of a whirling firebrand.

original: mgal dum rgyun mi 'chad par bskor ba ni mgal me'i 'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: mgal dum rgyun mi 'chad par bskor ba ni mgal me'i 'khor lo yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the circle of a whirling firebrand is a firebrand that is continuously turned.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo'i cha la snga ma'i mthar gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo'i cha la snga ma'i mthar gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The eye consciousness arises in succession to the parts of the circle of a whirling firebrand.

original: de dag gi mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it connects them,

original: phyis yid 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul pa yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: phyis yid 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul pa yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: Others think that the error is in the form of a wheel.

original: de nyid ni dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo'i chas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo'i chas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: This is indicated by the example of the circle of fire produced by a whirling firebrand.

original: mtshams sbyor ba yang mthong ba las ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gal te mtshams sbyor ba mthong bas byas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mthong bas yul gsal por yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba yang mthong ba las ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gal te mtshams sbyor ba mthong bas byas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mthong bas yul gsal por yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: Nor is the connection of the two moments of consciousness established by direct perception, because the object of direct perception is clearly defined.

original: ji ltar yongs su gcod pa bzhin du 'khor lo'i rnam pa'i mtshams sbyor ba yang gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su gcod pa bzhin du 'khor lo'i rnam pa'i mtshams sbyor ba yang gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the connection of the two moments of consciousness were established by direct perception, then the connection of the two moments of consciousness in the form of a wheel would be clearly defined, just as the clearly defined object is.

original: 'di ltar mtshams sbyor ba mthong bas byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshams sbyor ba mthong bas byas pa ma yin te /
translated: But the connection of the two moments of consciousness is not established by direct perception,

original: de'i yul nye ba can nyid yin pas snga phyi'i mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul nye ba can nyid yin pas snga phyi'i mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of direct perception is near at hand and is devoid of the capacity to connect the prior and subsequent moments of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang dran pas mtshams sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dran pas mtshams sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: However, the connection is established by memory.

original: gal te de ltar yang 'gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yang 'gyur mod ce na /
translated: If you say that this is so, then what follows?

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdran pa 'di yang yul du byas pa la mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dran pa 'di yang yul du byas pa la mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThis memory, etc.‚Äù

original: yul du ma byas pa la mtshams sbyor bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul du ma byas pa la mtshams sbyor bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This memory also connects with the object that is made present, because it is not possible to connect with the object that is not made present.

original: de lta ma yin na thal ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thal ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an overextension of the rule.

original: gsal ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba gsal bar snang ba nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba gsal bar snang ba nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a clear image, because it is contradictory for the appearance of conceptual thought to appear as a clear image.

original: mthong ba'i yul bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dpe yin no //
translated: Like the object of seeing, this is an example that has a dissimilar property.

original: des na mthong ba dang dran pa'i yul dag gi rgyu gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyis dran pa'i yul dang mthong ba'i yul la mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na mthong ba dang dran pa'i yul dag gi rgyu gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyis dran pa'i yul dang mthong ba'i yul la mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the object of memory and the object of seeing are connected by the cause of the clear image and the unclear image, respectively.

original: 'khor los snang ba yongs su gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khor los snang ba yongs su gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The wheel does not make the light appear clearly.

original: 'on kyang rim gyis gsal ba dang mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rim gyis gsal ba dang mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, they gradually become clear and unclear.

original: de nyid ni de dag gi rnam pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la de dag ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang dran pa dag ni'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni de dag gi rnam pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la de dag ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang dran pa dag ni'o //
translated: Because they are the very different aspects of those.

original: gal te 'khor lo'i snang ba gnyi ga'i rnam pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'khor lo'i snang ba gnyi ga'i rnam pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the appearance of the wheel has the aspect of both,

original: de bzhin du myur du mthong ba 'jug pa dang chu'i thigs pa 'thigs pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du myur du mthong ba 'jug pa dang chu'i thigs pa 'thigs pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the appearance of a swift river and the dripping of water, etc.

original: myur du mthong ba la 'jug pa dang chu'i thigs pa @184b 'thigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: myur du mthong ba la 'jug pa dang chu'i thigs pa @184b 'thigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The swift appearance of a river and the dripping of water, etc. are a contrast.

original: de ltar na ka ba la sogs pa rim pa bzhin du gnas pa dag la gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na ka ba la sogs pa rim pa bzhin du gnas pa dag la gang gi tshe /
translated: Thus, when pillars, etc. are arranged in sequence,

original: mthong ba myur du 'jug pa na de la myur du 'jug pa nyid dang chu'i thigs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa na yang myur du 'jug pa nyid yod pa de bas na sngon po la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la gcig tu 'dzin pa'i
analyzed: mthong ba myur du 'jug pa na de la myur du 'jug pa nyid dang chu'i thigs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa na yang myur du 'jug pa nyid yod pa de bas na sngon po la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la gcig tu 'dzin pa'i
translated: When it quickly engages its object, it quickly engages it. When it engages its object without interruption, it quickly engages it. Therefore, it is the case that one conceives of blue, etc., as one.

original: zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: One conceives of them as one.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Moreover, the root text declares,üîΩThe faculties are the six that are in contact with the mind.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúif they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.

original: dbang rnams zhes bya ba de ni mdo'i tshig yid la thug pa'i drug po rnams dang zhes bya ba 'di dang spel mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang rnams zhes bya ba de ni mdo'i tshig yid la thug pa'i drug po rnams dang zhes bya ba 'di dang spel mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.

original: yod na yang zhes bya ba de ni mdo'i tshig yin no //üîΩphyis kyi nye bar bkod nas yod na yang ste /
analyzed: yod na yang zhes bya ba de ni mdo'i tshig yin no // phyis kyi nye bar bkod nas yod na yang ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.

original: yod par gyur na'o zhes bya ba 'dis 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩspyod yul du gyur pa'i rang gi yul can rnams so zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi yul can rnams so //
analyzed: yod par gyur na'o zhes bya ba 'dis 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩspyod yul du gyur pa'i rang gi yul can rnams so zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi yul can rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though they exist‚Äù is from the s≈´tra.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äú

original: da ltar gyi yul can de yang yid kyi dbang po la bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul can de yang yid kyi dbang po la bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The present subject is not the mental faculty,

original: yid kyi dbang po de ni da ltar gyi yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po de ni da ltar gyi yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that mental faculty is not the subject of the present object.

original: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid ni dngos su yul gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid ni dngos su yul gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the conceptual mind does not directly grasp the intrinsic nature of the object, but rather it engages the object by following the sense consciousness.

original: dbang pos nyams su myong ba yang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyi tshe 'jig pa yin pa de bas na yid ni nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang pos nyams su myong ba yang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyi tshe 'jig pa yin pa de bas na yid ni nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the experience by the sense faculty is momentary, it ceases at that very moment. Therefore, the mind does not cognize the experience.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu da ltar gyi yul can nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu da ltar gyi yul can nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not always the subject of the present object.

original: 'o na ji ltar na yid la thug pa zhes brjod ce na skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na yid la thug pa zhes brjod ce na skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, why is it called the mind that is in contact?

original: 'di ltar da ltar gyi yul can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yid smos pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar gyi yul can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yid smos pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This fault does not exist, because the mind is not mentioned in order to teach that it is the subject of the present object.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar dbang po lnga da ltar gyi yul la 'jug pa de ltar yid kyang rad dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul la 'jug pa de bstan pa'i phyir yid la thug pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar dbang po lnga da ltar gyi yul la 'jug pa de ltar yid kyang rad dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul la 'jug pa de bstan pa'i phyir yid la thug pa zhes smos so //
translated: However, in order to show that the mental faculty engages its object in the same way that the five sense faculties engage their objects, he says, ‚Äúin contact with the mental faculty.‚Äù

original: da ltar gyi yul can nyid kyang dbang po lnga la ltos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul can nyid kyang dbang po lnga la ltos pa nyid yin no //
translated: And the fact that it has a present object is due to the five sense faculties.

original: gnas skabs gang la yang dbang po don thams cad cig car 'dus pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la yang dbang po don thams cad cig car 'dus pa can yin zhe na /
translated: In what state do all the sense faculties come together with their objects?

original: de'i phyir de de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúWhen one is in that state . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: cung zhig sems par byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: cung zhig sems par byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen one is thinking a little‚Äù

original: yid kyang rang gi yul la 'jug par ston par byed do //üîΩrnam par shes pa lnga po rnams kyis chod na yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa cig car ma yin par smra ba'i rnam par shes pa drug rim @185a * //
analyzed: yid kyang rang gi yul la 'jug par ston par byed do // rnam par shes pa lnga po rnams kyis chod na yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa cig car ma yin par smra ba'i rnam par shes pa drug rim @185a * //
translated: shows that the mental faculty also engages its object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven when the five consciousnesses are interrupted‚Äù

original: bzhin du skye ba na rnam par shes pa re re la lda po dag gis chod pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin du skye ba na rnam par shes pa re re la lda po dag gis chod pa yin no //
translated: refers to the six consciousnesses that arise in sequence, not simultaneously, as maintained by the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas. Each of the five sense consciousnesses is interrupted by the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan 'jug pa med na zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dis rgyun mi 'chad par yi ge 'dzin pa zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan 'jug pa med na zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dis rgyun mi 'chad par yi ge 'dzin pa zhes mi brjod do //
translated: If another consciousness does not enter, then one cannot say that this consciousness of the eye, etc. holds the letters without interruption.

original: yi ge'i shes pa de chod pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i shes pa de chod pa yin no //
translated: The consciousness of the letters is interrupted.

original: ming gi mthar thug pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba la yi ge gcig ni ming gi mthar thug pa'i yi ge yin la /
analyzed: ming gi mthar thug pa'i yi ge zhes bya ba la yi ge gcig ni ming gi mthar thug pa'i yi ge yin la /
translated: The letters are the ultimate constituents of the name. One letter is the ultimate constituent of the name.

original: de tsam 'dzin par byed pa ni shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam 'dzin par byed pa ni shes pa yin te /
translated: The consciousness that holds just that is the consciousness of the name.üîΩBecause the consciousnesses of the individual letters are different.üîΩThe consciousness of the name is the consciousness that holds the letters in combination.

original: yi ge so so'i shes pa tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyi ge 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni yi ge 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can 'dres par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge so so'i shes pa tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // yi ge 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni yi ge 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can 'dres par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gal te yi ge gcig 'dzin pa'i shes pa dus gzhan du gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe yi ge gzhan 'dzin pa'i shes pa dus gzhan gyis chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yi ge gcig 'dzin pa'i shes pa dus gzhan du gnas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe yi ge gzhan 'dzin pa'i shes pa dus gzhan gyis chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the consciousness apprehending one letter were to endure for another moment, then the consciousness apprehending another letter would be interrupted by another moment.

original: bar med pa ni rnam par shes pa rigs mi mthun pas ma chod pa yin te rnam par shes pa drug gi nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bar med pa ni rnam par shes pa rigs mi mthun pas ma chod pa yin te rnam par shes pa drug gi nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Without interval means not interrupted by a different type of consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi nang nas gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa gcig rang gi yul la dus ji srid cig rgyun 'byung bas 'jug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi nang nas gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa gcig rang gi yul la dus ji srid cig rgyun 'byung bas 'jug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From among the six consciousnesses means that when one consciousness, from among the six consciousnesses of eye and so on, engages its object for as long as it endures, then the other five consciousnesses are not active.

original: de ltar na gal te rnam par shes pa cig car skye bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te rnam par shes pa cig car skye bar mi 'dod na /
translated: Thus, if you do not assert that consciousness arises simultaneously,

original: bar dang bcas pa dang / bar med pa snang ba tha dad par 'gyur na /üîΩsnang ba tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bar dang bcas pa dang / bar med pa snang ba tha dad par 'gyur na / snang ba tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then with and without interval would be different appearances.

original: dngos po gnyi ga'i yad bar med par snang ba mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gnyi ga'i yad bar med par snang ba mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But different appearances do not exist because the appearance of both things is the same without interval.

original: skra'i rtse mo la sogs pas bskyed pa la zhes bya ba ni yan lag shin tu phra bas kyang chod pa la /
analyzed: skra'i rtse mo la sogs pas bskyed pa la zhes bya ba ni yan lag shin tu phra bas kyang chod pa la /
translated: The phrase produced by the tip of a hair, etc. refers to the fact that the object is cut off by a very small part.

original: chod pa dang ma chod pa'i snang ba tha dad par mthong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chod pa dang ma chod pa'i snang ba tha dad par mthong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase the appearance of the object as cut off or uncut is seen as different explains that.

original: cig car rnam par shes pa 'jug par khas len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi rgol ba dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: cig car rnam par shes pa 'jug par khas len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi rgol ba dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: The phrase if you accept that consciousness operates all at once, etc. anticipates an objection from the opponent.

original: yul gzhan gyi chod pa ni de la chags pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan gyi chod pa ni de la chags pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase the object is cut off by another means that the object is separated from that part.

original: gtan tshigs de bas na don rnam par nges pa 'ga' zhig gi gnas skabs 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de bas na don rnam par nges pa 'ga' zhig gi gnas skabs 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase therefore, the state of the ascertainment of an object is not apprehended means that.

original: rtag tu don nye bar thams cad 'dzin par thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya @185b pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtag tu don nye bar thams cad 'dzin par thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya @185b pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase it would always be apprehended means that it would always be apprehended as present.
