original: gal te rnam par shes pa cig car skye bar smra ba'i yid yul gcig la chags pa yin pa de lta na yang yul gzhan la rnam par shes pa gzhan yul gyi stobs kyis skye ba gang gis bzlog par nus /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa cig car skye bar smra ba'i yid yul gcig la chags pa yin pa de lta na yang yul gzhan la rnam par shes pa gzhan yul gyi stobs kyis skye ba gang gis bzlog par nus /
translated: But even if the mind that is said to be simultaneously generated is attached to one object, how could another consciousness be stopped from being generated by the power of the object?

original: gal te rim bzhin du smra ba la ji ltar na skyon 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rim bzhin du smra ba la ji ltar na skyon 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind is sequentially generated, how could this fault not arise?

original: gang gi cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gang gi cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf the mind is attached to another object, how could it be attached to one object?‚Äù

original: gal te yid rtog pa dang bcas pa yul gzhan la chags pa med pa de lta na yang dbang po'i shes pa rang gi yul la ci'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde ltar rnam par rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yid rtog pa dang bcas pa yul gzhan la chags pa med pa de lta na yang dbang po'i shes pa rang gi yul la ci'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na / de ltar rnam par rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the mind that possesses conception is not attached to another object, then why would a sense consciousness not engage its object?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúEven if consciousness is conception, it is the cause of a sense consciousness.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa yin na yang dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa yin na yang dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: Even if consciousness is conception, it is the cause of a sense consciousness.

original: de yang yul gzhan la chags pas nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang yul gzhan la chags pas nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: And since it is not able to be attached to another object, it is not able to be attached to its own object.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bral bas na yul gzhan la yang shes pa gzhan skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bral bas na yul gzhan la yang shes pa gzhan skye ba ma yin no //
translated: And because it is free from the condition of immediate antecedent, consciousness does not arise in regard to another object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin gsungs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin gsungs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For this very reason, it is said to be in accordance with the conditions.

original: lnga rnams rtsa ba'i rnam shes las //
analyzed: lnga rnams rtsa ba'i rnam shes las //
translated: The five arise from the fundamental consciousness,

original: ji lta'i rkyen las 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: ji lta'i rkyen las 'byung ba ni //
translated: in accordance with the conditions.

original: rnam shes lhan cig gam ma yin //
analyzed: rnam shes lhan cig gam ma yin //
translated: Consciousness arises together with or without

original: chu las rlabs rnams ji bzhin no //üîΩzhes gsungs so //üîΩmgal me la sogs zhes bya ba ni las kyi drug pa yin te /
analyzed: chu las rlabs rnams ji bzhin no // zhes gsungs so // mgal me la sogs zhes bya ba ni las kyi drug pa yin te /
translated: the eye, just as waves do in relation to the ocean.üîΩThe suffix ‚Äúka‚Äù in ‚Äúcak·π£ur-anugam‚Äù indicates the sixth case,

original: mgal me la sogs pa myur du 'jug pa la mig gi rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mgal me la sogs pa myur du 'jug pa la mig gi rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is ‚Äúin relation to the eye.‚ÄùüîΩFor this very reason, it is said to be the ‚Äúprojector‚Äù of the eye that is situated in a suitable place,

original: de nyid kyi phyir yul rung ba na gnas par byed pa der 'phen par byed pa zhes bya ba ni mgal me la sogs pas bskor bar bya ba yul rung ba na gnas pa la mig gis 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yul rung ba na gnas par byed pa der 'phen par byed pa zhes bya ba ni mgal me la sogs pas bskor bar bya ba yul rung ba na gnas pa la mig gis 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: that is, the eye that is situated in a suitable place for the activity of the wheel of fire, etc.

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because direct perception is established as being free from conceptualization,

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad byed pas rab tu sbyar ba'i tshad ma rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad byed pas rab tu sbyar ba'i tshad ma rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the logic of the one who applies the commentary on the Compendium of Valid Cognition is not valid,

original: la la ste srid pa'i bdag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: la la ste srid pa'i bdag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚Äúsome‚Äù and so on.

original: dpe grub pa na rgyu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don ni brda 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe grub pa na rgyu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don ni brda 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When the example is established, the non-observation of the cause is understood. The meaning of the word is that because it is preceded by the apprehension of the sign,

original: sgra dang lhan cig sbyor ba'i 'dzin pa ni 'brel pa ma bzung bar sbyor bar 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dang lhan cig sbyor ba'i 'dzin pa ni 'brel pa ma bzung bar sbyor bar 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the apprehension of the connection with the word will not be the apprehension of the connection without apprehending the relation.

original: spyir don de tsam bsgrub par bya ba la khyab pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyir don de tsam bsgrub par bya ba la khyab pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is pervasion in the mere proof of that much meaning in general,

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa 'di go bar byed pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa 'di go bar byed pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: this non-observation of the cause is the proof.

original: de ltar na 'di la brda la ma byang ba'i yang sgra dang sbyar nas don 'dzin pa na shin tu thal /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la brda la ma byang ba'i yang sgra dang sbyar nas don 'dzin pa na shin tu thal /
translated: Thus, in this case, even for one who is not learned in the sign, when apprehending the meaning in connection with the word, there is a great deal of consequence.

original: @186a * // ches pa ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: @186a * // ches pa ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: The refutation is the valid cognition that contradicts the opposite.

original: 'dis byis pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid yin par bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis byis pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid yin par bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: This cannot prove that the consciousness of a child is non-conceptual,

original: ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang byis pa la yang brda 'dzin par rung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang byis pa la yang brda 'dzin par rung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established and because a child can have a conceptual thought that is suitable to apprehend a sign.

original: de yang de ma thag nyid du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de ma thag nyid du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown immediately below.

original: gang dang gang dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is a sense consciousness is non-conceptual,

original: dper na byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the sense consciousness of a child.

original: brda la byang ba 'di'i yang dbang po'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtsa ba'i sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brda la byang ba 'di'i yang dbang po'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtsa ba'i sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The sense consciousness of one who is skilled in signs is also a sense consciousness. This is the original proof.

original: de las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma bstan pa de ltar na ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma bstan pa de ltar na ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the refutation of the opposite is not shown to be a valid cognition, then doubt will arise with regard to the reverse pervasion.

original: de nyid ni 'on kyang bsgrub pa dang dgag pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'on kyang bsgrub pa dang dgag pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: But that is not so, because of the statement in the case of proof and negation.

original: dpe sgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'dir ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe sgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'dir ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of a cause which was taught in order to prove that example is not established here.

original: gzhan yang byis pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byis pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Moreover, the statement ...because of the non-existence of conceptual cognition in the childish...

original: gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa yang zhes bya ba ni spyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa dag gi khyab pa ni ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa yang zhes bya ba ni spyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa dag gi khyab pa ni ma grub pa yin te /
translated: The pervasion of the reason is also not established, because the pervasion of the general probandum and the general proof is not established.

original: byis pa dag la rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa dag la rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conceptual cognition does not exist for the childish.

original: de ltar de dag kyang myong ba'i dus phyis 'byung ba can don gyi spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag kyang myong ba'i dus phyis 'byung ba can don gyi spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, even for them, conceptual cognition arises later than the time of experience, and has the aspect of a universal of the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Conceptual cognition is of two kinds:

original: don gyi spyi'i rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / sgra'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi spyi'i rnam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / sgra'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: that which is related to the aspect of a universal of the object, and that which is related to the aspect of a word.

original: brda la ma byang ba la yang dang po'i rnam par rtog pa nyid yod pa yin te /üîΩrnam par rtog pa de la gnas par brda byed pa de bas na /
analyzed: brda la ma byang ba la yang dang po'i rnam par rtog pa nyid yod pa yin te / rnam par rtog pa de la gnas par brda byed pa de bas na /
translated: Even for one who is not familiar with the convention, the first concept exists.üîΩThe convention is made in dependence on that concept.

original: rnam par rtog pa de ni brda 'dzin par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de ni brda 'dzin par rung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that concept is suitable to hold the convention.

original: rnam par rtog pa brda 'dzin par rung ba yod pa na byis pas kyang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa brda 'dzin par rung ba yod pa na byis pas kyang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the concept is suitable to hold the convention, the reason ‚Äúeven the child does not apprehend the relation between the word and the object‚Äù is not established.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar na byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar na byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs 'byed par byed do //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he opens up the topic with ‚ÄúThus, the child, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang mi ldan pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang 'dre ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang mi ldan pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang 'dre ba med pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot having the conceptual cognition‚Äù means not having the conceptual cognition in association.

original: 'o na brda rtogs pa'i thabs med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na brda rtogs pa'i thabs med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúThe means of understanding a sign is not established as the cause of a thought,‚Äù then that reason is not established in the proof of the absence of thought.

original: brda rtogs pa'i thabs rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni byis pa la yang yod pa'i phyir @186b ro ;
analyzed: brda rtogs pa'i thabs rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni byis pa la yang yod pa'i phyir @186b ro ;
translated: Because the conceptual consciousness that is the means of understanding a sign exists even for a child.

original: / byis pa dag gis sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa ma bzung ba zhes bya ba gzhan gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: / byis pa dag gis sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa ma bzung ba zhes bya ba gzhan gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it stated as the reason of another that ‚Äúchildren do not apprehend the relation between a sign and its meaning‚Äù?

original: brda'i thabs dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brda'i thabs dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not that they are devoid of the means of understanding a sign.

original: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: 'di ltar sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa de ni de 'dzin pa'i thabs dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa de ni de 'dzin pa'i thabs dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason ‚Äúthey do not apprehend the relation between a sign and its meaning‚Äù is because they are devoid of the means of apprehending that.

original: gang gi phyir byis pas 'brel pa ma bzang ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni thabs dang bral ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byis pas 'brel pa ma bzang ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni thabs dang bral ba nyid bstan to //
translated: Because of that, the statement ‚Äúchildren do not apprehend the relation‚Äù teaches that they are devoid of the means.

original: brda'i thabs su gyur pa'i rnam par dpyod pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brda'i thabs su gyur pa'i rnam par dpyod pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they are also free from the consciousness that analyzes the method of signs,üîΩthey will attain the state of being devoid of conceptual consciousness at the end of a person's death.

original: skyes bu shi ba'i mthar thug par rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes thal ba bsgrubs pa de la gzhan gyis ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu shi ba'i mthar thug par rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes thal ba bsgrubs pa de la gzhan gyis ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In response to this reductio, in order to show that the other party has not established this,

original: gal te brda la ma byad ba'i yid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te brda la ma byad ba'i yid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says, If you say that the mind is not conditioned by signs... and so on.

original: 'di skad du byis ba dag la yang brda'i thabs su gyur pa rnam par dpyod pa'i yid kho bo 'dod pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'di skad du byis ba dag la yang brda'i thabs su gyur pa rnam par dpyod pa'i yid kho bo 'dod pa de bas na /
translated: This is saying that since we accept that the mind that analyzes the method of signs exists even for the childish,

original: thams cad du brda med par thal ba med cing byis pa dag gi dbang po'i shes pa ngo bo nyid kyis dpyod pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad du brda med par thal ba med cing byis pa dag gi dbang po'i shes pa ngo bo nyid kyis dpyod pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore it is not the case that it follows that there are no signs everywhere, and since the sense consciousnesses of the childish are by nature free from analysis,

original: dpe bsgrub byas stong pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub byas stong pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: the example is not empty of the probandum.

original: ji srid du dbang po'i shes pa dpyod par byed pa nyid la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma brjod pa de srid du dbang po'i shes pa thams cad dpyod par byed pa nyid yin par dogs pas 'dzin pa nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: ji srid du dbang po'i shes pa dpyod par byed pa nyid la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma brjod pa de srid du dbang po'i shes pa thams cad dpyod par byed pa nyid yin par dogs pas 'dzin pa nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir
translated: Until a valid cognition that contradicts the analysis by sensory consciousnesses is stated, it is suspected that all sensory consciousnesses are analysis.

original: / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de'i tshe ji ltar de la yid brda la ma byang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de'i tshe ji ltar de la yid brda la ma byang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are not, the proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúAt that time, how is it that one is not skilled in the conventions of mind?‚Äù

original: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag la 'brel pa dang 'gal ba ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag la 'brel pa dang 'gal ba ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the relation and contradiction of the proof and the negation are not established.

original: dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa yin no zhes sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa yin no zhes sgrub pa ste /
translated: The proof is that whatever is a sensory consciousness is non-conceptual.

original: bsgrub par bya ba de la 'brel pa ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / gang dbang po'i shes pa yin pa de ni rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba de la 'gal ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de la 'brel pa ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / gang dbang po'i shes pa yin pa de ni rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba de la 'gal ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation to the probandum is not stated, and because the contradiction to the probandum, ‚Äúwhatever is a sense perception is necessarily related to discursive thought,‚Äù is not stated.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dpe nyid yin zhes bya ba ni brda la byang ba'i dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la dpe nyid yin /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dpe nyid yin zhes bya ba ni brda la byang ba'i dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la dpe nyid yin /
translated: ‚Äú It is a mere example of something else‚Äù means that the sense perception of one who is skilled in conventional symbols is a mere example of the probandum, ‚Äúis without discursive thought.‚Äù

original: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi la sogs pa 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can gyi sbyor ba'i rnam pa 'di dgag pa can la yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi la sogs pa 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can gyi sbyor ba'i rnam pa 'di dgag pa can la yod pa yin gyi /
translated: This type of syllogism, which is preceded by the apprehension of the qualifier and the object qualified, etc., is only negative.

original: rigs dang yon tan dang la sogs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan @187a * //
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan dang la sogs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan @187a * //
translated: It is not for the apprehension of a universal, quality, etc.

original: pa'i phyir gang gi tshe de lta yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir gang gi tshe de lta yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúWhen it is like that, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du snang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du snang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the appearance as just that‚Äù and so on.

original: dbyug par snang bas dbyug pa nye bar mtshon pa dang / lha sbyin du snang bas lha sbyin mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyug par snang bas dbyug pa nye bar mtshon pa dang / lha sbyin du snang bas lha sbyin mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The appearance as a stick indicates a stick, and the appearance as Devadatta indicates Devadatta.

original: de dag gi 'brel ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can gyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'brel ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can gyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir relationship and so on‚Äù is the relationship between the stick and the stick-bearer.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is to be applied to ‚Äúthe indication of worldly conventions and so on.‚Äù

original: ba lang dkar po dang 'tshed pa po dang rva can zhes bya ba la rigs dang yon tan dang / las dang rdzas kyi dbye bas sgra rnam pa bzhi la 'jug go zhes gzhan khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang dkar po dang 'tshed pa po dang rva can zhes bya ba la rigs dang yon tan dang / las dang rdzas kyi dbye bas sgra rnam pa bzhi la 'jug go zhes gzhan khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because others accept that the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is used in four ways, according to the distinctions of class, quality, action, and substance.

original: de bas na rigs la sogs pa bzhi'i de ltar na 'di ni rigs yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dper byed do //
analyzed: de bas na rigs la sogs pa bzhi'i de ltar na 'di ni rigs yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dper byed do //
translated: Therefore, the four, class and so on, are exemplified by ‚ÄúThis is a class‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs la sogs pa 'brel pa can dag de dang ldan pa las tha dad par mi 'dzin pa na de'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa yang thag ring du bsrings pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa 'brel pa can dag de dang ldan pa las tha dad par mi 'dzin pa na de'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa yang thag ring du bsrings pa nyid yin no //
translated: When one does not apprehend the related things, such as the universal, as different from the one that possesses them, then the relation between them is also pushed far away.

original: de nyid ni 'brel pa can tha dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'brel pa can tha dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That is because there is no apprehension of the related things as different.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rtog pa'o //
translated: And that is the conceptualization of sound.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By the reasoning that has been explained means by the process of explanation such as ‚ÄúThe word is not applied to the particular characteristic.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni dbang po'i shes pa yin zhing /üîΩde la sgra 'god pa med pa de bas na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni dbang po'i shes pa yin zhing / de la sgra 'god pa med pa de bas na /
translated: The sense perception has the particular characteristic as its object.üîΩAnd the word is not applied to that.

original: dbang po'i shes pa sgra la sbyor bas kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa sgra la sbyor bas kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though the sense perception is applied to the word, it is not conceptual.

original: sgra sbyor ba yang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba yang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The application of the terms ‚Äúqualifier‚Äù and ‚Äúqualified‚Äù is also based on the apprehension of the qualifier and the qualified.

original: byed pa 'di tsam gyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa 'di tsam gyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The sense consciousnesses are not capable of functioning merely through this much,

original: yul nye ba'i stobs las skye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dus gzhan la sdod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nye ba'i stobs las skye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dus gzhan la sdod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise through the power of the object being near and because they do not remain for another moment.

original: yang na ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan ma thag pa'i rigs pa khyad par la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rim gyis 'dzin pa'o ;
analyzed: yang na ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan ma thag pa'i rigs pa khyad par la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rim gyis 'dzin pa'o ;
translated: Or, the term ‚Äúthrough the reasoning that has been explained‚Äù refers to the apprehension of the qualifier and the qualified, which is the immediately preceding reasoning that was taught, such as ‚Äúthe qualifier and the qualified.‚Äù

original: / gal te ci'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa 'jug pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te ci'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa 'jug pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why the sense consciousnesses do not engage,

original: byed pa 'di tsam gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byed pa 'di tsam gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response is ‚ÄúThe sense consciousnesses are not capable of functioning merely through this much.‚Äù

original: phyogs 'di las kyang gi sgra ni ni'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di las kyang gi sgra ni ni'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this context, the term ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be viewed as having the meaning of ‚Äúeven.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi rigs tha dad pa bsgrub par 'dod pas rjes su 'gro ba can gyi spyi med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras @187b so ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi rigs tha dad pa bsgrub par 'dod pas rjes su 'gro ba can gyi spyi med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras @187b so ;
translated: Since it is asserted that a different type is established, it is said that ‚Äúif there is no universal that is concomitant with it,‚Äù and so on.

original: / de yang sgra dang gsal bar snang //
analyzed: / de yang sgra dang gsal bar snang //
translated: And that is the form of sound and the appearance of the individual.

original: sgra dang gsal ba zhes bya ba zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: sgra dang gsal ba zhes bya ba zlas dbye'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúsound and the individual‚Äù is a dvandva compound.

original: gsal ba ni ba lang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni ba lang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The individual is the cow and so on.

original: de dag tu snang ba'i ngag tshul can nam shes pa gang la de dag gi snang ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag tu snang ba'i ngag tshul can nam shes pa gang la de dag gi snang ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The speech that appears as those or the consciousness that has the appearance of those is called that.

original: sgra'i rnam pa dang ba lang la sogs pa gsal ba'i rnam pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa rnam par nges pa yin gyi sgra dang gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rigs kyi rnam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam pa dang ba lang la sogs pa gsal ba'i rnam pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa rnam par nges pa yin gyi sgra dang gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rigs kyi rnam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The form of sound and the form of the individual, the cow and so on, are ascertained by consciousness that is concomitant with that, but it is not the form of a universal that is different from sound and the individual. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid ni sems de la ba lang gi kha dog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ni sems de la ba lang gi kha dog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúthe color of the cow and so on in that mind‚Äù and so on.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs zhes bya ba la 'dis ni gsal bar snang ba can nyid bshad do //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs zhes bya ba la 'dis ni gsal bar snang ba can nyid bshad do //
translated: The phrase color and shape indicates the appearance of clarity.

original: ming zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni sgrar snang ba can bshad do //
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni sgrar snang ba can bshad do //
translated: The phrase name, etc. indicates the appearance of sound.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase in regard to itself, etc. means the following.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na yang gzugs brnyan nyid du gnas pa snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na yang gzugs brnyan nyid du gnas pa snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though it is of the nature of consciousness, it does not appear as a reflection.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig gi yul gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad par zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gsal ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de las tha dad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig gi yul gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad par zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gsal ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de las tha dad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the object of the eye consciousness is distinct from the clear form means that the object of the eye consciousness is distinct from the clear form.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang yi ge'i rnam pa'i ngo bo can gyi zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgra'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang yi ge'i rnam pa'i ngo bo can gyi zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgra'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The phrase the nature of letters, etc. means the nature of letters, words, and sentences.

original: de las khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa ni des dben pa 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: de las khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa ni des dben pa 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The apprehension of a special object is the effect of the apprehension of the absence of that.

original: de 'di la med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩkha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa de las tha dad pa gsal ba'i ngo bo dag gis zhes bya ba ni spyir 'dod pa kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgra'i rnam pa gsal bar snang ba las gsal ba'i ngo bo kha dog la sogs pa tha dad pa mig
analyzed: de 'di la med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa'o // kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa de las tha dad pa gsal ba'i ngo bo dag gis zhes bya ba ni spyir 'dod pa kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgra'i rnam pa gsal bar snang ba las gsal ba'i ngo bo kha dog la sogs pa tha dad pa mig
translated: The non-apprehension of the cause is like that, in that it is the absence of that.üîΩBy the appearances of color, etc., which are different from that, and by the appearances of the clear nature, etc. means that in general, the appearances of color, shape, and sound are desired.

original: gi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The appearances of the clear nature, color, etc., which are different from that, are the objects apprehended by the eye consciousness. That is the meaning of ‚Äúby the appearances of the clear nature, color, etc., which are different from that.‚Äù

original: shes pa de nyid ni de las tha dad pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bor snang ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: shes pa de nyid ni de las tha dad pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bor snang ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the consciousness itself appears as the clear nature that is different from that.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'phrod pa 'du ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'phrod pa 'du ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Because the contact is beyond the senses means that the contact of another is asserted to be an inference.

original: chos can ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo can gyi blo chos can nyid du brjod pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam bsam ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro
analyzed: chos can ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo can gyi blo chos can nyid du brjod pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam bsam ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro
translated: The fault of the nonestablishment of the subject is shown.

original: // rmig pa zhes bya ba ni rmig pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du mthong @188a * //
analyzed: // rmig pa zhes bya ba ni rmig pa'o // de bzhin du mthong @188a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúwool‚Äù refers to the wool.

original: ba'i zhes bya ba ni steng gi rva 'brel pa mthong ba'i'o //üîΩde dag ni 'phrod pa 'du ba las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan dang 'brel ba can gyi rva chag pa dang gsal ba gzhan de dag ni'o //
analyzed: ba'i zhes bya ba ni steng gi rva 'brel pa mthong ba'i'o // de dag ni 'phrod pa 'du ba las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan dang 'brel ba can gyi rva chag pa dang gsal ba gzhan de dag ni'o //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúseen‚Äù refers to the seen upper horn.üîΩThose are not from the conjunction of the two.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why, he says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no connection with the other.‚Äù

original: de la yan lag can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la yan lag can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúpart‚Äù refers to the horn.

original: de 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi blo gang yin pa ni gsal ba gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi rva la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi blo gang yin pa ni gsal ba gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi rva la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is mistaken, because the cognition of another is applied to the horn connected with another manifestation.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rva la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rva la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd also in other cases‚Äù means also in the case of the horns of a cow.

original: snam bu'i sgra rten zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan tshun 'brel pas khyad par can du 'byung ba'i snal ma nyid ni snam bu'i sgra'i rten yin gyi yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snam bu'i sgra rten zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan tshun 'brel pas khyad par can du 'byung ba'i snal ma nyid ni snam bu'i sgra'i rten yin gyi yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù is the basis of the word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù because it is the basis of the word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù in the sense of being its cause.

original: 'jig rten ci'i phyir 'bras bu snam bu la rgyu sgro btags nas tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten ci'i phyir 'bras bu snam bu la rgyu sgro btags nas tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does the world employ the expression ‚Äúcloth‚Äù in reference to the effect, the cloth, designating it with the name of its cause?

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsdud par byed pa'i tshig 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni de'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa dag la zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sdud par byed pa'i tshig 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni de'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa dag la zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù and so on is used.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin the transformation of its aspects‚Äù is an explanation of the word ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: snam bu'i tha snyad gdags su rung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snam bu'i tha snyad gdags su rung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is suitable to designate the cloth with the word ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: ba lang zhes lhag yan lag rnams //
analyzed: ba lang zhes lhag yan lag rnams //
translated: The word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is applied to the parts

original: rnam chad dmigs su med phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam chad dmigs su med phyir ro //
translated: Because the parts are not perceived when the cow is destroyed.

original: ba lang la rva zhes bya ba'i blo yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang la rva zhes bya ba'i blo yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is the cognition of the horns of the cow.

original: 'phrod pa dang 'du ba las ma yin pa da ltar na rgyu gcig bstan to //
analyzed: 'phrod pa dang 'du ba las ma yin pa da ltar na rgyu gcig bstan to //
translated: The present is taught to be the single cause of that which is not the meeting and separation of the present.

original: da ni rgyu gzhan bstan pa'i phyir 'dir ba lang lar zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: da ni rgyu gzhan bstan pa'i phyir 'dir ba lang lar zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Now, in order to teach another cause, he says, ‚ÄúHere, the cow is the cause of the designation of the word ‚Äòcow.‚Äô‚Äù

original: rnam par chad pa mthong med nyid //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa mthong med nyid //
translated: The non-perception of a division.

original: ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rgyu dran par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rgyu dran par byed pa'o //
translated: This is a reminder of the previously explained cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa byed pas mang du bshad zin to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa byed pas mang du bshad zin to zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the commentator says, ‚ÄúThis has been explained many times.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is true,‚Äù and so on, introduces the doubt of the opponent.

original: don gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe other meaning‚Äù and so on is the response.

original: don gzhan ni rten las gzhan 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan ni rten las gzhan 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: The other meaning is the reason for the engagement that is different from the basis.

original: gang la don gzhan gyi rten yod pa de ni rten can yin la /üîΩde lta bur gyur pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: gang la don gzhan gyi rten yod pa de ni rten can yin la / de lta bur gyur pa yang de yin la /
translated: That which has the other meaning as its basis is the possessor of the basis.

original: tha snyad kyang yin zhing de'i spyod yul zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang yin zhing de'i spyod yul zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: That is also such, and it is also a convention. The phrase ‚Äúthe domain of that‚Äù is a compound.

original: dngos po gang la shes pa 'khrul pa med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang la shes pa 'khrul pa med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is called ‚Äúnon-erroneous cognition of a thing.‚Äù

original: shes pa gang dang gang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi khyad par la'o //
analyzed: shes pa gang dang gang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi khyad par la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat cognition which is concomitant with a particular‚Äù means that it is concomitant with a particular substance.

original: spyi la sogs pa tha dad pa'i khyad par grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa tha dad pa'i khyad par grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe difference of universals, etc., is established.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis spyi la @188b sogs pa'i khyad par rdzas las tha dad pa'i khyad par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis spyi la @188b sogs pa'i khyad par rdzas las tha dad pa'i khyad par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the reason stated, the difference of universals, etc., is established as a difference from substance.

original: de ltar na ba lang dkar po dang rva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rigs la sogs pa'i shes pa dbyug pa can gyi shes pa dang 'dra bar khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ba lang dkar po dang rva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rigs la sogs pa'i shes pa dbyug pa can gyi shes pa dang 'dra bar khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Thus, in the case of ‚Äúwhite cow,‚Äù ‚Äúcow with horns,‚Äù etc., the cognition of the universal, etc., is like the cognition of the stick, i.e., it is concomitant with the particular.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //üîΩdngos po las ni tha dad can //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no // dngos po las ni tha dad can //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù is the opinion of the Buddhist.üîΩ‚ÄúFrom a thing, a difference‚Äù

original: rigs la sogs la ni ste dngos po dag las tha dad pa can no //
analyzed: rigs la sogs la ni ste dngos po dag las tha dad pa can no //
translated: means from things, a difference.

original: de ni dngos po las tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de ni dngos po las tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains that with ‚ÄúIt is not from a stick that is different from the thing.‚Äù

original: de ni don gzhan du gyur pa'i dbyug pa yan gar ba las ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos pos stong pa'i dbyug pa tsam las so //üîΩde yi bdag po med par yang //
analyzed: de ni don gzhan du gyur pa'i dbyug pa yan gar ba las ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos pos stong pa'i dbyug pa tsam las so // de yi bdag po med par yang //
translated: It is not from a mere stick that is empty of the nature of the thing that is helped and the helper, that is, a stick that is a different object.üîΩ‚ÄúNor is it without an owner.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la dbyug pa 'chang ba med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dbyug pa 'chang ba med pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is not even without a stick-holder.

original: kun rdzob pa las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa las zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the conventional.‚Äù

original: blo spyi'i rnam par snang ba can sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni kun rdzob yin la /
analyzed: blo spyi'i rnam par snang ba can sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni kun rdzob yin la /
translated: The conventional is the cognition that appears in the form of a universal and is reifying.

original: des sgro btags pa ni kun rdzob pa'o //
analyzed: des sgro btags pa ni kun rdzob pa'o //
translated: What is superimposed by that is conventional.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that ‚Äúbecause of the superimposition by the conceptual cognition.‚Äù

original: de skad du dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can phan tshun 'brel pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par de las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de skad du dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can phan tshun 'brel pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par de las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the same way, the state of the stick and the stick-holder being mutually related does not arise as a different object from that.

original: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, because it is its own characteristic, it is not the cause of the term‚Äôs usage,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra mi 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra mi 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the term is not applied to its own characteristic.

original: 'on kyang de la gnas skabs gzhan du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gnas skabs gzhan du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: However, the thought that superimposes a different state arises in regard to it.

original: de la snang ba sgro btags pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de'i rgyu can gyi sgra yin gyi dbyug pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la snang ba sgro btags pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de'i rgyu can gyi sgra yin gyi dbyug pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The term is caused by the nature of the appearance that is superimposed on it, but it is not based on the stick‚Äôs own characteristic.

original: de'i phyir dbyug pa can gyi tha snyad kyang phyi rol gyi dngos po tha dad pa'i rgyu can ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyug pa can gyi tha snyad kyang phyi rol gyi dngos po tha dad pa'i rgyu can ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: Therefore the term ‚Äústick-holder‚Äù is not caused by a different external object.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pas na rigs la sogs pa tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa la rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pas na rigs la sogs pa tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa la rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the example is empty of the probandum, there is no inference that establishes the difference of the reason, etc.

original: de nyid ni des ni dpe ma grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni des ni dpe ma grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That is what is meant by ‚ÄúSince the example is not established,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po khang bzangs phreng la sogs //
analyzed: dngos po khang bzangs phreng la sogs //
translated: Things, rows of houses, etc.

original: sgra rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Sounds, etc.

original: dngos po dang khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThings, rows of houses, etc.‚Äù is a dvandva compound.

original: de dag rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni dngos po dang khang bzangs phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so //
analyzed: de dag rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni dngos po dang khang bzangs phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so //
translated: The sounds that express them are the sounds ‚Äúthings, rows of houses, etc.‚Äù

original: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /üîΩshes pa yang de'i yul can du @189a * //
analyzed: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te / shes pa yang de'i yul can du @189a * //
translated: The mention of sounds is an illustration.

original: 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Consciousnesses are also asserted to have them as objects.

original: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba drug po la yang dngos po'i sgras bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba drug po la yang dngos po'i sgras bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because substance, quality, action, universals, particularities and inherence are also indicated by the word ‚Äúentity.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i sgra ni tshig gi don thams cad brjod pa'i ngag tshul can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgra ni tshig gi don thams cad brjod pa'i ngag tshul can yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúentity‚Äù is a verbal form that expresses all the meanings of words.

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is a universal,

original: tshig gi don so so la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don so so la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied to each of the meanings of words.

original: khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par can te /
analyzed: khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par can te /
translated: ‚Äú It is a particular‚Äù means that it is a particular,

original: khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra khyad par 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra khyad par 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the words ‚Äúa row of houses‚Äù and so on are applied to some particular.

original: gal te yang khang bzangs lan lag can gyi rdzas ma yin pa de lta na yang de dngos po nyid yin te ldan pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang khang bzangs lan lag can gyi rdzas ma yin pa de lta na yang de dngos po nyid yin te ldan pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though a house is not a substance that has parts, it is still an entity, because it has the nature of inherence.

original: de'i phyir ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúInherence is not an entity.‚Äù

original: yon tan yang ma yin te yon tan rnams la yon tan nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan yang ma yin te yon tan rnams la yon tan nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nor is it a quality, because qualities do not have qualities.

original: khang bzangs ni gzhan gyi 'dod pas yon tan yin la /
analyzed: khang bzangs ni gzhan gyi 'dod pas yon tan yin la /
translated: A palace is a quality in the sense that it is desired by another.

original: gang las de la gzhan khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba'i yon tan yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las de la gzhan khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba'i yon tan yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: From what is it a quality of a palace-row?

original: de sgra ni zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs kyi phreng ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de sgra ni zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs kyi phreng ba'i sgra'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúpalace‚Äù is the word ‚Äúpalace-row.‚Äù

original: sgra smos pa shes pa yang don gyis bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra smos pa shes pa yang don gyis bzung ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúsound‚Äù is understood by implication,

original: de med par sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sound does not occur without it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa las khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa las khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the commentary shows that the cognition is a universal.

original: 'dir shes pa 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir shes pa 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
translated: Here, the statement that cognition is caused by the contact of the object is also false,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba ni 'di'i blo rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir gang las rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rgyu nyid yin /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba ni 'di'i blo rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir gang las rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rgyu nyid yin /
translated: because contact is the cause of the cognition of that object. How can it be the cause of a universal?

original: rgyu nyid yin na yang spyir kun du brtags pa log pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin na yang spyir kun du brtags pa log pa yin no //
translated: If it is a cause, then in general, the imagined is refuted.

original: tshad ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshad ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The measure does not exist, etc.

original: yon tan chen po dang chung ngu nyid la sogs pa ni tshad yin no //
analyzed: yon tan chen po dang chung ngu nyid la sogs pa ni tshad yin no //
translated: The measure is the greatness and smallness of the qualities, etc.

original: yon tan chen po nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo tshad de ni khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yon tan chen po nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo tshad de ni khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The measure, which is the nature of the greatness of the qualities, etc., does not exist in the rows of palaces, etc.

original: khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgras kyang gang brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgras kyang gang brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: By the words ‚Äúrows of palaces, etc.,‚Äù what is expressed?

original: ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khang bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩtha dad pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i khyad par ni dngos po yin la /
analyzed: ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khang bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // tha dad pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i khyad par ni dngos po yin la /
translated: The characteristics of possession are called ‚Äúpalaces,‚Äù etc.üîΩBecause there is no difference in the distinct particular.

original: de med pa'i tha snyad bar btags pa can yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: de med pa'i tha snyad bar btags pa can yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: Others think that the distinct particular is a thing, and that it is designated as the absence of that.

original: khyed kyis kun du brtags pa'i nye bar 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyis kun du brtags pa'i nye bar 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that what you imagine to be a designation does not exist,

original: @189b gzhan la rab tu grags pa'i dpe chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi tshul gyis 'di ltar dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god par byed do //
analyzed: @189b gzhan la rab tu grags pa'i dpe chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi tshul gyis 'di ltar dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god par byed do //
translated: he presents the example of a forest, which is well known to others, by means of a method that has a dissimilar property: ‚ÄúFor example, etc.‚Äù

original: nags zhes bya ba 'di la grangs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi zhes bya ba ni nags zhes bya ba ni yan lag can khas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nags zhes bya ba 'di la grangs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi zhes bya ba ni nags zhes bya ba ni yan lag can khas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, a forest is not a collection of trees, because the definition of a collection is not accepted as a whole.

original: shing gi 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi grangs la nags zhes bya'o zhes gzhan khas len to //
analyzed: shing gi 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi grangs la nags zhes bya'o zhes gzhan khas len to //
translated: Others accept that a forest is a collection that possesses the aggregation of trees.

original: de dag la ni rdzas la yod pa yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni me tog dag ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni rdzas la yod pa yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni me tog dag ste /
translated: In that case, it is like the existence of flowers in a tree,

original: de nyid la de dag 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la de dag 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are in a state of aggregation in that very place.

original: rdzas gcig la zhes bya ba ni shing la'o //
analyzed: rdzas gcig la zhes bya ba ni shing la'o //
translated: In one substance means in a tree.

original: dngos kyi yul can yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: dngos kyi yul can yang de dag yin la /
translated: They are also the actual objects.

original: sgra dang shes pa yang yin pas na /
analyzed: sgra dang shes pa yang yin pas na /
translated: and it is sound and cognition.

original: dngos kyi yul can gyi sgra dang shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos kyi yul can gyi sgra dang shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is sound and cognition that have the thing as their object.

original: de bdag gis khyad par med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bdag gis khyad par med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That cognition which is not distinguished by the thing is so called.

original: des gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is that which is apprehended by it.

original: dngos su rnam par gzhag pa ni de tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dngos su rnam par gzhag pa ni de tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The establishment of the thing is due to that alone, and therefore it is a natural reason.

original: de 'dra ba ni rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni rnam shes kyi //
translated: That is the cause of consciousness.

original: rgyu yin zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yin zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The commentary on this is ‚Äúthat which is concomitant with it,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni dngos po gang dag la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni dngos po gang dag la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúin regard to which‚Äù is ‚Äúin regard to those things.‚Äù

original: des zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa pos so /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa pos so /
translated: ‚ÄúBy it‚Äù means by the proponent.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa /
translated: Book 4

original: de ltar shes pa yin na yang //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa yin na yang //
translated: Even though it is known in that way,

original: tha dad tha dad med rtogs phyir //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med rtogs phyir //
translated: because it is understood as different and not different,

original: zhes bya ba de tsam ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de tsam ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha yin la /
translated: This much is the part of the verse.

original: da ni de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs snga ma nye bar bkod nas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: da ni de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs snga ma nye bar bkod nas 'chad par byed do //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is so,‚Äù he sets forth the opponent‚Äôs position and explains it.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu shes pa tha dad pa med pa de dag byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par de dag gi 'bras bu dbang po'i shes pa de dag gal te gsal ba so so la tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu shes pa tha dad pa med pa de dag byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par de dag gi 'bras bu dbang po'i shes pa de dag gal te gsal ba so so la tha dad pa yin na /
translated: ‚Äú How can they be the cause of a cognition that is not different from the effect?‚Äù means that if those different manifestations are the effect of those sense cognitions, and if they are different in each individual manifestation,

original: ji ltar gsal ba dag 'bras bu'i shes pa tha dad pa med pa byed pa yin zhe na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal ba dag 'bras bu'i shes pa tha dad pa med pa byed pa yin zhe na'o //
translated: how can the manifestations be the cause of a cognition that is not different from the effect?

original: tha dad med rtogs phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad med rtogs phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because of the realization of non-difference‚Äù is the seventh reason.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du zhes bya bas rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: For that very reason, he explains with ‚ÄúThe reason for the realization of oneness‚Äù and so on.

original: de tsam gyis dag gi don yongs su mi rdzogs pa'i phyir don de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis dag gi don yongs su mi rdzogs pa'i phyir don de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because that much does not fully complete the meaning, he says ‚ÄúBy those meanings‚Äù and so on.

original: tha dad pa yod na yang dngos po de dag gis ngo bo nyid kyi gcig rtogs pa skyer rung ba'i dbang po'i shes pa de dag skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad pa yod na yang dngos po de dag gis ngo bo nyid kyi gcig rtogs pa skyer rung ba'i dbang po'i shes pa de dag skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If they are different, then those cognitions of the sense faculties, which are capable of producing the understanding of a single nature of those things, produce it. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir @190a * //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir @190a * //
translated: In order to clarify that very point, he says

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: those cognitions, etc.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i gsal ba rnams kyi shes pa skyed pa de dag ni gang gis tha dad na yang rnam pa gcig rtogs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i gsal ba rnams kyi shes pa skyed pa de dag ni gang gis tha dad na yang rnam pa gcig rtogs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the compound is this: those cognitions which produce the understanding of the manifestations that are such are the same, even if they are different, in producing the understanding of a single aspect.

original: de yang shes pa tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa'i shes pa'o ;
analyzed: de yang shes pa tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa'i shes pa'o ;
translated: And that is the non-difference of cognitions, i.e., the understanding.

original: / de yang sngar zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por ro //
analyzed: / de yang sngar zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por ro //
translated: And that was stated previously, i.e., in the first chapter.

original: de nyid rnar par bya ba'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid rnar par bya ba'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: In order to clarify that very point, the commentator teaches with the words, as one, etc.

original: de'i 'bras bu rnams mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i 'bras bu rnams so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnams mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i 'bras bu rnams so //
translated: The result of that is ‚Äúseen,‚Äù i.e., the manifest result.

original: gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yi phyir /
analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yi phyir /
translated: Because of being the cause of the cognition of one,

original: blo ni tha dad med pa yin //
analyzed: blo ni tha dad med pa yin //
translated: the cognition is not different.

original: blo gcig rgyu yi dngos po yis //
analyzed: blo gcig rgyu yi dngos po yis //
translated: Because of the one cause of the cognition,

original: gsal ba rnams kyang tha mi dad //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams kyang tha mi dad //
translated: the manifestations are also not different.

original: ces bya ba der bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba der bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This has already been demonstrated.

original: de 'bras can min bral /
analyzed: de 'bras can min bral /
translated: It is not the result of that, nor is it free from that.

original: rjes 'gro zhes bya ba ni gcig rtogs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can no //
analyzed: rjes 'gro zhes bya ba ni gcig rtogs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can no //
translated: ‚ÄúFollowing‚Äù means having the result of the cognition of one, etc.

original: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ni de 'bras can min te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ni de 'bras can min te /
translated: Not having that as its result is ‚Äúnot the result of that.‚Äù

original: gang gis de lta bur gyur pa'i rtog pa nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de lta bur gyur pa'i rtog pa nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not produced by the consciousness that experiences the conceptual cognition that has become like that.

original: de dag dang bral ba ni gzhan sel ba ste /
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba ni gzhan sel ba ste /
translated: Free from those is the exclusion of other.

original: rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i rgyu gsal ba de 'dra ba dag la de rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i rgyu gsal ba de 'dra ba dag la de rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yin te /
translated: The manifestation that is the cause of the cognition of one form is present in those similar manifestations.

original: thams cad ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all are the opposite of not having that as its result.

original: de ldog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir dngos po rnams phan tshun tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ldog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir dngos po rnams phan tshun tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because it is the nature of the exclusion of that, it is the nature of the mutual difference of things.

original: ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because exclusion and possession of that are not different.

original: de dang 'di 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'di 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat and this are contradictory‚Äù is because of the acceptance of the object of intrinsic identity.

original: skyon de yod po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: skyon de yod po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is that the fault does not exist, and so on.

original: sgras rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir mnyan pa dngos po la gnas pa rnam par gcod pa la reg pa yin no zhes ma bstan te /
analyzed: sgras rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir mnyan pa dngos po la gnas pa rnam par gcod pa la reg pa yin no zhes ma bstan te /
translated: Because sound teaches intrinsic identity, it is not taught that hearing is the contact with the exclusion of the thing that is the basis.

original: sgra las rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi skye pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa mi skye pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness that has the aspect of intrinsic identity does not arise from sound.

original: skye na yang 'on long la sogs pa med par thal ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye na yang 'on long la sogs pa med par thal ba bshad zin to //
translated: Even if it did arise, it would follow that the deaf and the blind would not exist, and so on.

original: de ni phyi rol nus pa rnam gcod la //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol nus pa rnam gcod la //
translated: That is the exclusion of the external potential.

original: reg pa med na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: reg pa med na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven without contact‚Äù meansüîΩthat the capacity of the external object to produce its own effect is not determined by the capacity of the word to exclude other things.

original: phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi de dang de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa la so sor nges pa'i nus pa gang yin pa des rnam par gcad pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de phyi @190b rol gyi nusüîΩpa rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi de dang de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa la so sor nges pa'i nus pa gang yin pa des rnam par gcad pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de phyi @190b rol gyi nus pa rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: The capacity of the word to exclude other things is the external capacity.

original: de la nges pa ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: de la nges pa ni reg pa ste /
translated: The determination of the word is contact.

original: khams ni don sna tshogs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams ni don sna tshogs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elements have various meanings.

original: de med na yang ste /
analyzed: de med na yang ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEven without that‚Äù means

original: sgras rang gi mtshan nyid la reg pa med na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgras rang gi mtshan nyid la reg pa med na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that even without contact with the word‚Äôs own meaning,

original: de ni phyi rol gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: he explains with ‚Äúthat external thing.‚Äù

original: de sgra ni zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de sgra ni zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on ‚Äúthat word‚Äù is

original: dngos po rnam par gcod pa brjod pa'i ngag tshul can gyi mnyan pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnam par gcod pa brjod pa'i ngag tshul can gyi mnyan pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the listener who has the mode of speech that expresses the exclusion of other things.

original: rnam pa rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dag / ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams gzung ba'i rnam par dag pa 'brel cing sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dag / ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams gzung ba'i rnam par dag pa 'brel cing sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe forms of conceptualization‚Äù means that conceptualizations are related to and connected with the forms of the perceived object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan brjod par bya ba de dag la rjod par byad pa nyid du nye bar 'dre ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan brjod par bya ba de dag la rjod par byad pa nyid du nye bar 'dre ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúare engaged in the expression of those forms of conceptualization‚Äù is that they are connected with the expression of those forms of conceptualization that are to be expressed.

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams dngos po la gnas pa can nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams dngos po la gnas pa can nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the forms of conceptualization are grounded in things?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúin their own characteristics, etc.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pas zhes bya bas ni snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pas zhes bya bas ni snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the error of intrinsic reality‚Äù means that the engagement of the appearance and the object of conceptualization as a unity is itself an error.

original: rnam pa 'dis rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dngos po la gnas pa can yin pa ni blo ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dngos po la gnas pa can yin pa ni blo ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way, the forms of conceptualization are grounded in things‚Äù means that the mind.

original: mnyan pa ji ltar na dngos po'i ldog pa ston par byed pa yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: mnyan pa ji ltar na dngos po'i ldog pa ston par byed pa yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How does the listener make known the negation of the entity?

original: de'i phyir blos snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag la tha dad pa med par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir blos snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag la tha dad pa med par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the non-difference of the appearance and the object of conceptualization in the mind, etc.‚Äù

original: blos snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag zhen pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
analyzed: blos snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag zhen pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the reason of the non-difference of the appearance and the conceptualization in the mind,

original: rnam pa 'dis mnyan pa des dngos po ldog pa can la skyes bu 'jug par byed pa de'i dngos po ldog pa ston par byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis mnyan pa des dngos po ldog pa can la skyes bu 'jug par byed pa de'i dngos po ldog pa ston par byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: by this method, the listener causes the person to engage in the entity with the negation, and thus he is said to make known the negation of the entity.

original: 'di skad du sgras snang ba dang brtag par bya ba gcig tu byas nas /
analyzed: 'di skad du sgras snang ba dang brtag par bya ba gcig tu byas nas /
translated: This is what is said: having made the appearance and the object of conceptualization one by means of the word,

original: dngos po la 'jug par byed pa de lta bur gyur pa'i blo gang yin skyed par byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po la 'jug par byed pa de lta bur gyur pa'i blo gang yin skyed par byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: the listener causes the person to engage in the entity. The mind that is such a producer is produced.

original: rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa don gyi gzugs brnyan phyi rol nyid du snang ba rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du don gzhan las ldog pa de bas na de nyid dngos po ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa don gyi gzugs brnyan phyi rol nyid du snang ba rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du don gzhan las ldog pa de bas na de nyid dngos po ma yin nam /
translated: Since the appearance of the external object, the reflection of the object that is the basis of conceptualization, is as if it were the particular inherent characteristic of the object, it is excluded from other objects. Therefore, is it not a real entity?

original: gal te de sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin na don gyi phyi rol gyi dngos po sgra'i brjod par bya bar khas blangs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te de sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin na don gyi phyi rol gyi dngos po sgra'i brjod par bya bar khas blangs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it is not expressed by the word, then it would be accepted that the external object is the referent of the word.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan rjod par byed pa dang spyi dngos por gyur pa rjod par byed pas phyi rol sgra'i brjod par bya bar 'dod pa la khyad par ci zhig @191a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan rjod par byed pa dang spyi dngos por gyur pa rjod par byed pas phyi rol sgra'i brjod par bya bar 'dod pa la khyad par ci zhig @191a * //
translated: Or, if the reflection of conceptualization is the referent and the universal is a real entity that is the referent, what is the difference between this and the assertion that the external object is the referent of the word?

original: yod ; 'on kyang ming la rtsod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rgo la ba de'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: yod ; 'on kyang ming la rtsod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rgo la ba de'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: However, the opponent may say, ‚ÄúThis is a dispute about names.‚Äù

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To anticipate this objection, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ni rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du nang na gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ni rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du nang na gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is like this: the reflection of conceptualization is not different from the nature of conceptualization itself, and therefore, like the nature of conceptualization, it exists internally.
