original: 'di'i phyir rol du 'dzin pa dang don gzhan las ldog pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir rol du 'dzin pa dang don gzhan las ldog pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pas byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of external objects and the exclusion of other objects are created by error.

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis kyang dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis kyang dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also taught that things are not established by the power of error.üîΩFor that very reason, it is said, ‚Äúlike exclusion, it appears,‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ldog pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;üîΩldog pa bzhin du snang gi ldog pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ldog pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ; ldog pa bzhin du snang gi ldog pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It appears like exclusion, but it is not exclusion itself.

original: don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dang tshul can gyi dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba don gyi rnam pas phyi rol gyi don gyi bya ba cung zad kyang bsgrubs pa med do //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dang tshul can gyi dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba don gyi rnam pas phyi rol gyi don gyi bya ba cung zad kyang bsgrubs pa med do //
translated: The appearance of conceptualization, which has the mode of producing the effect of an object, is not a thing that performs the function of an object. The appearance of conceptualization, which has the mode of producing the effect of an object, is not a thing that performs the function of an object. original: don dam par de gzhan las ldog pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir rol na med ba nyid kyi phyir gzhan las ldog pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par de gzhan las ldog pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir rol na med ba nyid kyi phyir gzhan las ldog pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In reality, it is not a negation of other, because it does not exist externally.

original: yod na yang ldog pa nyid dam ldog pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na yang ldog pa nyid dam ldog pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it did exist, it would be either a negation or not a negation.

original: de sgra'i brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de sgra'i brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the object of verbal expression.

original: gzugs brnyan te de'i phyi rol na med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan te de'i phyi rol na med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is a reflection, because it does not exist externally.

original: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i spyi dang 'dra ba brjod par bya ba nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i spyi dang 'dra ba brjod par bya ba nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is not like the universals imagined by others, which do exist as objects of verbal expression.

original: yang na gal te rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i don gyi rnam pa brjod par bya ba phyi rol na yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yang na gal te rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i don gyi rnam pa brjod par bya ba phyi rol na yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Or else, if the form of an object that appears in a conceptual cognition does not exist externally,

original: de shes pa nyid kyi dngos po nyid yin la /
analyzed: de shes pa nyid kyi dngos po nyid yin la /
translated: it is the nature of consciousness itself.

original: de yang sgras brjod par bya ba ni ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de yang sgras brjod par bya ba ni ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: And that is not the object of verbal expression.

original: sgras brjod par bya ba dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgras brjod par bya ba dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of expression is a real thing,

original: de'i phyir de sgra'i brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de sgra'i brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that it is not the object of expression of a word.

original: gzugs brnyan de ni shes pa las tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de ni shes pa las tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: That reflection is not the object of expression of a word because it is not different from consciousness and it is not the nature of its own character.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra mi 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra mi 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a word is not applied to a character.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i rnam pa phyi rol na med pa nyid kyi phyir ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i rnam pa phyi rol na med pa nyid kyi phyir ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: If you say that it is not the object of expression because the aspect of the appearance of conception does not exist externally and is like the horn of a rabbit,

original: nang yang ma yin te rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang yang ma yin te rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not even internal because it is a character.

original: de nyid kyis phyi rol gyi gsal ba rnams sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa thag ring du gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis phyi rol gyi gsal ba rnams sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa thag ring du gsal ba yin no //
translated: By that very fact, it is clear that external things are the object of expression of a word.

original: spyi dngos por gyur pa ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: spyi dngos por gyur pa ni mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not assert that a universal is a real thing.

original: 'on na sgra'i @191b brjod par bya ba ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on na sgra'i @191b brjod par bya ba ci yin zhe na /
translated: But what is the referent of the word?

original: don dam par cung zad kyang med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: don dam par cung zad kyang med do zhes brjod do //
translated: We reply: Nothing at all ultimately exists.

original: 'o na ji ltar na sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhon nu'i bar la rab tu grags pa dang / ci ltar dngos po ldog pa ston par byed pa mnyan pa yin no zhes bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhon nu'i bar la rab tu grags pa dang / ci ltar dngos po ldog pa ston par byed pa mnyan pa yin no zhes bstan zhe na /
translated: But how can the conventional expressions that arise from words be well known among the young, and how can one listen to the teaching that reveals the cessation of things?

original: brjod pa sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis yin pa de ltar na brda ci lta ba bzhin du sgra las rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar gyur pa de kho na nyid du na don gyis stong pa yin na yang ngo bo nyid
analyzed: brjod pa sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis yin pa de ltar na brda ci lta ba bzhin du sgra las rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar gyur pa de kho na nyid du na don gyis stong pa yin na yang ngo bo nyid
translated: We reply: The conventional expressions that arise from words are due to the power of delusion. In that case, just as the conventional expressions are, so the conceptual mind that arises from words in regard to reality is empty of objects.

original: kyis 'khrul pas rang gi cha la phyi rol gyi don dang gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa na sgras don brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i zhen pa na 'dis nyan pa po rnams slu bar byed pa dang / de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kyis 'khrul pas rang gi cha la phyi rol gyi don dang gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa na sgras don brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i zhen pa na 'dis nyan pa po rnams slu bar byed pa dang / de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis brjod par bya ba dang brjod par byed par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: By this, one deceives the listeners, and by the power of their thoughts, the expressed and the expresser are posited.

original: blo de yang de'i ngo bo nyid du zhen pas skyes bu de las gzhan pa las ldog pa'i don la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: blo de yang de'i ngo bo nyid du zhen pas skyes bu de las gzhan pa las ldog pa'i don la 'jug par byed do //
translated: And that cognition, by conceiving its own nature, causes the person to engage in the object that is the exclusion of other.

original: de bas na chad de tsam gyis gzhan sel ba'i mnyan pa ni rjod par byed pa yin no zhes brjod do ;
analyzed: de bas na chad de tsam gyis gzhan sel ba'i mnyan pa ni rjod par byed pa yin no zhes brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, by that much, the exclusion of other is the expresser.

original: / de nyid kyi phyis bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyis bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to teach just that,

original: de lta na yang don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig rang gi sde pa la brgal zhing brtags pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig rang gi sde pa la brgal zhing brtags pa byed pa yin te /
translated: he says, Even so, it apprehends the aspect of the object... and so on. He first engages in debate with his own faction.

original: gang dag rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam pa dngos su sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin no zhes de ltar zhugs pa'o //üîΩdon gyi rnam pa zhes 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang dag rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam pa dngos su sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin no zhes de ltar zhugs pa'o // don gyi rnam pa zhes 'dzin pa ni //
translated: Those who are engaged in the idea that the form of the object is the direct referent of the word.üîΩThe apprehension of the form of the object

original: don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa ste //
translated: is the apprehension of the form of the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: It is the reflection that appears in the conceptual consciousness.

original: don gyi zhes bya ba ni phyir rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: don gyi zhes bya ba ni phyir rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúobject‚Äù refers to the external particular.

original: gang gi tshe de las gzhan pa las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la gnas pa'i gzhan sel ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de las gzhan pa las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la gnas pa'i gzhan sel ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: When it is said that it is the exclusion of the other, it is the exclusion of the other that is the nature of the particular.

original: sgras don cha ni ci brjod ces bya ba ni don gyi cha'o //
analyzed: sgras don cha ni ci brjod ces bya ba ni don gyi cha'o //
translated: What part of the object does the word refer to?

original: de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par gyur pa ma yin pa'i dngos po las ldog pa'i sgo nas 'jug par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni don byed pa don du gnyer bas rgyu 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba ni don du
analyzed: de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par gyur pa ma yin pa'i dngos po las ldog pa'i sgo nas 'jug par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni don byed pa don du gnyer bas rgyu 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba ni don du
translated: The statement ‚Äúfrom the perspective of the opposite of a thing that is not a means of accomplishing what is to be accomplished‚Äù means that the means of accomplishing what is to be accomplished is that which is sought by one who seeks a cause, that is, who seeks to accomplish a purpose.

original: gnyer bas 'bras bu 'dod pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: gnyer bas 'bras bu 'dod pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: The result that is to be accomplished is that which is sought by one who seeks a result.

original: 'bras bu de'i sgrub par byed pa ni de sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i sgrub par byed pa ni de sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The means of accomplishing that result is the means of accomplishing it.

original: de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid thob pa ni de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid thob pa ni de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the state of being a means of accomplishing what is to be accomplished is the state of being a means of accomplishing what is to be accomplished.

original: de las bzlog pa ni de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩde las bzlog @192a * //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'o // de las bzlog @192a * //
translated: The opposite of that is the state of not being a means of accomplishing what is to be accomplished.

original: pa'i sgo nas de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par gyur pa'i dngos po la 'jug par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed par gyur pa'i dngos po la 'jug par bya ba la'o //
translated: From the perspective of the opposite of that, one engages in a thing that is a means of accomplishing what is to be accomplished.

original: de zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa las rnam par gcod pa de ma brjod na /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa las rnam par gcod pa de ma brjod na /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the exclusion of that which is other than that. If that is not expressed,

original: don byed par nus pa nyid ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don byed par nus pa nyid ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the ability to perform a function is not expressed.üîΩTherefore, since the one who seeks to perform a function must necessarilyüîΩemploy a word, it is meaningless to say that the word does not express the

original: de bas na don byed pa don du gnyer bas sgra brjod pa don med pa can yin pa de'i phyir gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don byed pa don du gnyer bas sgra brjod pa don med pa can yin pa de'i phyir gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no //
translated: object.

original: ci ste rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de yang gsal ba rnams la so sor gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba de yang gsal ba rnams la so sor gnas pa yin la /
translated: If you think that the appearance in the conceptual cognition is the individual

original: de brjod pa na dngos po'i cha kho na brjod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de brjod pa na dngos po'i cha kho na brjod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: thing, and that when it is expressed, the aspect of the thing is expressed, thenüîΩwhy is it that the conceptual cognition does not apprehend the thing?üîΩTherefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe object of conceptual cognition is a universal,‚Äù and so

original: de'i phyir rnam pa de yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa de yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that even that aspect is the object of conceptual thought.üîΩ

original: rnam par rtog pa la gsal bar snang ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la gsal bar snang ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The appearance in conceptual cognition is the thing, but it is not the individualüîΩthing.

original: gsal ba'i cha'i rjes su byed pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa la rnam par gnas pa yin te /üîΩde de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i cha'i rjes su byed pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa la rnam par gnas pa yin te /üîΩde de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The appearance that conforms to the aspect of the thing is the object of conceptual cognition.

original: don la min te don ni phyir rol na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir dang snang ba ni nang na gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don la min te don ni phyir rol na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir dang snang ba ni nang na gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in fact, it is not so, because the object exists externally, and the appearance exists internally.

original: sgra'i don yod pa nyid du khas len pa na'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sgra'i don khas len par byed pa'i rang gi sde pa gang yin pa de la 'di thal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra'i don yod pa nyid du khas len pa na'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sgra'i don khas len par byed pa'i rang gi sde pa gang yin pa de la 'di thal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one accepts that the object of the word exists, this reductio is directed at those of our own schools who accept that the object of the word exists ultimately.

original: gal te 'o na don gyi gzugs brnyan rjes su 'gro ba can de nyid sgras don yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na don gyi gzugs brnyan rjes su 'gro ba can de nyid sgras don yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the mere reflection of the object, which is concomitant with it, is the object of the word,

original: don gyi gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don gyi gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then the reflection of the object, etc.

original: gal te 'o na dngos po brjod par bya bar khas len na sgra'i don mi rung na khyed cag ci ltar sgra'i don rnam par 'jog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na dngos po brjod par bya bar khas len na sgra'i don mi rung na khyed cag ci ltar sgra'i don rnam par 'jog pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if you accept that the thing is the object of expression, and that the object of the word is not tenable, then how do you posit the object of the word?

original: de yi ngo bo sgro 'dogs rtogs //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo sgro 'dogs rtogs //
translated: The nature of that is the understanding of superimposition.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In response to this, he says,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo de la rang gi mtshan nyid du sgro btags nas de rtogs pa ni khong du chad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo de la rang gi mtshan nyid du sgro btags nas de rtogs pa ni khong du chad pa'o //
translated: Having reified the nature of the image of conceptualization as a specific characteristic, the understanding of that is the comprehension.

original: des na snang ba dang rnam par rtog par bya ba'i don gcig tu byed pas 'jug pa na gzhan las ldog pa'i don rtogs shing thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na snang ba dang rnam par rtog par bya ba'i don gcig tu byed pas 'jug pa na gzhan las ldog pa'i don rtogs shing thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, when the object of appearance and the object of conceptualization are made one, the meaning of the exclusion from other is understood and obtained when engaging.

original: de ni yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that with ‚ÄúIf that is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don dngos ni ji ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don dngos ni ji ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of designation‚Äù means that the actual meaning of the word is not tenable in any way.

original: don gyi cha la 'di rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni dngos po dag la de las gzhan pa rnam par bcad nas zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: don gyi cha la 'di rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni dngos po dag la de las gzhan pa rnam par bcad nas zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The commentary on the line ‚ÄúIt follows the aspect of the object‚Äù is ‚ÄúHaving excluded that which is other from things.‚Äù

original: de la 'jug par gyur pa na de rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'jug par gyur pa na de rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one engages in that, it follows.

original: gal te tha snyad @192b 'khrul pa yin na don dang 'bral pa ji ltar yin de'i phyir don dang 'brel pa yod na yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa rjes su dpag pa nyid du nye bar 'dogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha snyad @192b 'khrul pa yin na don dang 'bral pa ji ltar yin de'i phyir don dang 'brel pa yod na yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa rjes su dpag pa nyid du nye bar 'dogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a conventional expression that is mistaken, how can it be divorced from its object? Therefore, even if there is a connection with the object, the inference for the sake of another would not be designated as an inference.

original: 'khrul par mtshungs pa nyid yin na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra ji ltar na rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag las khyad par du 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: 'khrul par mtshungs pa nyid yin na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra ji ltar na rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag las khyad par du 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: If they are the same in being mistaken, how can the words ‚Äúimpermanent,‚Äù etc., differ from the words ‚Äúpermanent,‚Äù etc.?

original: de'i phyir don dang 'brel pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la rag las pas zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang 'brel pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la rag las pas zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven if there is a connection with the object,‚Äù etc. ‚ÄúIn dependence on‚Äù means that it comes about through the perception of a thing that is like that in some way.

original: bstan zin pa ni le'u dang por ro //
analyzed: bstan zin pa ni le'u dang por ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù in the first chapter.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda med pas rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de nyid la brdar byed pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda med pas rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de nyid la brdar byed pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no convention in regard to the intrinsic identity, the convention is made in regard to that representation of the object.

original: ji ltar brdar btags pa bzhin du tha snyad kyi dus na yang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan nyid rnam par rtog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar brdar btags pa bzhin du tha snyad kyi dus na yang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan nyid rnam par rtog pa ma yin nam /
translated: Just as it is designated, is the representation of conceptualization not a conceptual image even at the time of conventional usage?

original: 'khrul pas snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed pas phyi rol la yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pas snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed pas phyi rol la yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since delusion makes what appears and what is imagined to be one, it is not external.

original: de'i phyir gang gi phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa po tha snyad kyi dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa po tha snyad kyi dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause of the conventional usage of the one who designates at the time of convention, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du brda'i dus na yang snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag la yang gcig nyid du zhen pas rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la yang brda byed pa na /
analyzed: 'di skad du brda'i dus na yang snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag la yang gcig nyid du zhen pas rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la yang brda byed pa na /
translated: This is what is said: Even at the time of the designation, since one adheres to the identity of what appears and what is imagined, when one designates a conceptual image,

original: 'khrul pas phyir rol rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pas phyir rol rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one understands the external through delusion.

original: de bas na ji ltar brdar btags pa bzhin du zhen pa tha snyad kyi dus na yang zhen pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar brdar btags pa bzhin du zhen pa tha snyad kyi dus na yang zhen pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that just as it is designated, the adherence arises at the time of convention.

original: brjod par bya ba'i don rnam par bcad par 'gyur pa las zhes bya ba la shing ma yin pa gzhan las rnam par bcad pa na shing la sogs pa gang yin pa sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i don rnam par bcad par 'gyur pa las zhes bya ba la shing ma yin pa gzhan las rnam par bcad pa na shing la sogs pa gang yin pa sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúfrom the exclusion of the object of expression‚Äù is this: when there is the exclusion of other, which is not a tree, then whatever is a tree, etc., is the object of expression of the word.

original: shing la sogs pa ma yin pa gzhan la sgra ma mthong ba'i rgyu yis sgra la dngos po rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa ma yin pa gzhan la sgra ma mthong ba'i rgyu yis sgra la dngos po rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because of the non-perception of the word in other, which is not a tree, etc., the thing is understood from the word.

original: gang la med pa de rnam par bcad nas dngos po ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la med pa de rnam par bcad nas dngos po ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when the non-existent is excluded, the thing is indicated.

original: skyes bu'i zhen pa'i dbang gis de skad du brjod kyi sgra las dngos po rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i zhen pa'i dbang gis de skad du brjod kyi sgra las dngos po rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is said by the power of the human imagination, but the thing is not understood from the word.

original: 'dis ni ldog pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldog pa bshad do //
translated: This explains the exclusion.

original: la lar de mthong la ltos phyir //
analyzed: la lar de mthong la ltos phyir //
translated: Because it is seen in some places and not in others.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the positive concomitance.

original: de ltar gyi shing la sogs pa zhes bya ba la da ltar smos pa ni don nye ba nyid yod pa nyid du bstan par nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyi shing la sogs pa zhes bya ba la da ltar smos pa ni don nye ba nyid yod pa nyid du bstan par nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, wood, etc. The present tense is used to show that the meaning is close at hand, because it is able to show existence.

original: phyogs gcig smos pa rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig smos pa rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin pa bstan te /
translated: The mention of one part indicates that the extension is not primary.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nyid kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang phyogs @193a * //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nyid kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro // gang phyogs @193a * //
translated: Because the meaning is understood through the door of exclusion.

original: gcig la yang de las ldog pa la zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa la sogs pa las ldog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig la yang de las ldog pa la zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa la sogs pa las ldog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, in one part means in what is not wood, etc. The meaning is in what is excluded from what is not wood, etc.

original: de las rnam par gcod pa'i don de zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa ni shing la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de las rnam par gcod pa'i don de zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa ni shing la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The meaning of exclusion from that is that. The exclusion of what is not wood, etc. is of wood, etc.

original: gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa ston pa 'dis ni sgra 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa ston pa 'dis ni sgra 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: By this teaching of the exclusion of others, sound is shown to have a result.

original: de lta ma yin na sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the use of sound would be fruitless.

original: de lta ma yin na de ni dngos po la mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brjod par bya ba'i don las rigs mi mthun pa ma mthong ba la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de ni dngos po la mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brjod par bya ba'i don las rigs mi mthun pa ma mthong ba la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Otherwise, it would be necessary to supply the words ‚Äúin relation to the object to be expressed‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúit is not tenable in regard to the thing itself.‚Äù

original: shing la sogs pa'i don rnam par gcod par gyur pa phyogs gcig po la lar mthong ba la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i don rnam par gcod par gyur pa phyogs gcig po la lar mthong ba la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the exclusion of such things as trees is based on the observation of a single part.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa snga ma nyid rjes su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa snga ma nyid rjes su bstan to //
translated: This shows that the positive and negative concomitances are already established.

original: 'brel pa byas pa las zhes bya ba ni brdar byas pa las so //
analyzed: 'brel pa byas pa las zhes bya ba ni brdar byas pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the connection‚Äù means from the convention.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa des zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa des zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that which is the basis of the connection‚Äù means

original: rigs la sogs pa 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pas /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pas /
translated: from the basis of the connection, such as the universal.

original: gang kho na las don gang la mnyan par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gang kho na las don gang la mnyan par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom which one hears the meaning‚Äù means from which one hears the object.

original: rigs la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i rdzas de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no zhes de skad du brjod pa'i drang srong la bya'i bu la sogs pa rdzas tshig gi don can gyi gzhung spong ba'i sgo nas bshad do //üîΩrigs la sogs pa de dag la gang kho na las mnyan par 'gyur zhes sbyar te /üîΩrigs la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i rdzas de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no zhes de skad du /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i rdzas de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no zhes de skad du brjod pa'i drang srong la bya'i bu la sogs pa rdzas tshig gi don can gyi gzhung spong ba'i sgo nas bshad do // rigs la sogs pa de dag la gang kho na las mnyan par 'gyur zhes sbyar te / rigs la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i rdzas de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no zhes de skad du /
translated: The substance indicated by the class and so on is the meaning of the statement, and this is the teaching of the sage, the son of Aruna, who rejects the scriptural system that takes substance as the meaning of the word.üîΩThe substance indicated by the class and so on is the meaning of the statement, and this is the teaching of the sage, the son of Aruna, who rejects the scriptural system that takes substance as the meaning of the word.üîΩThe substance indicated by the class and so on is the meaning of the statement, and this is the teaching of the sage, the son of Aruna, who rejects the scriptural system that takes substance as the meaning of the word.

original: drang srong rta'i bu rigs tshig gi don can gyi gzhung spong ba'i sgo nas 'di bstan to //üîΩde dang 'brel pa dag la zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i 'brel pa dag la ste /
analyzed: drang srong rta'i bu rigs tshig gi don can gyi gzhung spong ba'i sgo nas 'di bstan to // de dang 'brel pa dag la zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i 'brel pa dag la ste /
translated: The substance indicated by the class and so on is the meaning of the statement, and this is the teaching of the sage, the son of Aruna, who rejects the scriptural system that takes substance as the meaning of the word.

original: sgas 'brel pa brjod pa yin no zhes de skad du ston pa gang yin pa de dag bsal ba'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: sgas 'brel pa brjod pa yin no zhes de skad du ston pa gang yin pa de dag bsal ba'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: The substance indicated by the class and so on is the meaning of the statement, and this is the teaching of the sage, the son of Aruna, who rejects the scriptural system that takes substance as the meaning of the word.

original: rigs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / sgra'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / sgra'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three kinds of conceptualization are conceptualization of class, etc., conceptualization associated with conceptualization of class, etc., and conceptualization of sound.üîΩBy the reason stated earlier means

original: sngar bshad pa'i rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: by the teaching:

original: khyad par dang ni khyad par gzhi //
analyzed: khyad par dang ni khyad par gzhi //
translated: distinctions, the basis of distinctions,

original: 'brel dang 'jig rten gzhung lugs ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas so //üîΩmthong ba sre byed bdag nyid can //
analyzed: 'brel dang 'jig rten gzhung lugs ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas so // mthong ba sre byed bdag nyid can //
translated: connections, and the systems of the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na sgra dmigs pa gang @193b yin pa de sbyor ba ni mthong ba bsre bar byed pa'o //üîΩ'dzin pa gang la de'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na sgra dmigs pa gang @193b yin pa de sbyor ba ni mthong ba bsre bar byed pa'o // 'dzin pa gang la de'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The seeing is the mixing of the self means that the object of the word that is perceived at the time of the convention is the seeing that mixes the application.

original: rang bzhin yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The grasping is the self of that means that the nature of that is the existence of that nature.

original: de nyid ni mthong ba sbyor bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni mthong ba sbyor bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is what is explained by the words: ‚ÄúIt has the nature of the seeing that mixes the application,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtogs pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is understanding?

original: sngon nyams su myong ba rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sngon nyams su myong ba rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe expression of what was previously experienced,‚Äù and so on.

original: der zhen pas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i don du zhen pa ste /
analyzed: der zhen pas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i don du zhen pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy attachment to that‚Äù means attachment to the past object.

original: don gang la sgra brdar btags pa de nyid da ltar gyi don yin no zhes de ltar mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gang la sgra brdar btags pa de nyid da ltar gyi don yin no zhes de ltar mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one is attached to the idea that the object to which a word is applied is the present object.

original: de'i byed pa la de'i yul gyi byed pa'i nus pas khyab pa yin pa la de dang 'gal ba yang nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i byed pa la de'i yul gyi byed pa'i nus pas khyab pa yin pa la de dang 'gal ba yang nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is that the activity of that is the activity of its object. The contradictory of that is the absence of capacity. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: rnam par rtog pa des zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs de las 'das pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs pa gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa des zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs de las 'das pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs pa gang yin pa des so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that conception‚Äù means by the understanding of the object that has passed beyond that state.

original: don de zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyi don mig gis gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don de zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyi don mig gis gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat object‚Äù is the object as it is, which is to be apprehended by the eye.

original: mthong ba'i rang bzhin yod na yang de zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rang bzhin yod na yang de zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: If the nature of the seen exists, that is the second conception.

original: de brda zhes bya ba la brda ni sgra nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de brda zhes bya ba la brda ni sgra nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word that refers to the word itself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sang bar gyur pa'i don gyi ming 'dzin pas zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sang bar gyur pa'i don gyi ming 'dzin pas zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do /
translated: For this very reason, it is explained by grasping the name of the object that has become distant.

original: brjod pa med pa can gyi don ni mig gis gsal bar 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod pa med pa can gyi don ni mig gis gsal bar 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning without expression is clearly grasped by the eye - this is the meaning.

original: de'i tshe des na skra'i don gyi yul can nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dbang po'i yul la yang sgra 'jug pa de'i tshe dbang po'i don yang sgra'i don yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe des na skra'i don gyi yul can nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dbang po'i yul la yang sgra 'jug pa de'i tshe dbang po'i don yang sgra'i don yin te /
translated: At that time, therefore, it is the object of the meaning of hair means that when the word also enters the object of the sense faculty, at that time the object of the sense faculty is also the meaning of the word.

original: dbang po las skyes pa gang la yul de yod pa de dag ni sgra'i don gyi yul can yin la /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa gang la yul de yod pa de dag ni sgra'i don gyi yul can yin la /
translated: Those that arise from the sense faculty and have that object are the object of the meaning of the word.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de des so //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de des so //
translated: That very thing is that, and by that.

original: gal te dbang po'i don rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'jug pa de tsam gyis phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i don rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'jug pa de tsam gyis phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: If the object of the sense faculty is the intrinsic identity of sound, then how could the consciousness that arises from the sense faculty, which depends on the proximity of the external object, engage in accordance with desire?

original: sgra'i don gyi yul can yin na yang spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi dbang po'i shes pa 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa mi rigs paüîΩma yin nam /
analyzed: sgra'i don gyi yul can yin na yang spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi dbang po'i shes pa 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even if the object of the word is the object of the sense faculty, it is not tenable that the sense consciousness that has intrinsic identity as its object engages in accordance with desire, since any conceptual consciousness that has a universal as its object engages in accordance with desire.

original: 'di skad du gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sgra'i don yin pa de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i skra'i don bzhin du sgra'i shes pa la snang bar 'gyur zheng sgra'i shes pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don ma @194a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sgra'i don yin pa de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i skra'i don bzhin du sgra'i shes pa la snang bar 'gyur zheng sgra'i shes pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don ma @194a * //
translated: If the intrinsic identity is the object of the word, then it would appear to the consciousness of the word, just like the object of the word ‚Äúhair‚Äù would.

original: yin no // sgra ni 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa de yang sgra bzhin du 'dod pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin no // sgra ni 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa de yang sgra bzhin du 'dod pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because sound is the cause of mere desire, that cognition, like sound, would have desire as its cause.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa la sgra'i don nyid du dbang po'i don snang bar gyur pa na yang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan bzhin du 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa la sgra'i don nyid du dbang po'i don snang bar gyur pa na yang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan bzhin du 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the object of a sense faculty appears as the meaning of a sound in such a cognition, it would be the cause of mere desire, like a conceptual image.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i sgra don la 'jug par gyur pa na 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ro snyam sems so //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i sgra don la 'jug par gyur pa na 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ro snyam sems so //
translated: When one engages with the meaning of such a sound, it would be the cause of mere desire.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don 'das su zin kyang bdag nyid kyi dpyad nas brda byed par 'gyur ro zhes sngar ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don 'das su zin kyang bdag nyid kyi dpyad nas brda byed par 'gyur ro zhes sngar ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Regarding the past, etc., as previously explained, even though the sound and meaning have passed, one can still make a convention by analyzing oneself.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni don 'das pa dang chod pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni don 'das pa dang chod pa bzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes past and obstructed objects.

original: sgra 'god pa yang spyod yul gyi dngos po 'das pa dang zhig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sgra 'god pa yang spyod yul gyi dngos po 'das pa dang zhig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The term ‚Äúsound‚Äù is also applied to things that are past and destroyed, etc.

original: spyod yul gyi dngos po 'das pa dang zhig pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: spyod yul gyi dngos po 'das pa dang zhig pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpast and destroyed, etc.‚Äù is a disjunctive compound.

original: chod pa dang phra ba nyid kyi spyod yul gyi dngos po las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chod pa dang phra ba nyid kyi spyod yul gyi dngos po las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is past in the sense that the object of the sense faculty has passed beyond the sense faculty, and it is destroyed in the sense that the object of the sense faculty has been destroyed.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma skyes pa nyid bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma skyes pa nyid bzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the unborn.

original: rnam pa 'dis ni dbang po'i yul las 'das pa yin na ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis ni dbang po'i yul las 'das pa yin na ste /
translated: In this way, the object is beyond the range of the sense faculties.

original: dbang pos 'dzin par rung ba nyid dang bral ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang pos 'dzin par rung ba nyid dang bral ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is devoid of the capacity to be grasped by the sense faculties.

original: de las so sor nges pa nyid la de 'das pa nyid yod na mi 'gyur bas khyab pa yin pa de dang 'gal ba yang 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las so sor nges pa nyid la de 'das pa nyid yod na mi 'gyur bas khyab pa yin pa de dang 'gal ba yang 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: If it were to exist as something that is past, it would not be so. Therefore, it is pervaded by the opposite of that. It would also be the opposite of that. Thus, there is the observation of an incompatible pervasion.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi blo mthong ba ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi blo mthong ba ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the cognition that perceives form, etc.?

original: de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not seeing, because there is no conceptualization on the part of the subject.

original: mngon sum thams cad ni gzhan gyi rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad ni gzhan gyi rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod do //
translated: For all direct perception is held to be accompanied by the conceptualization of another.

original: blo rtog pa med pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: blo rtog pa med pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: The nonconceptual cognition is indicated by ‚Äúit is not like this, etc.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like‚Äù means just like the external object.

original: de 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'o //üîΩgzugs bzhin du gzugs mthong ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'o // gzugs bzhin du gzugs mthong ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúIts engagement‚Äù is the conceptual cognition.üîΩ‚ÄúIn the seeing of form, etc., just like form‚Äù means

original: ji ltar gzugs dang gzugs zhes de la bu'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de bzhin du gzugs mthong ba la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs dang gzugs zhes de la bu'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de bzhin du gzugs mthong ba la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: just as the conceptualization of form and form engages in that, so it is not in the seeing of form. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na mthong ba la nyams su myong ba la ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs mthong ba'i dus na mthong na yang nyams su myong bar mi 'dod pa de'i tshe mthong ba ste mthong ba'i yul la nyams su myong ba ma grub pas
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba la nyams su myong ba la ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs mthong ba'i dus na mthong na yang nyams su myong bar mi 'dod pa de'i tshe mthong ba ste mthong ba'i yul la nyams su myong ba ma grub pas
translated: Thus, ‚Äúthat which is not established in experience for one who sees‚Äù means that if one does not accept that one experiences what one sees, then one does not establish the experience of the object that is seen.

original: so // ba'i gzugs mthong @194b pa ni de nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: so // ba'i gzugs mthong @194b pa ni de nyid yin zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the seeing of form‚Äù means that is the seeing of form.

original: ba'i gzugs mthong ba ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khyad par gyis gzugs mthong ba du ma nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir lan gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: ba'i gzugs mthong ba ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khyad par gyis gzugs mthong ba du ma nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir lan gnyis brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the seeing of form‚Äù is stated twice in order to show that there are many kinds of seeing form due to the differences in the object.

original: yang na nga'i gzugs mthong ba ni de lta bu'i don gyi rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba de nyid yin zhing nga'i gzugs mthong ba ni nang gi dga' ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: yang na nga'i gzugs mthong ba ni de lta bu'i don gyi rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba de nyid yin zhing nga'i gzugs mthong ba ni nang gi dga' ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'di yin no //
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äúthat is the seeing of my form‚Äù means that is the seeing of form in the sense of the object. ‚ÄúThat is the seeing of my form‚Äù means that is the seeing of form that is accompanied by inner joy and so on.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa 'di yang yul mthong ba'i yul can gyi shes pa dran pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa 'di yang yul mthong ba'i yul can gyi shes pa dran pa nyid yin no //
translated: This explanation is also a memory of the consciousness that is the subject that sees the object.

original: gzhan dag ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa mngon sum nyid yin par 'dod pa de bas na de'i ngo bor khyod nyid 'dod pa'i mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid 'jug par mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa mngon sum nyid yin par 'dod pa de bas na de'i ngo bor khyod nyid 'dod pa'i mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid 'jug par mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Others assert that conceptual cognition is direct perception. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf direct perception that you yourself accept as conceptual does not engage‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te khyod nyid kyi gzhung gis gzugs mthong ba la nyams su myong ba ma yin na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum yang 'jug par mi 'gyur na rnam par rtog pa de yang snang ste de ni rig par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te khyod nyid kyi gzhung gis gzugs mthong ba la nyams su myong ba ma yin na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum yang 'jug par mi 'gyur na rnam par rtog pa de yang snang ste de ni rig par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If, according to your own texts, seeing form is not experience, then direct perception that is conceptual also does not engage, because that conception appears, for it is what is to be cognized.

original: rgyu de bas na de nyams su myong ba yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyu de bas na de nyams su myong ba yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: For that reason, it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, it is said that it exists as experience‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na blo'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa med na blo me 'dzin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na blo'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa med na blo me 'dzin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the previously explained errors would occur‚Äù means that if there is no conceptual cognition of the object of the mind at the time of apprehending form, it follows that the mind does not apprehend form.

analyzed: de bas na blo'i yul can gyi nyams su myong ba rtog pa med par 'gyur ro //

original: gal te de'i gnas skabs na blo mngon sum nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i gnas skabs na blo mngon sum nyid ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de mngon sum nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na gzugs mthong ba'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na gzugs mthong ba'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te shes pa nyams su myong ba yang rtogs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: de nyid kyis myong yin na ni //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /

translated: When form is apprehended as ‚Äúform,‚Äù there is the experience of the cognition of form that is connected with conceptualization.

analyzed: de yang shes pa gnyis pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: gzugs kyi blo gang gis zhes bya @195a * //
