analyzed: 'das pa ni rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i ngang tshul can med pa nyid du'o //
translated: The past is the state of abiding in one‚Äôs continuum, but it is not existent.

original: rnam pa gzhan du bdag nyid so sor rang gis rig pas nyams su myong ba can gyi blo zhes bya ba ni so sor rang gis rig pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du bdag nyid so sor rang gis rig pas nyams su myong ba can gyi blo zhes bya ba ni so sor rang gis rig pa ste /
translated: In another way, the cognition that is experienced by reflexive awareness is called ‚Äúreflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: rang rig pas nyams su myong ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩmngon sum rtog pa med pa yang rang rig pa ma yin par smra ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba mngon sum tog pa med pa yang rang rig par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rang rig pas nyams su myong ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // mngon sum rtog pa med pa yang rang rig pa ma yin par smra ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba mngon sum tog pa med pa yang rang rig par mi 'dod de /
translated: That which has reflexive awareness and experience is called that.üîΩNonconceptual perception is not reflexive awareness.

original: shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika of our own Buddhist tradition does not assert that nonconceptual perception is reflexive awareness because they assert that consciousness is experienced by another consciousness.

original: 'das pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gnag gi tshe da ltar gyi gzugs mthong ba de'i tshe re zhig de mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gnag gi tshe da ltar gyi gzugs mthong ba de'i tshe re zhig de mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: Seeing past form and so on is seeing form that exists in the present.

original: gzhan gyi la gzugs dang shes pa la cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi la gzugs dang shes pa la cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because in the other, the form and consciousness are not simultaneously conceived.

original: / rang rig pa ni rang gi sde pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rang rig pa ni rang gi sde pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the self-knowing is accepted by our own schools.

original: shes pa la shes pa cig car 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa la shes pa cig car 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no feeling that is the nature of consciousness occurring simultaneously with consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe phyis 'byung ba ste 'dzin par byed de shes pa'i skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyis 'byung ba ste 'dzin par byed de shes pa'i skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When it occurs later, it is the apprehending, the arising of consciousness,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mthong pa 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mthong pa 'das pa yin no //
translated: at that time the seeing of form, etc., is past.

original: chos can shes pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba la /
analyzed: chos can shes pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba la /
translated: In the inference of the existence of consciousness,

original: de yod pa'i rtags thams cad kyi rten ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yod pa'i rtags thams cad kyi rten ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: the basis of all the reasons would not be established,

original: chos can shes pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can shes pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of consciousness itself would not be established.

original: chos can dang 'brel pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos can dang 'brel pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid do //
translated: The property of the subject is the relation to the subject.

original: gzugs la sogs pa thag nye ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni da ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa thag nye ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni da ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit has the character of conforming to the proximity of form, etc.‚Äù means that it conforms to the form, etc., that is, the reflection of form, etc., that is present.

original: de ltar na don 'gags par 'gyur bas rang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa de'i phyir shes pa de la gzugs la sogs pa thag nye ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na don 'gags par 'gyur bas rang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa de'i phyir shes pa de la gzugs la sogs pa thag nye ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, since the object has ceased, it generates a cognition that has the form of itself. Therefore, the cognition is said to ‚Äúconform to the proximity of form, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe myur du @195b mthong ba mang po zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dbang po'i shes pa nyid rgyun du skye ba na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe myur du @195b mthong ba mang po zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe dbang po'i shes pa nyid rgyun du skye ba na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen there is a rapid succession of perceptions‚Äù means when there is a continuous arising of the sensory cognitions.

original: rang yul can rnam shes nyams myong zhes bya ba ni blo'i yul can no //
analyzed: rang yul can rnam shes nyams myong zhes bya ba ni blo'i yul can no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe experience of the consciousness that has its own object‚Äù means the experience of the object by the mind.

original: de'i tshe de ltar yul 'dzin pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni yul nyams su myong ba ni rang nyams su myong ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de ltar yul 'dzin pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni yul nyams su myong ba ni rang nyams su myong ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat that time, although it apprehends the object in that way‚Äù means that the experience of the object is in accordance with the experience of itself.

original: de gal te rtog pa dang bral ba rig pa yin pa de bas na yul nyams su myong ba yang de ltar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de gal te rtog pa dang bral ba rig pa yin pa de bas na yul nyams su myong ba yang de ltar grub pa yin no //
translated: If that is cognition free from conceptual thought, then the experience of the object is established in the same way.

original: sgra'i yul gang yin pa de ni rtog pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sgra'i yul gang yin pa de ni rtog pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the object of sound is conceptual thought.

original: rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin na ni snang ba gsal ba can du 'gyur na gsal bar snang ba can yin na ni rtog pa nyid yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin na ni snang ba gsal ba can du 'gyur na gsal bar snang ba can yin na ni rtog pa nyid yin par mi rigs so //
translated: If the object of the intrinsic identity of conceptual thought were to have a clear appearance, then it would not be reasonable for it to be conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rjes su 'brel pa la gsal bar snang ba can nyid 'gal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rjes su 'brel pa la gsal bar snang ba can nyid 'gal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears to be contradictory for that which is associated with conceptual thought to have a clear appearance.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa mi gsal bar snang ba can spyi nyid la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa mi gsal bar snang ba can spyi nyid la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, conceptual thought has as its object the universal, which has an unclear appearance.

original: de ltar ma yin na rgyu med pa can nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni spyi 'dra ba las kyang de 'dra bar 'byung na rgyu'i chos kyi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na rgyu med pa can nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni spyi 'dra ba las kyang de 'dra bar 'byung na rgyu'i chos kyi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to arise in a similar way from a similar universal, then it would be a causeless effect, because it would not conform to the cause.

original: dngos po la yang brda byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi dus na dngos po nye bar mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir de la brda byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la yang brda byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi dus na dngos po nye bar mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir de la brda byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it designated in regard to the thing, because at the time of the convention, the thing is not present, and because it does not appear in the cognition that arises from the word.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dngos po la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dngos po la'o //
translated: In regard to that means in regard to the thing.

original: tha snyad kyi dus na sgra dang don sbyor ba'i brda dran pa ni rgyu yin pa de 'di la med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa la de'i tshe nus par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus na sgra dang don sbyor ba'i brda dran pa ni rgyu yin pa de 'di la med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa la de'i tshe nus par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The memory of the convention that connects the word and the object is the cause at the time of the convention, and that does not exist in this case.üîΩThus, the non-apprehension of the cause is the reason. At that time, it would be able to be said that the thing is not perceived.

original: brda dran pa la ltos pa yod na gzugs thag nye bar kyang re zhig dbang po'i shes pa skyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brda dran pa la ltos pa yod na gzugs thag nye bar kyang re zhig dbang po'i shes pa skyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If there is dependence on the memory of a sign, then even when the form is near, the sense consciousness is not produced for a while.

original: 'on kyang dang por dran pa nyid skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang dang por dran pa nyid skyed par byed do //
translated: However, first it produces memory itself.

original: de bas na don de ni dngos su dran pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi shes pa'i zhi ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don de ni dngos su dran pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi shes pa'i zhi ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that object becomes the direct cause of memory, not of consciousness.

original: dran pa las dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur bas gdon mi za bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'di ni gang gi tshe dbang po'i shes pa dran pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa de'i tshe don thag nye ba'i dbang gis ba skyed pa
analyzed: dran pa las dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur bas gdon mi za bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'di ni gang gi tshe dbang po'i shes pa dran pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa de'i tshe don thag nye ba'i dbang gis ba skyed pa
translated: Since the sense consciousness arises from memory, it is not necessarily produced by the power of the object. This is the intended meaning. When the sense consciousness is caused by memory, then by the power of the nearness of the object,

original: can ma yin no //
analyzed: can ma yin no //
translated: it is not produced.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa tsam sngon du song ba'i shes pa 'dod pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa yod pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa tsam sngon du song ba'i shes pa 'dod pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa yod pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because there is engagement and disengagement preceded by mere conceptual cognition, it is not necessarily produced. This is what is said.

original: ci'i @196a * //üîΩphyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i @196a * //üîΩphyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha dad med phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis skad cig ma nyid ma yin par khas blangs pa la brten nas bstan to //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis skad cig ma nyid ma yin par khas blangs pa la brten nas bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are not different‚Äù is stated in dependence on the opponent‚Äôs assertion that they are not momentary.

original: khyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
analyzed: khyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no difference in the designation‚Äù

original: zhes bya de ni mdo yin la //
analyzed: zhes bya de ni mdo yin la //
translated: is the s≈´tra.

original: skad cig ma nyid dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs dag gi skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la sbyar nas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs dag gi skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la sbyar nas 'chad par byed do //
translated: Because it is the context of the positions of momentariness and non-momentariness, it is explained by applying it to both positions.

original: re zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs ni rtag pa'i phyogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: re zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs ni rtag pa'i phyogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor bar byed do //
translated: First, the position of non-momentariness is applied to the position of permanence by ‚Äúalso‚Äù and so on.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang skad cig ma'i phyogs la skad cig ma snga phyi'i khyad par nyid kyi rnam par gnyi ga sbyor bar byed do//
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang skad cig ma'i phyogs la skad cig ma snga phyi'i khyad par nyid kyi rnam par gnyi ga sbyor bar byed do//
translated: Or by ‚Äúalso‚Äù and so on, the difference between earlier and later moments is applied to both positions of momentariness and non-momentariness.

original: de la khyad par gyi ngo bo ma bzung ba la brda yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dbang po'i shes pas skad cig ma gnyis pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bshad pa de'i phyir skad cig ma dang po ma bzung ba la brda
analyzed: de la khyad par gyi ngo bo ma bzung ba la brda yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dbang po'i shes pas skad cig ma gnyis pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bshad pa de'i phyir skad cig ma dang po ma bzung ba la brda
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere is no convention for that which is not apprehended as a specific nature‚Äù means that since it is explained that the sense consciousness apprehends the second moment,

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no convention for the first moment that is not apprehended.

original: don bzung ba la 'di'i 'di rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i brda 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: don bzung ba la 'di'i 'di rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i brda 'thad pa yin no //
translated: It is tenable to say that the convention ‚ÄúThis is the expression of that object‚Äù is for the apprehension of the object.

original: khyad par gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni brda med pa'i rgyu gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni brda med pa'i rgyu gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúA specific nature‚Äù is the second reason for the absence of a convention.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda byed pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda byed pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to make a convention in regard to a specific characteristic.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brdar ma byas pa'i don sngon gyi brda la dmigs pa'i dran pas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brdar ma byas pa'i don sngon gyi brda la dmigs pa'i dran pas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat also is not logical‚Äù means that the object that is not made into a convention is not apprehended by memory that observes the previous convention.

original: don gyi sgra ni yul brjod pa dang dgos pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyi sgra ni yul brjod pa dang dgos pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word object refers to the expression of the object and the expression of the purpose.

original: de phyogs kyi bye brag gis 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: de phyogs kyi bye brag gis 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: In regard to that, the explanation is by way of a specific direction.

original: don can gang zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can no //
analyzed: don can gang zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù is the object of a universal.

original: phyogs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar smra ba'i phyogs dang po la ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar smra ba'i phyogs dang po la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe second position‚Äù is in relation to the first position of the proponents of momentariness.

original: skad cig ma'i phyogs la skad cig ma dang po gang yin pa de dran pa skyed par byed par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang 'chad pa'i de nyid skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la ltos nas gnyis par bshad do //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyogs la skad cig ma dang po gang yin pa de dran pa skyed par byed par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang 'chad pa'i de nyid skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la ltos nas gnyis par bshad do //
translated: In the position of momentariness, the first moment is asserted to be the producer of memory, and so on. That which is explained is called the second in relation to the position that is not momentary.

original: phyogs de la dran pa yul med pa can yin te /
analyzed: phyogs de la dran pa yul med pa can yin te /
translated: In that position, memory is without an object.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po'i yul can de khyad par gyi ngo bo ma bzung ba de la brda med pa'i phyir brdar ma byas pa la dran pa'i yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po'i yul can de khyad par gyi ngo bo ma bzung ba de la brda med pa'i phyir brdar ma byas pa la dran pa'i yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the object of the first moment is not apprehended as the nature of a particular, and since there is no convention in relation to that, memory does not exist as an object of a convention that has not been made.

original: de'i yul skad cig ma gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i yul skad cig ma gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the object of the second moment.

original: de ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang brdar ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang brdar ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is not the cause and because the convention has not been made.

original: gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar smra ba'i phyogs gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar smra ba'i phyogs gnyis pa ste /
translated: The third is the second position of the proponents of momentariness.

original: yang na phyis 'byung ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin @196b pa la'o //
analyzed: yang na phyis 'byung ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin @196b pa la'o //
translated: Or else, it is the one that is explained by ‚Äúthe subsequent moment that occurs‚Äù and so on.

original: rtag pa'i phyogs la ltos nas de nyid gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyogs la ltos nas de nyid gsum pa yin no //
translated: In relation to the position of permanence, it is the third.

original: gang gis dgos pa yin zhes bya ba de la 'bras bu med pa can te /
analyzed: gang gis dgos pa yin zhes bya ba de la 'bras bu med pa can te /
translated: With regard to ‚Äúfor what purpose,‚Äù it is purposeless.

original: 'di ltar phyis 'byung ba'i skad cig ma shes pas 'dzin par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyis 'byung ba'i skad cig ma shes pas 'dzin par 'dod na /
translated: Thus, if it is asserted that the subsequent moment that occurs is apprehended by consciousness,

original: des dran pa bskyed pa ma yin pa de bas na de dran pa'i yul ma yin pa de ltar na de la dran pa 'bras bu med pa can yin no //
analyzed: des dran pa bskyed pa ma yin pa de bas na de dran pa'i yul ma yin pa de ltar na de la dran pa 'bras bu med pa can yin no //
translated: it does not generate memory. Therefore, it is not the object of memory. In that case, memory is purposeless.

original: de yang de ma thag tu bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang de ma thag tu bshad zin to //
translated: Moreover, that has already been explained immediately preceding.

original: gnyis ka yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul yang ma yin zhing dgos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul yang ma yin zhing dgos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNeither‚Äù means neither the object nor the purpose.

original: phyogs gsum pa'i skyon gang yin pa de nyid dang po'i phyogs la yang skyon du brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa'i skyon gang yin pa de nyid dang po'i phyogs la yang skyon du brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever fault there is in the third position, that same fault should be stated with regard to the first position,

original: don rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad par ma brjod do //
analyzed: don rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad par ma brjod do //
translated: because the meaning is understood, it is not stated separately.üîΩAnd the distinction is also apprehended.

original: khyad par yang 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa rnam par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par yang 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa rnam par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the sense consciousness that has the aspect of its own character is ascertained.

original: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
translated: Direct perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: It is established by direct perception itself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /üîΩde phyir mig dang gzugs dag la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas / de phyir mig dang gzugs dag la //
translated: And so on, up to:

original: brten nas mig blo skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: brten nas mig blo skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i rnam 'grel gyi gzhung gis tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung ji tsam bshad pa de bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i rnam 'grel gyi gzhung gis tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung ji tsam bshad pa de bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the passage from the Compendium of Valid Cognition up to the conclusion of the text of the Thorough Exposition.

original: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
translated: Direct perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: zhes bya ba skabs su byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba skabs su byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having made this the topic, it says and so on.

original: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
translated: It is direct perception, free from conceptual thought.

original: ming dang rigs sogs sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: ming dang rigs sogs sbyor bar byed //
translated: It is applied to names, universals, etc.

original: kha cig na re sgra ni don dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sgra ni don dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that a word is the reason for the connection with the object.

original: gzhan dag ni don gyis stong pa'i sgra dag gis khyad par can gyi don brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni don gyis stong pa'i sgra dag gis khyad par can gyi don brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that words, which are empty of objects, express objects that are qualified.

original: gang la rtog pa de dag med pa de ni mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba gzhung 'di tsam bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la rtog pa de dag med pa de ni mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba gzhung 'di tsam bshad pa yin no //
translated: The passage is merely to the effect that that which is free from those conceptual thoughts is direct perception.

original: de ltar na rtog pa rnam pa gsum ston par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na rtog pa rnam pa gsum ston par mdzad pa na /
translated: Thus, when it teaches the three kinds of conceptual thought,

original: rigs la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnam pa gsum ston par byed pa'i gzhung don gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnam pa gsum ston par byed pa'i gzhung don gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: the passage that teaches the three kinds of conceptual thought with regard to universals, etc., is explained by the commentary.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don gyis bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don gyis bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is explained by the meaning.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir //
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir //
translated: But why?

original: gnyi ga la rag las pas skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pas da bshad par bya ba'i gzhung 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gnyi ga la rag las pas skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pas da bshad par bya ba'i gzhung 'chad par byed do //
translated: The passage to be explained is explained by the words, ‚Äúbecause it arises in dependence on both,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po'i shes pa de'i go bar byed pa dbang po'i sgo nas tha snyad du byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa de'i go bar byed pa dbang po'i sgo nas tha snyad du byed pa yin nam /
translated: Is it the sense consciousness that is the means of understanding that is conventionally designated as the sense faculty?

original: 'on te yul gyi sgo nas yin zhes de ltar dbang pa'i shes pa ston @197a * //üîΩbar byed pa'i skabs su go bar byed pa nyid de ni dbang po'i sgra las yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yul gyi sgo nas yin zhes de ltar dbang pa'i shes pa ston @197a * // bar byed pa'i skabs su go bar byed pa nyid de ni dbang po'i sgra las yod pa yin no //
translated: Is the term ‚Äúsense perception‚Äù used to refer to the sense faculty that causes the sense consciousness to understand, or is it used to refer to the object?üîΩIn this way, when the sense consciousness is being taught, the term ‚Äúsense perception‚Äù is used because it causes understanding, and the term ‚Äúsense‚Äù is used because it exists as the cause.

original: de ltar na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa na the tshom med par dbang po'i shes pa nyid shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa na the tshom med par dbang po'i shes pa nyid shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the term ‚Äúsense consciousness‚Äù is used, it is understood without doubt that it is a sense consciousness.

original: de skad du bstan pa na shes par 'dod pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du bstan pa na shes par 'dod pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is taught in this way, the object that is desired to be understood is realized.

original: de bas na mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rigs pa yin gyi yul gyi shes pa zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rigs pa yin gyi yul gyi shes pa zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is reasonable, but ‚Äúobject consciousness‚Äù is not.

original: de ltar brjod pa na nges par dbang po'i shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa na nges par dbang po'i shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is expressed in this way, it is definitely understood to be a sense consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang yul gyi rnam par shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni yul la brten pa yin no zhes tha snyad du bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang yul gyi rnam par shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni yul la brten pa yin no zhes tha snyad du bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness is also the consciousness of the object, and therefore it is not conventionally said that it is based on the object.üîΩMaster DignƒÅga, when explaining the meaning of the term ‚Äúsense faculty,‚Äù

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos go bar byed pa nyid 'chad par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos go bar byed pa nyid 'chad par mdzad pa na /
translated: said:

original: thun mong min pa'i rgyu nyid phyir //üîΩdbang po la de'i tha snyad byas //
analyzed: thun mong min pa'i rgyu nyid phyir // dbang po la de'i tha snyad byas //
translated: Because it is the uncommon cause,

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: the sense faculty is designated as such.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na dbang po'i sgra la dbang po'i shes pa rtogs pa la go bar byed pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas na dbang po'i sgra la dbang po'i shes pa rtogs pa la go bar byed pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Because it is the uncommon cause, the term ‚Äúsense faculty‚Äù is taught to indicate the consciousness of the sense faculty.

original: de ltar na yul ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa thun mong gi rgyu yin zhes bshad pa gang yin pas yul go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yul ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa thun mong gi rgyu yin zhes bshad pa gang yin pas yul go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is said that the object is the common cause of the mental consciousness and the consciousness of another continuum, the object is not the cause of the mental consciousness.

original: de'i chos kyang nges sbyor byed //
analyzed: de'i chos kyang nges sbyor byed //
translated: The characteristics of the object are also applied to it.

original: ces bya ba ni go bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin du gyur pas chos nges par sbyor bar rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni go bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin du gyur pas chos nges par sbyor bar rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: it is proper to apply a word to a thing by way of the nature of that which is to be understood.

original: go bar byed pa khyab par byed par sgra nges par sbyor bar 'os pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: go bar byed pa khyab par byed par sgra nges par sbyor bar 'os pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: He explains that by ‚Äúit is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood,‚Äù etc.

original: sgra'i nges par sbyor bar 'os pa ni sgra nges par sbyor bar rigs pa ste /üîΩbrjod par bya ba dang rjod pa 'byed pa nyid du nges par sbyor bar rigs pa nyid yin no //üîΩde la go bar byed pa khyab par byed pas khyab pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can sgra sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa nyid du gyur pa la yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i nges par sbyor bar 'os pa ni sgra nges par sbyor bar rigs pa ste / brjod par bya ba dang rjod pa 'byed pa nyid du nges par sbyor bar rigs pa nyid yin no // de la go bar byed pa khyab par byed pas khyab pa yin no // de ltar na rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can sgra sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa nyid du gyur pa la yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is proper to apply a word‚Äù means it is proper to apply a word.

original: sgra sbyor ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don ston par byed pa'i yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don ston par byed pa'i yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be understood, because it is proper to apply a word to a thing to be pervaded by that which is to be

original: de yang go bar byed pa nyid du nus pa yin gyi cig shos kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang go bar byed pa nyid du nus pa yin gyi cig shos kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is only the expressive that is capable of expressing, not the other.

original: go bar byed pa ma yin pa nges par sbyor na rtog pa sngon du gtong pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go bar byed pa ma yin pa nges par sbyor na rtog pa sngon du gtong pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to apply the non-expressive, the pre-established conception would be lost.

original: de bas na gal te go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na gal te go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if it were non-expressive,

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba sgra nges par sbyor ba de nyid byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba sgra nges par sbyor ba de nyid byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the application of sound with pre-established conception would not be expressive.

original: de'i phyir bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir rtog pa sngon du @197b gtong ba can sgra nges par sbyor bar 'os pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can gyi go bar byed pa nyid de'i khyab par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir rtog pa sngon du @197b gtong ba can sgra nges par sbyor bar 'os pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can gyi go bar byed pa nyid de'i khyab par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when reversed, there is an invalidating valid cognition. Thus, the mere suitability of applying sound with pre-established conception is the pervasion of expressiveness, which is related to that.

original: 'dis ni sbyor ba'i don 'thad par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor ba'i don 'thad par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the establishment of the meaning of the application.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Here, there are two types of application: through affirmation and through negation.

original: de la re zhig sgrub pa ni gang zhig tha snyad gang la rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can sgra 'god pa de ni de la go bar byed pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la re zhig sgrub pa ni gang zhig tha snyad gang la rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can sgra 'god pa de ni de la go bar byed pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Now, first of all, the proof is this: Whoever, having a concept of a term, applies it, he is only an illuminator of it.

original: dper na rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu'i tha snyad la rnga dang nas kyi sgra zhes nges par sbyor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu'i tha snyad la rnga dang nas kyi sgra zhes nges par sbyor ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the term ‚Äúdrum‚Äù is applied to the sound of a drum, and the term ‚Äúbarley‚Äù is applied to the sprout of barley.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i tha snyad 'di la yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can sgra nges par sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i tha snyad 'di la yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can sgra nges par sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And in the case of the term ‚Äúsense perception,‚Äù the term is applied by one who has a concept of it. This is an argument from nature.

original: go bar byed pa nyid kyang dbang po'i tha snyad kho na yin par gnas so //
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid kyang dbang po'i tha snyad kho na yin par gnas so //
translated: And the illuminator is only the sense perception.

original: dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang gang zhig go bar byed pa nyid kyi mi 'gyur ba de ni de la nges par sbyar bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang gang zhig go bar byed pa nyid kyi mi 'gyur ba de ni de la nges par sbyar bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: And by the way of negation, that which is not an illuminator is not fit to be applied to it.

original: dper na rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu'i tha snyad la go rims bzhin du dbyug pa'i sgra dang sa la sogs pa'i sgra mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu'i tha snyad la go rims bzhin du dbyug pa'i sgra dang sa la sogs pa'i sgra mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the terms ‚Äúsound of a drum‚Äù and ‚Äúsprout of barley‚Äù do not become respectively the terms ‚Äúsound of a stick‚Äù and ‚Äúsprout of earth.‚ÄùüîΩAnd in the context of demonstrating the sense consciousnesses, the term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is not understood to be a term that is applied to the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ston par byed pa'i skabs la yang yul gyi sgra'i tha snyad la go bar byed par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ston par byed pa'i skabs la yang yul gyi sgra'i tha snyad la go bar byed par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-observation of a pervader.

original: de la gang gi phyir 'di ltar de'i chos kyang nges sbyor byed pa go bar byed pas khyab pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /üîΩrang bzhin rtags ni nges par sbyor //
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir 'di ltar de'i chos kyang nges sbyor byed pa go bar byed pas khyab pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / rang bzhin rtags ni nges par sbyor //
translated: The passage that begins with ‚ÄúBecause of this, the application of a property of that which is to be comprehended is pervasion‚Äù and ends with

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung 'dis sgrub pa sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung 'dis sgrub pa sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe evidence of nature is the application of ascertainment‚Äù explains the application that proves the proof.

original: go bar byed pa'i //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i //
translated: The application of a property of that which is to be comprehended is pervasion.

original: rang bzhin rtags ni nges par sbyor //
analyzed: rang bzhin rtags ni nges par sbyor //
translated: The evidence of nature is the application of ascertainment.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rtags sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rtags sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúOne should employ the reason ‚Äòthe nature of being a cause of understanding what is to be established.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rtags nges par sbyar ba de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgag pa la gtan tshigs ni dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rtags nges par sbyar ba de ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgag pa la gtan tshigs ni dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: The reason ‚Äúnature‚Äù is employed, and that is reversed, etc. The reason is stated in the proof of the negation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de de ltar na go bar byed pa'i tha snyad kyi bshad pa yin gyi skabs su bab pa'i don rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgrub par byed
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de de ltar na go bar byed pa'i tha snyad kyi bshad pa yin gyi skabs su bab pa'i don rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgrub par byed
translated: Therefore, it is an explanation of the convention of understanding, not of another that causes one to understand the meaning at hand.

original: pa rnam pa gnyis kyi sbyor ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: pa rnam pa gnyis kyi sbyor ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, it shows the two kinds of results of the proof, the positive and negative, of the two kinds of syllogisms, the positive and negative.

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa las ni sgrub pa'i sgo nas rang gi sgras sbyor ba bshad de /
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa las ni sgrub pa'i sgo nas rang gi sgras sbyor ba bshad de /
translated: In the Compendium of Logic, the employment of the reason by way of the positive is explained by way of one‚Äôs own words.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i sgo nas kyang tha snyad 'dogs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i sgo nas kyang tha snyad 'dogs pa mthong ste /
translated: We also see that expressions are used in an uncommon way.

original: @198a * // dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu lta bu'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: @198a * // dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu lta bu'o zhes bstan to //
translated: For example, the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley.

original: de la yang don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yang don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning is this.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can dag brjod par 'dod pa'i don ston pa la tha snyad mthong ba gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can dag brjod par 'dod pa'i don ston pa la tha snyad mthong ba gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat which is seen as a convention‚Äù is that which is seen as a convention in the expression of the object one wishes to speak about by those who employ concepts.

original: de'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the expression is what is to be proven.

original: dgag pa'i sgo nas sbyor ba yang don gyis bstan to //
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgo nas sbyor ba yang don gyis bstan to //
translated: The application by way of negation is also taught by implication.

original: de ltar na de la thun mong ma yin pa'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba'i kyang gi sgra ni nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de la thun mong ma yin pa'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba'i kyang gi sgra ni nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúin an uncommon way as well‚Äù is a restrictive particle.

original: thun mong ma yin pa kho na'i sgo nas yin gyi /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa kho na'i sgo nas yin gyi /
translated: It is only in an uncommon way.

original: thun mong gi sgo nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges par bzung ba'i 'bras bus go bar byed pa ma yin pa nges par sbyar bar 'os pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: thun mong gi sgo nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges par bzung ba'i 'bras bus go bar byed pa ma yin pa nges par sbyar bar 'os pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not to be construed as a definite exclusion, but rather as a clarification that is appropriate to the context.üîΩ‚ÄúWell then, how is it that the five kinds of consciousness . . .‚Äù?

original: 'o na ci ltar na rnam par shes pa lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod pa de 'brel pa byed pas bstsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar na rnam par shes pa lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod pa de 'brel pa byed pas bstsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: The author of the Compendium of Valid Cognition responds to this objection by saying, ‚ÄúThe collection . . . .‚Äù

original: gzhung 'di yang gal te mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhung 'di yang gal te mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba yin na /
translated: The point of this passage is this: If direct perception is free from conceptualization,

original: ci ltar na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga bsags pa la dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: ci ltar na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga bsags pa la dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dis bstan to //
translated: how can the collection of the five kinds of consciousness, such as visual consciousness, be the object of direct perception?

original: rdul phra rab 'dus pa ni bsags pa yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'dus pa ni bsags pa yin la /
translated: The collection is the aggregation of atoms.

original: de yang tshogs ba can thams cad kyi spyi'i ngo bo yin zhing de la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: de yang tshogs ba can thams cad kyi spyi'i ngo bo yin zhing de la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: Also, others think that the sense consciousnesses are conceptual because they are the general nature of all the assemblies and they focus on that.

original: gal te de gcig tu rnam par shes pa ma yin na de ji ltar rung zhes bya ba 'di yang tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: gal te de gcig tu rnam par shes pa ma yin na de ji ltar rung zhes bya ba 'di yang tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung yin no //
translated: If it is not a consciousness in one part, how can it be suitable? This is a statement from the Compendium of Valid Knowledge.

original: bsags pa de gal te gcig tu rnam par rtog pa ma yin na 'o na ji ltar na rnam par shes pa lnga'i dmigs pa bsags pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsags pa de gal te gcig tu rnam par rtog pa ma yin na 'o na ji ltar na rnam par shes pa lnga'i dmigs pa bsags pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: If that collection is not conceptual in one part, then how can it be the collection of objects of the five consciousnesses? This should be applied.

original: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can de dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la 'dod kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa gzhan 'di yang tshad ma kun las btus pa'i
analyzed: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can de dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la 'dod kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa gzhan 'di yang tshad ma kun las btus pa'i
translated: This other explanation, that the five collections of consciousness are asserted to have objects that are the characteristics of the sense bases, not the characteristics of substance, is also from the Compendium of Valid Knowledge.

original: phyogs snga ma'i gzhung yin te rtog pa dang bral ba dang 'gal ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma'i gzhung yin te rtog pa dang bral ba dang 'gal ba nyid kyis so //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position, which is contradicted by the absence of conceptualization.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas spel mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas spel mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Vasubandhu also says, etc. This is the explanation of the mixture.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i nang nas sngon po la sogs @198b pa so sor nges pa gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i nang nas sngon po la sogs @198b pa so sor nges pa gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Sometimes, from among blue, yellow, etc., a particular blue, etc., generates visual consciousness, etc.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i tshogs pas zhes bya ba chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos su rnam par gzhag pa byas pa na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i tshogs pas zhes bya ba chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos su rnam par gzhag pa byas pa na /
translated: Sometimes, a collection of blue, yellow, etc., is posited in the Abhidharma treatise.

original: gal te gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dmigs na yang ji ltar na de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid la gnod par mi 'gyur zhes brgal ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dmigs na yang ji ltar na de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid la gnod par mi 'gyur zhes brgal ba'o //
translated: If a collection of form, sound, etc. is observed by the five collections of consciousness, how can it not contradict their being objects of specific characteristics? This is the opponent‚Äôs objection.

original: de la slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'di ltar de dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du 'dod kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'di ltar de dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du 'dod kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Vasubandhu explains that the sense bases are considered to be the objects of the intrinsic natures of the sense faculties, not the objects of the intrinsic natures of substances, so this error does not occur.

original: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa thams cad so so'am bsdus pa bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i sgo'i don ni skye mched yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa thams cad so so'am bsdus pa bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i sgo'i don ni skye mched yin no //
translated: The meaning of sense base is the door that generates consciousness in accordance with the individual or combined nature of all blue, yellow, red, and so on.

original: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni skye mched gzhan las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni skye mched gzhan las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Their intrinsic natures are the opposite of the other sense bases.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rigs mthun pa dag gi ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rigs mthun pa dag gi ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The intrinsic natures of form, sound, and so on are the entities that generate the sense consciousnesses of those of similar type.

original: de thun mong ma yin pa yin na yang skye mched gzhan las bzlog nas rigs mthun pa thams cad la bye brag med par rang gi mtshan nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: de thun mong ma yin pa yin na yang skye mched gzhan las bzlog nas rigs mthun pa thams cad la bye brag med par rang gi mtshan nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Although this is not common to all, it is called the own-characteristic of all homogeneous things, without distinction, by excluding other sense-fields.

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dag la ngo bo so so ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin zhing de la ni de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yulüîΩcan ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dag la ngo bo so so ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin zhing de la ni de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: It is not the own-characteristic of a substance. The individual natures of the divisions of form, sound, etc. are the own-characteristic of a substance. With regard to that, they are not the objects of the own-characteristic.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye ba re re la nges pa'i sgo nas de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye ba re re la nges pa'i sgo nas de dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the objects of the own-characteristic, by way of being restricted to each division of form, etc.

original: 'on kyang rigs mthun pa rnams la khyad par med par rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs mthun pa rnams la khyad par med par rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: However, because they are grasped as the own-characteristic of homogeneous things, without distinction, this is the meaning of the summary.

original: rgol ba ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i ngo bo la skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgra bshad pa yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: rgol ba ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i ngo bo la skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgra bshad pa yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: The opponent thinks that the term ‚Äúsense base‚Äù is explained by the intrinsic identity of the sense bases in general, such as ‚Äúthat which is to be apprehended by the eye.‚Äù

original: bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas /
analyzed: bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúWhen the aggregates are destroyed‚Äù

original: mdo mdzad pas phyogs snga ma'i bsam pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: mdo mdzad pas phyogs snga ma'i bsam pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: shows the opinion of the opponent, the author of the s≈´tra.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa'i rkyen nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa rdul phra rab kyi @199a *// rang bzhin skyed pa gang yin pa de'i rkyen te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa'i rkyen nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa rdul phra rab kyi @199a *// rang bzhin skyed pa gang yin pa de'i rkyen te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the condition that produces the nature that generates consciousness is present‚Äù means that the condition of that which produces the nature of the atom that generates consciousness is present.

original: lhan cig byed pa gang yin pa de nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gang yin pa de nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the condition that is the co-arising is present.

original: de dag phan tshun nye bar 'go ba la sogs pa la brten pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni mchod pa dang yul rung ba na gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzung ngo ;
analyzed: de dag phan tshun nye bar 'go ba la sogs pa la brten pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni mchod pa dang yul rung ba na gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzung ngo ;
translated: The words ‚Äúbased on mutual approach, etc.‚Äù include ‚Äúworship, located in a suitable place,‚Äù etc.

original: / rgyud lnga ma yongs su gyur pa gang la phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa brten pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: / rgyud lnga ma yongs su gyur pa gang la phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa brten pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is a transformation of the fivefold continuum, in which there is a basis consisting of mutual approach, etc., is so called.

original: rgyud snga ma yongs su gyur pa yang nye bar len pa'i skad cig ma snga ma skad cig ma phyi ma'i nus pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud snga ma yongs su gyur pa yang nye bar len pa'i skad cig ma snga ma skad cig ma phyi ma'i nus pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: The transformation of the prior continuum is the production of the capacity of the prior moment of appropriation to generate the subsequent moment.

original: de 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba ni yul mchod pa na gnas pa rdul phra rab gzhan dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba ni yul mchod pa na gnas pa rdul phra rab gzhan dang bral ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Such‚Äù means that the object of worship is located in a suitable place, free from other atoms.

original: shes pa de ni rdul phra rab mang pos bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa de ni rdul phra rab mang pos bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the compound is that the cognition is to be generated by many atoms.

original: de la thams cad kyis kyang 'dir de la don du mas skyed phyir //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyis kyang 'dir de la don du mas skyed phyir //
translated: In this regard, all of them say that it is generated here by many objects.

original: rang don la spyi spyod yul can zhes bya ba'i tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung 'di bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: rang don la spyi spyod yul can zhes bya ba'i tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung 'di bshad pa yin no /
translated: The treatise itself is called ‚ÄúCompendium of Valid Cognition,‚Äù and the author is called ‚ÄúDignƒÅga.‚ÄùüîΩThe commentary on the Compendium of Valid CognitionüîΩThe commentary on the Compendium of Valid Cognition

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /üîΩbam po lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa /üîΩspyir de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad / bam po lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa / spyir de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung rjod par byed pa ste /

original: chad ma kun las btus pa las spyi'i sgra brjod pa ni rdul phra rab du ma rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir te gang la skyi ste rdul phra rab du ma'i spyod yul yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chad ma kun las btus pa las spyi'i sgra brjod pa ni rdul phra rab du ma rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir te gang la skyi ste rdul phra rab du ma'i spyod yul yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The Compendium of Abhidharma states: ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòuniversal‚Äô is taught because of the nature of many subtle particles. The term ‚Äòthat which has a universal as its object‚Äô is to be applied to that which has many subtle particles as its object.‚Äù

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pa spangs pa na spyi'i yul can nyid yin par khab blangs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pa spangs pa na spyi'i yul can nyid yin par khab blangs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: This statement does not refer to the nature of a substance, so does it not follow that when the phrase ‚Äúthat which has a particular as its object‚Äù is rejected, the phrase ‚Äúthat which has a universal as its object‚Äù is accepted?

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore:

original: de la don du ma bskyed phyir //
analyzed: de la don du ma bskyed phyir //
translated: Because it does not generate a meaning,

original: rang don la spyi'i spyod yul can //üîΩspyi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bshad pa de 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rang don la spyi'i spyod yul can // spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bshad pa de 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: it has a universal as its object in regard to a substance.üîΩIt is not because it apprehends a universal.üîΩThis explanation contradicts the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not because of the nature of a substance.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚ÄúThis is also not because of the nature of a substance‚Äù is stated.

original: yul rnam par chad pa na gnas pa rnams rdzas gzhan gcig rtsom pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldan pa lhan cig byed pa yul @199b rnam par 'chad pa'i gnas skabs na med pa'i phyir 'bras bu rdzas rtsom pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul rnam par chad pa na gnas pa rnams rdzas gzhan gcig rtsom pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldan pa lhan cig byed pa yul @199b rnam par 'chad pa'i gnas skabs na med pa'i phyir 'bras bu rdzas rtsom pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is that when the object is divided, the simultaneous activity of the possession does not exist, and therefore the composition of another substance as an effect does not exist.

original: go rims med par zhen pa phyin ci log yin no zhes bya ba ni go rims med pa kho na phyi ci log yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims med par zhen pa phyin ci log yin no zhes bya ba ni go rims med pa kho na phyi ci log yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that the absence of order itself is the error.üîΩIt was previously refuted.

original: sngar bsal zin to zhes bya ba ni cig car rnam par shes pa skye ba sgrub par byed pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: sngar bsal zin to zhes bya ba ni cig car rnam par shes pa skye ba sgrub par byed pa'i skabs su /
translated: In the context of establishing the simultaneous arising of consciousness, it was said:

original: 'dir don kun dang cig car ni //
analyzed: 'dir don kun dang cig car ni //
translated: Here, all objects and consciousnessesüîΩare simultaneous,

original: 'dus can dbang rnams yod na yang //
analyzed: 'dus can dbang rnams yod na yang //
translated: even when the sense faculties are assembled.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩdus mtshungs can blo thams cad kyi //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro // dus mtshungs can blo thams cad kyi //
translated: And so on. Therefore, it was already refuted.üîΩBecause all minds that are simultaneous

original: thams cad skad cig ma nyid du khas len par phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad skad cig ma nyid du khas len par phyir ro //
translated: are accepted as momentary.

original: gzhan myur du 'jug pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni blo gzhan myur du 'jug pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan myur du 'jug pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni blo gzhan myur du 'jug pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the context of the statement, ‚ÄúThe other is not one that quickly engages.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rim min thal 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: 'di ni rim min thal 'gyur ba'am //
translated: This is a reductio argument that does not follow your ownüîΩposition.

original: zhes bya ba ni don gcig 'dzin par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don gcig 'dzin par zhen pa'o //
translated: This is the attachment to the apprehension of a single object.

original: phyi ma leb khra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rma bya la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma leb khra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rma bya la sogs pa'o //
translated: The latter is a peacock, etc.

original: tshon sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba yang de yin la ras dang dar la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gi snal ma'i rigs sna tshogs pa las zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: tshon sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba yang de yin la ras dang dar la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gi snal ma'i rigs sna tshogs pa las zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is also a cloth that is dyed with various colors, and it is a variety of threads that are the particularities of cloth, silk, etc. This is the inclusion of the particularities.

original: de dag gis bsgrubs shing bskyed pa'i ras dang stan gang yin pa de dag dang por byas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bsgrubs shing bskyed pa'i ras dang stan gang yin pa de dag dang por byas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is produced and generated by those is cloth and a rug. That which has that as its original cause is called that.

original: snal ma rigs sna tshogs pa las bsgrubs pa smos pa ni rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i rdzas mi rtsom pas yan lag can gyi rdzas med par bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: snal ma rigs sna tshogs pa las bsgrubs pa smos pa ni rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i rdzas mi rtsom pas yan lag can gyi rdzas med par bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The mention of the cloth being made of various kinds of thread is for the purpose of showing that there is no whole substance, since a substance of a different kind is not produced.

original: yan lag can med na yang yan lag can de la brten pa'i gzugs gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can med na yang yan lag can de la brten pa'i gzugs gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And if there is no whole, there is not even a single form that is based on it.

original: de la yang yan lag gi gzugs kyi rigs du ma snang ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis kyang khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang yan lag gi gzugs kyi rigs du ma snang ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis kyang khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: And in that case, one must also admit that there are many kinds of forms that are parts.

original: gzugs gzhan la mi dmigs pa'i blos zhes bya ba la yongs su gcad par bya ba'i gzugs las gzhan pa'i gzugs ni gzugs gzhan no //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan la mi dmigs pa'i blos zhes bya ba la yongs su gcad par bya ba'i gzugs las gzhan pa'i gzugs ni gzugs gzhan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa cognition that does not apprehend any other form‚Äù means that the form that is the object of apprehension is different from the form that is the object of the cognition.

original: de la mi dmigs pa ste yongs su gcad par bya ba'i gzugs gcig la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa ste yongs su gcad par bya ba'i gzugs gcig la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition that is a conceptual thought that apprehends a single form that is the object of apprehension does not apprehend any other form that is the object of the cognition.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn those‚Äù refers to the blue and the yellow.

original: de rig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de rig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of that‚Äù means the apprehension of the distinction.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i khyad par blos rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa med pa ni gcig nyid la khyad par byed pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang de ltar rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed @200a
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i khyad par blos rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa med pa ni gcig nyid la khyad par byed pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang de ltar rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed @200a
translated: The apprehension of a difference, such as blue and yellow, etc., by the intellect, is the differentiation of a single entity into a difference. The apprehension of a difference is the perception of something contradictory to that.

original: * // pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: * // pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the pervasion is the perception of something contradictory to the pervader.

original: 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub par smra'o zhes bya ba ni rma bya la sogs pa'i gzugs kyang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas blos rnam par phya nas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub par smra'o zhes bya ba ni rma bya la sogs pa'i gzugs kyang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas blos rnam par phya nas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement that the reason is not established. The form of a peacock, etc., is also apprehended by the intellect through the differentiation of the differences, such as blue, etc.

original: de la yan lag can gyi gzugs rnam par phye nas mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de la yan lag can gyi gzugs rnam par phye nas mi 'dzin cing /
translated: There, the form of the whole is not apprehended through differentiation.

original: yan lag gi gzugs gzung ba gang yin pa de ni du ma nyid du 'dod pa de phyogs su byed pa na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes sems so //
analyzed: yan lag gi gzugs gzung ba gang yin pa de ni du ma nyid du 'dod pa de phyogs su byed pa na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes sems so //
translated: That form of the parts which is apprehended, if it is accepted as being multiple, then when that is taken as the position, it is the establishment of what is already established.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi bsgrub pa sems dang mi ldan pa ni bcos ma'i phye ma leb de gang la yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig yod pa ma yin no //üîΩdon rnams dus mtshungs can nyid du //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi bsgrub pa sems dang mi ldan pa ni bcos ma'i phye ma leb de gang la yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig yod pa ma yin no // don rnams dus mtshungs can nyid du //
translated: The substance of a different class is not a composite of substances, like a painted butterfly.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don gyi rnam pa dang dus ni don gyi rnam pa dang dus so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don gyi rnam pa dang dus ni don gyi rnam pa dang dus so //
translated: With regard to the statement, ‚ÄúThe object and the aspect are simultaneous,‚Äù the aspect of an object and the time of the object are the aspect and time of the object.

original: blo gang la de dag mtshungs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: blo gang la de dag mtshungs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has these two is said to have the aspect and time of the object.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The state of that is reality.

original: des na don gyi rnam pa mtshungs pa can ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tha dad par snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: des na don gyi rnam pa mtshungs pa can ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tha dad par snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of the object is the same because blue, yellow, and so on appear as different.

original: dus mtshungs pa can ni gnyi ga la yang go rims med par 'dzin pa so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa can ni gnyi ga la yang go rims med par 'dzin pa so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The time is the same because both are apprehended without order and are known separately.

original: bcos ma'i phye ma leb pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: bcos ma'i phye ma leb pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúLike a painted butterfly,‚Äù and so on, explains that.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa dag la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa dag la'o //
translated: Both‚Äù refers to the contrived and the uncontrived.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can ma yin gyi 'on kyang gal te yan lag can gyi gzugs sna tshogs pa gcig yin no zhes
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can ma yin gyi 'on kyang gal te yan lag can gyi gzugs sna tshogs pa gcig yin no zhes
translated: ‚ÄúNot having a variegated nature like blue and so on‚Äù means that it does not have a variegated nature like a multicolored butterfly and so on.

original: bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
analyzed: bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the whole is one‚Äù means that the meaning of ‚Äúone‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúwhole.‚Äù

original: blo sna tshogs min zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung gi de la yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo sna tshogs min zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung gi de la yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot having a variegated cognition‚Äù means that according to the other system, it has no object.

original: de ltar na de'i yul yan lag can gyi rdzas yin nam /üîΩyan lag can 'du ba dang ldan pa gzugs sna tshogs pa can cig gam /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i yul yan lag can gyi rdzas yin nam / yan lag can 'du ba dang ldan pa gzugs sna tshogs pa can cig gam /
translated: Thus, is its object a whole substance?üîΩOr is the whole a collection that possesses a variegated form?

original: yan lag gi gzugs so so'am ma lus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yan lag gi gzugs so so'am ma lus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it the individual forms of the parts or the entirety?

original: re zhig dang po'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, the conception that it is a whole substance is not so,

original: de la yan lag can gyi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yan lag can gyi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no whole substance.

original: de ni rigs mi mthun pa can de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni rigs mi mthun pa can de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThose of dissimilar type,‚Äù etc.

original: de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gnyis pa med par bstan te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gnyis pa med par bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the non-existence of that,‚Äù etc. shows the non-existence of the second alternative.

original: yan lag can gyi gzugs ni yan lag can gyi ngo bo ste gang de la 'du ba ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi gzugs ni yan lag can gyi ngo bo ste gang de la 'du ba ldan pa'o //
translated: The form of the whole is the nature of the whole, which is the collection of parts.

original: yan lag can @200b gyi ngo bo yang yin la gcig kyang yin zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can @200b gyi ngo bo yang yin la gcig kyang yin zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the whole is also one, is the meaning of the compound.

original: yang sna tshogs pa'i sgra dang las 'dzin pa nyid bya'o //
analyzed: yang sna tshogs pa'i sgra dang las 'dzin pa nyid bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be understood as referring to the word ‚Äúvariety‚Äù and the compound.

original: de nas mi rtsom pa'i sgra dang drug pa'i bsdu ba bya'o 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas mi rtsom pa'i sgra dang drug pa'i bsdu ba bya'o 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then, the word ‚Äúnon-beginning‚Äù and the sixth case should be understood as follows.

original: gal te yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi yan lag gcig tsom par 'gyur pa de bas na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi yan lag gcig tsom par 'gyur pa de bas na /
translated: The idea is this: If the substance of the whole were to begin with only one part,

original: de'i rten can yan lag can gyi ngo bo yan lag gi yon tan gyis kyang rtsom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rten can yan lag can gyi ngo bo yan lag gi yon tan gyis kyang rtsom par 'gyur te /
translated: then the nature of the whole, which is based on that, would also begin with the quality of the part.

original: rten med pa can gyi yon tan brtsam par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa can gyi yon tan brtsam par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for a quality to begin without a basis.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rtog pa gsum pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rtog pa gsum pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: The third conception is refuted by ‚ÄúAnd those objects such as blue, etc.‚Äù

original: cig car don du ma 'dzin par khas mi len pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: cig car don du ma 'dzin par khas mi len pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The fourth conception does not exist, because it is not admitted that many objects are apprehended simultaneously.

original: de lta na de zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na de zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means ‚Äúif that is so.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar phye ma leb la yan lag can gyi ngo bo khra bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa yongs su snang bar gyur pa ma yin pa yan lag can gyi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i
analyzed: 'di ltar phye ma leb la yan lag can gyi ngo bo khra bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa yongs su snang bar gyur pa ma yin pa yan lag can gyi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i
translated: ‚Äú Thus, there is no variegated nature of the whole in the butterfly‚Äù means that the nature of the whole is not perceived, because the parts such as blue, etc., are not perceived.

original: phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the idea.

original: yang na don 'di khyod kyis kun du brtags pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don 'di khyod kyis kun du brtags pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the meaning is that the variegated nature of the whole imagined by you does not exist,

original: gcig dang sna tshogs pa nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang sna tshogs pa nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because singularity and variegation are mutually exclusive.
