original: gal te gnyi ga'i yang ngo bo tha dad pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni phye ma leb khra bo'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa dang stan khra bo la sogs pa'i yan lag gi ngo bo tha dad pa gang
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga'i yang ngo bo tha dad pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni phye ma leb khra bo'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa dang stan khra bo la sogs pa'i yan lag gi ngo bo tha dad pa gang
translated: If you say that the cause of the designation of the variegated is the different natures of both, then the different natures of the variegated parts of the butterfly and the different natures of the variegated parts of the cloth, etc.,

original: yin pa de dag gnyi ga'i yang gzugs sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni ldan pa la nye par 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
analyzed: yin pa de dag gnyi ga'i yang gzugs sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni ldan pa la nye par 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
translated: are both forms of the variegated.üîΩThe reply to that is ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

original: phye ma leb khra bo'i gzugs la sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phye ma leb khra bo'i gzugs la sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the form of the variegated butterfly is not variegated.

original: khyod kyis yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig nyid du kun du brtags pa gang yin pa de la sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig nyid du kun du brtags pa gang yin pa de la sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the variegated that you imagine to be the nature of the possessor of parts does not exist.

original: ri mo la sogs pa la yang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar de la re zhig yan lag can med pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa gzhan mi dod do //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa la yang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar de la re zhig yan lag can med pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa gzhan mi dod do //
translated: Thus, first of all, because the possessor of parts does not exist, the variegated entity of the possessor of parts does not exist.

original: 'on kyang de la yan lag gi gzugs kho na snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la yan lag gi gzugs kho na snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, only the form of the parts would appear there.

original: de dag so so la yang sna tshogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag so so la yang sna tshogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: And they do not each have variegation.

original: sna tshogs pa dag ni sna tshogs pa nyid nye bar btags pa la yan lag ma yin te /üîΩcig car du ma 'dzin par khas mi @201a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dag ni sna tshogs pa nyid nye bar btags pa la yan lag ma yin te / cig car du ma 'dzin par khas mi @201a * //
translated: And variegation is not a part in the designation of variegation.

original: len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted that many are apprehended simultaneously.

original: gal te sna tshogs par snang ba can gyi blo la snang ba de'i tshe nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs par snang ba can gyi blo la snang ba de'i tshe nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If it appears to the cognition that has variegation as its appearance, then it would be the cause of the designation.

original: don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir nye bar btags par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang la gzugs nye bar btags pa'i rgyu 'du ba dang ldan pa de nyid la ldan pa yang 'du ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir nye bar btags par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang la gzugs nye bar btags pa'i rgyu 'du ba dang ldan pa de nyid la ldan pa yang 'du ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Because of the convergence of the cause of the designation of form on one thing, it is a designation.

original: spyi'i spyod yul can gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang grub 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //üîΩre zhig blo de gcig nyid la //
analyzed: spyi'i spyod yul can gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang grub 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro // re zhig blo de gcig nyid la //
translated: The context is: ‚ÄúThe consciousness that has a universal as its object would also be established.‚ÄùüîΩFirst, how could a single cognition

original: ji ltar du ma snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar du ma snang bar 'gyur //
translated: appear as many?

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: This is what he thinks.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba khyod kyang blo rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid 'dod do //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba khyod kyang blo rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid 'dod do //
translated: The proponent of the thesis also asserts that cognition has aspects.

original: de lta na sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa de blo'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de lta na blo sna tshogs pas snang ba can khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa de blo'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de lta na blo sna tshogs pas snang ba can khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the various aspects become the nature of cognition, and thus you accept that cognition appears as various aspects.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sna tshogs pa yin pa de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sna tshogs pa yin pa de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is indeterminate.

original: blo gcig gi rang bzhin nyid yin na yang sna tshogs par snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gcig gi rang bzhin nyid yin na yang sna tshogs par snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The reason is indeterminate because although it is the nature of a single cognition, it appears as various.üîΩAs it is said,

original: ji lta ji ltar don bsam pa //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar don bsam pa //
translated: ‚ÄúAs it is thought, so it is seen.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúobject‚Äù refers to external things such as blue, yellow, and so on.

original: don smos pa ni rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa 'gog par byed pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don smos pa ni rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa 'gog par byed pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is used to refute that it is different from consciousness, but it is not the dependent nature of another consciousness.

original: de yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAs it is thought‚Äù means as one or many.

original: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol lam yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol lam yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la yang ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn some nature‚Äù means that it is not external, nor is it the nature of consciousness.

original: chags par snang ba'i rnam par mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chags par snang ba'i rnam par mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not abide in the aspect of appearing as attachment.

original: ji ltar rnam par mi gnas pa de ltar de ma thag nyid du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par mi gnas pa de ltar de ma thag nyid du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: How it does not abide will be shown immediately.

original: chos rnams bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos rnams bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the statement that phenomena are selfless, etc.,

original: thams cad med pa ni chos rnams bdag med pa nyid ma yin te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs med par thal ba'i phyir dang / sngar ji skad du bshad pa bzhin du kun rdzob rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad med pa ni chos rnams bdag med pa nyid ma yin te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs med par thal ba'i phyir dang / sngar ji skad du bshad pa bzhin du kun rdzob rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it is not that all phenomena are non-existent, because it would follow that the factors of defilement and purification would not exist, and because, as was previously explained, the conventional is reasonable.

original: 'on kyang kun du brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dben pa rang rig pa tsam de yang bstan bcos mdzad pa rang nyid kyis 'og nas rgyas par gsal bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun du brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dben pa rang rig pa tsam de yang bstan bcos mdzad pa rang nyid kyis 'og nas rgyas par gsal bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the treatise-writer himself will clarify below that the mere self-awareness, which is devoid of the apprehended object and apprehending subject that are imagined, is also selfless.

original: don dam par blo sna tshogs pa des dngos po yang sna tshogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: don dam par blo sna tshogs pa des dngos po yang sna tshogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If the various minds are ultimate, then various things would be established, etc.

original: @201b ji ltar dang por don dam par blo gcig sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can de lta bur gyur pa'i don nyid kyis skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @201b ji ltar dang por don dam par blo gcig sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can de lta bur gyur pa'i don nyid kyis skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as at first, ultimately, the mind is of a single nature, so too, by the very nature of the object, it is of a variegated aspect.

original: de nas 'dzin par byed pa'i blo de'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas 'dzin par byed pa'i blo de'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the external thing that is posited as the aspect of that apprehending mind is also established.

original: de bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ste /
translated: It is just like that.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig bzhin du bden par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde'i blo la yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni blo gcig la yang sna tshogs pa nyid de ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig bzhin du bden par 'gyur ro zhe na / de'i blo la yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni blo gcig la yang sna tshogs pa nyid de ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the mind is of a single nature, so too, it is true that it is of a variegated aspect.üîΩBut that is not so for the mind, that is, the variegated aspect is not so for a single mind.

original: blo gcig dang tha dad pa med pa de yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo gcig dang tha dad pa med pa de yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that it is not different from a single mind.

original: gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that with ‚Äúone‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar na de sna tshogs par snang ba nyid du 'dod pas gzhan gcig nyid yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na de sna tshogs par snang ba nyid du 'dod pas gzhan gcig nyid yin par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, since it is asserted that it appears as variegated, it is asserted that it is different.

original: de bas na gcig nyid yin na ngo bo sna tshogs pa ma yin pa yang zhes bya ba rang bzhin sna tshogs pa ma yin na yang ste /
analyzed: de bas na gcig nyid yin na ngo bo sna tshogs pa ma yin pa yang zhes bya ba rang bzhin sna tshogs pa ma yin na yang ste /
translated: Therefore, if it is one, it is not a variety of entities, that is, if it is not a variety of natures,

original: ngo bo sna tshogs pa nyid yin na gcig nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo sna tshogs pa nyid yin na gcig nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because being a variety of entities is incompatible with being one.

original: 'on kyang 'khrul ba'i dbang gis sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khrul ba'i dbang gis sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it appears as a variety of aspects due to the power of error.

original: gcig dang du ma dag gi gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dag gi gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the line ‚Äúthe existence of one and many, etc.,‚Äù

original: sna tshogs pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: it means that the existence of a variety and the existence of one are

original: rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i rten don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ma gtogs par rnam par gzhag pa gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i rten don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ma gtogs par rnam par gzhag pa gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the bases for positing something. Apart from being either different or non-different in reality, there is no other basis for positing something.

original: de la don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs pa nyid du gnas pa'i rten yin zhing gcig nyid du gnas pa'i yang don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs pa nyid du gnas pa'i rten yin zhing gcig nyid du gnas pa'i yang don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: In that regard, it is the basis for the existence of the various ultimate aspects, and it is the non-existence of the various ultimate aspects for the existence of unity.

original: de la gal te blo la don dam pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa 'dod na /
analyzed: de la gal te blo la don dam pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa 'dod na /
translated: In that regard, if one asserts that the mind has various ultimate aspects,

original: 'o na ni gcig nyid ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na ni gcig nyid ma yin pa'am /
translated: then it is not a unity.

original: gcig nyid yin na don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is a unity, then the various ultimate aspects do not exist.

original: de ltar mi 'dod na ril gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod na ril gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if one does not assert that, then everything is a unity,

original: de la gal te don dam par blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la gal te don dam par blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that regard, if the so-called mind . . . ‚Äù

original: de ltar na cig car skye ba la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi rang bzhin gcig nyid yin na gcig gi skye ba gang yin pa de nyid thams cad kyi yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na cig car skye ba la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi rang bzhin gcig nyid yin na gcig gi skye ba gang yin pa de nyid thams cad kyi yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there is the error of simultaneous arising, and so forth. If the nature of everything is just one, then whatever is the arising of one is just the arising of everything.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni cig car dgag pa dang thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni cig car dgag pa dang thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that the refutation is simultaneous and that everything is applied to everything.

original: de'i phyir gcig nyid yin na rnam pa du ma can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni blo gcig yin na rnam pa du ma can du mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang blo ni gnyis @202a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig nyid yin na rnam pa du ma can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni blo gcig yin na rnam pa du ma can du mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang blo ni gnyis @202a * //
translated: Therefore, if it is one, it does not have many aspects. The idea is that if it is one cognition, it does not have many aspects.

original: kyi ngo bos dben pa rang rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can kho na yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: kyi ngo bos dben pa rang rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can kho na yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: However, cognition is the nature of mere self-awareness, which is devoid of the nature of duality.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po sna tshogs pa med cing /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po sna tshogs pa med cing /
translated: If external things are not various,

original: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can gcig med na 'o na ji ltar yul dang dus nges pa can gyi phyi rol gyi gzugs nyid du snang ba yin zhes de skad du 'dogs pa la /
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can gcig med na 'o na ji ltar yul dang dus nges pa can gyi phyi rol gyi gzugs nyid du snang ba yin zhes de skad du 'dogs pa la /
translated: and if there is not one cognition with various aspects, then how is it that external form appears to be restricted in terms of place and time?

original: 'on kyang gal te 'di bdag don 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te 'di bdag don 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this question, it is said, ‚ÄúIf you assert that this is for your own sake,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgrub pa po 'khrul pa'i ngo bor don du mngon par zhen pa las don zhes brjod kyi de dag don nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa po 'khrul pa'i ngo bor don du mngon par zhen pa las don zhes brjod kyi de dag don nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is used in the sense of the practitioner‚Äôs mistaken belief in the reality of objects, but they are not real objects.

original: kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni gtan nas med pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni gtan nas med pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the imagined is utterly nonexistent.

original: 'dod pa de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that object?

original: de'i ngo bo can ma yin par 'gyur ba dag kyang de'i ngo bo'i sgo nas gsal ba zhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo can ma yin par 'gyur ba dag kyang de'i ngo bo'i sgo nas gsal ba zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: The term ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù refers to those that are not of its nature appearing as if they were.

original: de'i ngo bo can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ngo bo can ma yin par gyur pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ngo bo can ma yin par gyur pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúnot of its nature‚Äù means that they are not of the nature of external objects.

original: de'i ngo bo'i sgo nas kyang de'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo'i sgo nas gsal zhing snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i sgo nas kyang de'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo'i sgo nas gsal zhing snang ba'o //
translated: They are manifest and appear as if they were of the nature of external objects.üîΩIf they were the ultimate reality of that,

original: de dang de'i don dam par gnas pa de kho na nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo can ma yin par snang ba de don dam par te dngos su gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang de'i don dam par gnas pa de kho na nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo can ma yin par snang ba de don dam par te dngos su gnas pa yin te /
translated: they would be of the nature of that.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a valid cognition that establishes it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not unmistaken reality.

original: 'dir phyi rol gyi don du rtogs pa ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol gyi don du rtogs pa ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that here, the realization of external objects is not reality because it is undermined by valid cognition.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don mthong ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin par rigs kyi ma 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don mthong ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin par rigs kyi ma 'khrul pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When external objects are seen, it is reasonable that they are mistaken, not that they are unmistaken.

original: rigs pa de la mi ston mod kyi /
analyzed: rigs pa de la mi ston mod kyi /
translated: Although that reasoning is not taught here,

original: kho bo tshad mas gnod pa'i log pa'i rnam par rtog pas ni ston pa 'gog par byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: kho bo tshad mas gnod pa'i log pa'i rnam par rtog pas ni ston pa 'gog par byed pa yin no ;
translated: we refute the teacher with a mistaken conception undermined by valid cognition.

original: / de bas na rab rib kyis 'khrul pa'i mig can la skra shad dang sbrang ma la sogs pa med pa snang ba bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis khyab pa'i mig can la phyi rol gyi don 'di med na yang snang ngo zhes de skad du
analyzed: / de bas na rab rib kyis 'khrul pa'i mig can la skra shad dang sbrang ma la sogs pa med pa snang ba bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis khyab pa'i mig can la phyi rol gyi don 'di med na yang snang ngo zhes de skad du
translated: Therefore, just as the nonexistent floating hairs and so on appear to those whose eyes are infected by eye disease, so too external objects appear to those whose eyes are infected by the eye disease of ignorance, even though they do not exist.

original: bstan pa rigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pa de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: bstan pa rigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pa de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so ;
translated: The treatise was composed in that way because it is reasonable to do so.

original: / de la don dam par gnas pa de kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de la don dam par gnas pa de kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to that, it is reality that abides ultimately.

original: de'i ngo bo can ma yin pa dag kyang de'i ngo bo can du snang ba tshad ma'i stobs las 'ongs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'khrul pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang don dam par te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo can ma yin pa dag kyang de'i ngo bo can du snang ba tshad ma'i stobs las 'ongs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'khrul pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang don dam par te /
translated: That which is not of its nature appears to be of its nature through the power of valid knowledge. That is not itself mistaken. However, ultimately,

original: dngos su phyi rol gyi ngo bor gnas pa de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa yin pa @202b de ltar na phyin ci log tu rtog pa 'dis de la bdag gis rigs pas 'ongs pa'i don 'gog pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dngos su phyi rol gyi ngo bor gnas pa de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa yin pa @202b de ltar na phyin ci log tu rtog pa 'dis de la bdag gis rigs pas 'ongs pa'i don 'gog pas ci zhig bya /
translated: that reality which abides as the nature of external things is unmistaken. In that case, what use is it for me to refute the object that comes through reasoning to this conception that is mistaken?

original: de bas na ji ltar rigs pa nyid du yang dag pa ma yin pa ston par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar rigs pa nyid du yang dag pa ma yin pa ston par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that it is taught to be unreal.

original: de bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel ba ni rags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel ba ni rags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù in the line ‚Äúthat is its nature‚Äù means ‚Äúin that gross form.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa la yang de'i ngo bo gcig yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rags pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa la yang de'i ngo bo gcig yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rags pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: And if it is a collection, then it does not have a single nature, that is, a gross nature.

original: rdul phra rab gzhan dang 'dres na yang rdul phra rab rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gzhan dang 'dres na yang rdul phra rab rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyams pa ma yin te /
translated: And if it is a collection of atoms, then the atoms do not lose their atomic nature.

original: tshogs pa na yang de dag rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin na rags pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rdul phra rab yul ma yin pa de ltar na 'khrul pa med pa'i sems kyis nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: tshogs pa na yang de dag rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin na rags pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rdul phra rab yul ma yin pa de ltar na 'khrul pa med pa'i sems kyis nges par mi nus te /
translated: If they had a gross nature in a collection, then the atoms would not be the objects of a cognition that has a gross form. In that case, a nonerroneous cognition could not ascertain them.

original: rnam pa gzhan rtogs pas rnam pa gzhan 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan rtogs pas rnam pa gzhan 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is impossible for a cognition to apprehend one form when it cognizes another form.

original: de lta ma yin na thal ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thal ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were possible, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: mi mkhas pa gang dag rags pa'i rnam pa phyi dang nang du 'gyur ba ma yin zhing de rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa gang dag rags pa'i rnam pa phyi dang nang du 'gyur ba ma yin zhing de rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The unwise, however, think that the gross form is not a transformation of the internal and external, and is not the object of consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab shin tu nye bar gnas pa yul ma chad par gnas pa rdul phra rab gzhan gyis bskor ba mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab shin tu nye bar gnas pa yul ma chad par gnas pa rdul phra rab gzhan gyis bskor ba mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
translated: They think that the object of direct perception is the subtle atom, which is extremely close, not divided into parts, and surrounded by other subtle atoms.

original: rdul phra rab de dag kyang phan tshun 'dres pa ma yin te /üîΩ'dres pa ni gnyi ga ltar yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag kyang phan tshun 'dres pa ma yin te / 'dres pa ni gnyi ga ltar yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But those subtle atoms do not touch each other.üîΩIf they touched each other in one place, they would coalesce; if they touched each other in every place, they would be the same as a whole.

original: phyogs gcig gis 'du na ni cha can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis 'du na ni cha can du 'gyur la /
translated: If they touched each other in one place, they would have parts.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi yin na ni gong bu rdul phran tsam nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi yin na ni gong bu rdul phran tsam nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they touched each other in every place, they would be the same as a whole.

original: de bas na shin tu 'dab nye bar gnas pa rigs mi mthun pas chod pa rdul phra rab bar dang bcas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shin tu 'dab nye bar gnas pa rigs mi mthun pas chod pa rdul phra rab bar dang bcas pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are only surrounded by subtle atoms with an interval between them, and are separated by atoms of a different kind.

original: gang yang shin tu brtan por 'dus pa rags pa'i rnam par snang ba gang yin pa de 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang shin tu brtan por 'dus pa rags pa'i rnam par snang ba gang yin pa de 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: That which appears as a gross form, extremely compact, is an error.

original: bar chad phra bas chod par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro des de skad du brjod pa'i rgol ba ni rmongs pa'i blo can yin te /
analyzed: bar chad phra bas chod par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro des de skad du brjod pa'i rgol ba ni rmongs pa'i blo can yin te /
translated: The opponent who speaks in that way is confused,

original: rang gi tshig nyid kyis rang gi tshig la bi tam pa ya ti co 'dri bar byed de 'khrul par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi tshig nyid kyis rang gi tshig la bi tam pa ya ti co 'dri bar byed de 'khrul par byed do //
translated: because he himself asks himself, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù He is confused.

original: gal te rdul phra rab 'dzin par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i shes pa la rags pa'i rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa de 'khrul pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab 'dzin par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i shes pa la rags pa'i rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa de 'khrul pa yin na /
translated: If the appearance of a gross object in consciousness that is asserted to apprehend subtle particles is mistaken,

original: ci ltar de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rdul phra rab yul yin /
analyzed: ci ltar de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rdul phra rab yul yin /
translated: how could consciousness that has its aspect have subtle particles as its object?

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan yul ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of one thing cannot be the object of consciousness that has the aspect of another,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //üîΩrdul phra rab kyi @203a * //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to // rdul phra rab kyi @203a * //
translated: because that is absurd.

original: rnam ba can gyi shes pa ni chu rol ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gis kyang yang dag par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam ba can gyi shes pa ni chu rol ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gis kyang yang dag par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness that has the aspect of subtle particles is not known by anyone who has not seen the limit of reality.

original: de bas na rdul phra rab mngon sum gyi yul ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab mngon sum gyi yul ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the subtle particle is not the object of direct perception, nor is it the object of inference.

original: de la 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i rtags las brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i rtags las brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be inferred from the evidence of the effect, the consciousness.

original: gzhan dag de yang nang gi bag chags kyi byas ba yin par smra ba de ltar na de yang de'i rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag de yang nang gi bag chags kyi byas ba yin par smra ba de ltar na de yang de'i rtags ma yin no //
translated: Others say that even that is the product of internal predispositions. If that were so, then that also would not be the evidence of that.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi mngon sum du 'dod pa'i rags ba'i rnam pa ni gcig dang du mas dpyad mi bzod ba'i phyir don dam par med pa nyid yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi mngon sum du 'dod pa'i rags ba'i rnam pa ni gcig dang du mas dpyad mi bzod ba'i phyir don dam par med pa nyid yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is granted that it is to be inferred, but it is better that the gross form, which is asserted to be direct perception, does not ultimately exist because it cannot withstand analysis as one or many.

original: rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo 'di ji skad du bshad ba'i rnam bas shin tu lkog tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni re zhig spong bar mi nus shing de la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo 'di ji skad du bshad ba'i rnam bas shin tu lkog tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni re zhig spong bar mi nus shing de la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: This essence of the subtle particle, which is extremely hidden by the form explained above, cannot be refuted, and a valid cognition that contradicts it does not operate,

original: de ni cha med pa nyid kyis gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni cha med pa nyid kyis gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of one, since it is partless.

original: gal te de la sgrub par byed pa yang med do snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de la sgrub par byed pa yang med do snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is no proof of that,

original: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: then you would have doubt about that.

original: / de ltar na yang the tshom med par thams cad du chos rnams bdag med par ma bstan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: / de ltar na yang the tshom med par thams cad du chos rnams bdag med par ma bstan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But even so, all things would not be taught as selfless without doubt.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: de skad du smra ba des kyang gdon mi za bar rdul phra rab lus can nyid du 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: de skad du smra ba des kyang gdon mi za bar rdul phra rab lus can nyid du 'dod par bya ste /
translated: That proponent must certainly accept that the subtle particle has a body,

original: lus can ma yin pa ni rdul phra rab nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa ni rdul phra rab nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not embodied is not suitable as a subtle particle.

original: de lta ma yin na sems dang sems las byung ba dag la yang rdul phra rab nyid du ci'i phyir rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sems dang sems las byung ba dag la yang rdul phra rab nyid du ci'i phyir rtog par mi byed /
translated: Otherwise, why would you not imagine that mind and mental factors are subtle particles?

original: lus can yin na ni gdon mi za bar phyogs dang cha tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus can yin na ni gdon mi za bar phyogs dang cha tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: If it has a body, then it must have different parts and directions,

original: phyogs dang cha tha dad pa dang bral ba yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du lus can nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang cha tha dad pa dang bral ba yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du lus can nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is free from different parts and directions is not suitable as embodied, like consciousness.

original: phyogs dang cha tha dad pa nyid yin na yang cha dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang cha tha dad pa nyid yin na yang cha dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is different in terms of direction and part, then it has parts.

original: de'i phyir gcig dang du mas dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir rags pa bzhin du rdul phra rab la yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig dang du mas dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir rags pa bzhin du rdul phra rab la yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like the coarse, the subtle particle is also harmed because it cannot withstand analysis as being either one or many.

original: 'di yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pa mthu che ba rnams kyis zil gyis mnan pa de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pa mthu che ba rnams kyis zil gyis mnan pa de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is also suppressed by the great power of the Acarya Vasubandhu and others, and therefore external objects do not exist.

original: nang gi yongs gcod ces bya ba la sogs pas re zhig ngo bo nyid rnam par phye nas ston par byed do //
analyzed: nang gi yongs gcod ces bya ba la sogs pas re zhig ngo bo nyid rnam par phye nas ston par byed do //
translated: The internal determination, etc., first teaches the differentiation of the nature.

original: cha 'di gang las gzhan zhes bya ba ni nang du snang ba'i 'dzin ba'i rnam pa las gzhan ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha 'di gang las gzhan zhes bya ba ni nang du snang ba'i 'dzin ba'i rnam pa las gzhan ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is different from this part, etc. ? The blue, yellow, etc. are different from the aspect of the internal appearance of the apprehender.

original: byis pa smos pa ni 'khrul pa dag kho na la de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa smos pa ni 'khrul pa dag kho na la de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the childish is because it appears in that way only to those who are deluded.

original: byang chub sems @203b dpa' chos rnams bdag med par mkhyen pas ni gnyis kyis dben pa rang rig ba tsam kho na mkhyen to //
analyzed: byang chub sems @203b dpa' chos rnams bdag med par mkhyen pas ni gnyis kyis dben pa rang rig ba tsam kho na mkhyen to //
translated: The bodhisattva, who knows that phenomena are selfless, knows only the mere self-awareness that is devoid of duality.

original: nang dang phyi rol du snang ba'i rnam pa 'dis kyang phyi rol gyi don yod pa dang med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol du snang ba'i rnam pa 'dis kyang phyi rol gyi don yod pa dang med kyang rung ste /
translated: Even though the appearance of internal and external objects is like this, external objects may or may not exist.

original: blo ngo bo gnyis ba can nyid yin no //
analyzed: blo ngo bo gnyis ba can nyid yin no //
translated: The mind has a dual identity.

original: de ltar na phyi rol gyi don yod na yang shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol gyi don yod na yang shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, even if external objects exist, one must accept that consciousness has aspects,

original: rnam pa med pas 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa med pas 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without aspects, apprehension is impossible.

original: phyi rol gyi don med na yang shes pa nyid de'i rnam par skye ba de ltar na gsal ba kho nar ngo bo nyid gnyis pa can yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med na yang shes pa nyid de'i rnam par skye ba de ltar na gsal ba kho nar ngo bo nyid gnyis pa can yin no //
translated: Even if external objects do not exist, consciousness itself arises in the aspect of those objects, and thus it is clear that it has a dual identity.

original: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid gnyis pa can gyi shes pa de yang bden pa ma yin par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid gnyis pa can gyi shes pa de yang bden pa ma yin par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: However, that consciousness that has a dual identity is not real; it is posited through the power of error.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa bzhin du tha snyad la dngos por rnam par gzhag ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa bzhin du tha snyad la dngos por rnam par gzhag ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conventional is posited as a thing just as it is imagined.

original: de ltar ma yin na ji ltar na blo gcig la ngo bo gnyis bden par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ji ltar na blo gcig la ngo bo gnyis bden par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, how could two natures be truly in one cognition?

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir blo gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir blo gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúIn one cognition,‚Äù etc.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod na yang blo ngo bo gnyis pa can yin gyi zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod na yang blo ngo bo gnyis pa can yin gyi zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to prove what has been said, namely, that even if external objects exist, cognition has a dual nature.

original: rnam ba med par smra ba'i phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa la ci ste gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: rnam ba med par smra ba'i phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa la ci ste gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: To those who adhere to external objects but deny the existence of the form of cognition, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is not . . .,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni gzung bar 'dod pas sngon po dang ser po 'di'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'di'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni gzung bar 'dod pas sngon po dang ser po 'di'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is its cognition‚Äù means that it is desired to be apprehended, as in ‚ÄúThis is the cognition of blue and yellow.‚Äù

original: de yang nang du 'dus pa na gzhan 'dra ba cig yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang nang du 'dus pa na gzhan 'dra ba cig yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that is not something else that is similar and included within it.

original: snang ba'i rnam pa ste ji skad du bshad ba'i rnam pas nang du 'dus pa ste shes pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa na'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam pa ste ji skad du bshad ba'i rnam pas nang du 'dus pa ste shes pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa na'o //
translated: The aspect of appearance, that is, the aspect as it has been explained, is internal, that is, it is present as the nature of consciousness.

original: gzhan ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Other means different from that.

original: 'dra bar byed pa ni shes pa la gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra bar byed pa ni shes pa la gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa ste /
translated: Causing similarity means causing the image to be placed in consciousness.

original: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan 'dra ba 'jog pa dang 'jog par byed pa gnyis yang dag par myong ba med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan 'dra ba 'jog pa dang 'jog par byed pa gnyis yang dag par myong ba med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the similarity of the form and the image, the placed and the placer, is not experienced.

original: de la 'di ltar 'gyur te gal te shes pa gcig la rnam pa gnyis de kho na nyid du 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar 'gyur te gal te shes pa gcig la rnam pa gnyis de kho na nyid du 'gal ba yin na /
translated: In this regard, this is how it goes: If two aspects in a single consciousness are contradictory in reality,

original: 'o na rnam pa de dag las gang yang rung ba bden par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa de dag las gang yang rung ba bden par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then which of those aspects is true?

original: de'i phyir shes pa bdag nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa bdag nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf the consciousness is a single nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: /'o na gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyang yod pa ma yin na shes pa gang yin pa de'i de kho na nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig lus gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan ni tshu rol mthong ba
analyzed: /'o na gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyang yod pa ma yin na shes pa gang yin pa de'i de kho na nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig lus gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan ni tshu rol mthong ba
translated: ‚ÄúIf both the apprehended and the apprehender do not exist, then what is left that is the reality of consciousness? Apart from the aspects of the apprehended and the apprehender, there is no other nature of consciousness that can be observed by the proponents of consciousness.üîΩ

original: rnams kyis yang dag par myong ba med do //üîΩyang dag par myong na yang de kho na nyid mthong ba @204a * //
analyzed: rnams kyis yang dag par myong ba med do // yang dag par myong na yang de kho na nyid mthong ba @204a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if the duality of apprehended and apprehender does not exist, what other reality of consciousness remains, apart from the aspects of apprehended and apprehender? The nature of consciousness is not experienced by those who see only the near side.

original: nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were experienced, it would be seen as reality.

original: de ltar na lus can dag 'bad rtsol med par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lus can dag 'bad rtsol med par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, embodied beings would be liberated without effort.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa las kyang des pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa las kyang des pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not tenable even from the perspective of inference.

original: 'di ltar re zhig rang bzhin gyi rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni de la srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig rang bzhin gyi rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni de la srid pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, inference arising from a nature sign is not possible in this case,

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because its nature is what is to be proven.

original: /'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: /'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from a result sign,

original: ngo bo gnyis su med pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos bo sgrub par byed ba'i mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis su med pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos bo sgrub par byed ba'i mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-dual nature and the direct perception and non-perception that establish the entity of cause and effect are not established.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu grub pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu grub pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The establishment of cause and effect, which has the characteristic of the cessation of the effect, also does not exist,

original: 'bras bu nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect itself is not established.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnyis su med pa de kho na 'bras bur 'gyur ba zhig na de yang tshad mas grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnyis su med pa de kho na 'bras bur 'gyur ba zhig na de yang tshad mas grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if the non-duality of the YogƒÅcƒÅra becomes the effect, then that is not established by valid cognition.

original: gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Whatever appears dual is not the effect, because it is just like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste rmongs pas gnyis mi shes pa dag gis 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste rmongs pas gnyis mi shes pa dag gis 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: Here it should be said: This is stated by the ignorant who do not understand duality.

original: 'di ltar 'dzin pa'i sgras nang rtogs pa'i ngo bo dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa du mar 'byung ba can rang rig par mi brjod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dzin pa'i sgras nang rtogs pa'i ngo bo dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa du mar 'byung ba can rang rig par mi brjod na /
translated: Thus, if the term ‚Äúapprehending‚Äù does not refer to reflexive awareness, which has the nature of inner realization and arises in many aspects, such as pleasant and unpleasant, then what is it?

original: gang gis na de yang med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de yang med par 'gyur /
translated: How could it not exist?

original: 'on kyang de rnam par shes pa las phyi rol bzhin du sngon po la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa de gcig dang du mas dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de rnam par shes pa las phyi rol bzhin du sngon po la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa de gcig dang du mas dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: However, that which appears as blue and so on, like external objects, is not reality because it cannot withstand the analysis of being either one or many.

original: de bas na re zhig don dam par rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na re zhig don dam par rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, first, the different apprehended objects of consciousness do not exist ultimately.

original: de med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa'i rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i gzung ba 'di'i 'dzin pa'i ngo bo 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i 'dzin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod de ;
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa'i rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i gzung ba 'di'i 'dzin pa'i ngo bo 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i 'dzin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod de ;
translated: Because they do not exist, the apprehender that is imputed in dependence on them, the nature of the thought that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is the apprehender of this apprehended,‚Äù does not exist.

original: byed pa po dang las phan tshun ltos pas rab tu brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las phan tshun ltos pas rab tu brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the agent and object are imputed in mutual dependence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir pa na tshun ltos nas de dag rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir pa na tshun ltos nas de dag rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are established in mutual dependence.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo rang rig pa tsam yang 'dzin pa'i sgras brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo rang rig pa tsam yang 'dzin pa'i sgras brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of realization, which is mere self-awareness, is not expressed by the word ‚Äúgrasping.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni phan tshun ltos nas rab tu brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni phan tshun ltos nas rab tu brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of realization is not imagined in mutual dependence,

original: rang gi rgyu nyid las de de ltar skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu nyid las de de ltar skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in that way from its own cause alone.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo de nyid rang rig pa tsam du gnas so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo de nyid rang rig pa tsam du gnas so //
translated: That very nature of realization abides as mere self-awareness.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gnyis med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gnyis med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it is free from the apprehended and apprehender, as explained, it is called ‚Äúnondual.‚Äù

original: de skad du yang /üîΩsngo dang ser sogs rnam shes las //
analyzed: de skad du yang / sngo dang ser sogs rnam shes las //
translated: As it is said:üîΩBlue, yellow, and so on appear

original: phyi rol @204b bzhin du snang 'gyur ba //üîΩde bden ma yin de phyir phyi //
analyzed: phyi rol @204b bzhin du snang 'gyur ba // de bden ma yin de phyir phyi //
translated: as if external to consciousness.üîΩThey are not real, therefore they are said

original: de nyid du ni med ces bya //üîΩde ltos byed pa po'i ngo bo //
analyzed: de nyid du ni med ces bya // de ltos byed pa po'i ngo bo //
translated: to be nonexistent in reality.üîΩThat which is imagined to be

original: rig par 'dod pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: rig par 'dod pa gang yin pa //
translated: the nature of the agent that depends on that

original: de yang de nyid min de'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang de nyid min de'i phyir //
translated: And that is not reality, therefore

original: myong ba gnyis med ces nges 'gyur //
analyzed: myong ba gnyis med ces nges 'gyur //
translated: it is ascertained as non-dual experience.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa na thams cad kyis de kho na nyid mthong ba'i thal ba med do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa na thams cad kyis de kho na nyid mthong ba'i thal ba med do //
translated: And when the nature of realization is established by reflexive awareness perception, there is no entailment that everyone would see reality.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo de la cha med pa nyid kyi phyir gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo de la cha med pa nyid kyi phyir gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: Because in that nature of realization, there is no division, even if it is grasped, it is not related to the seed of error.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa bzhin du gnyis med pa'i nges pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa bzhin du gnyis med pa'i nges pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as it is realized, the ascertainment of non-duality does not arise.

original: de bas na gnyis med pa'i ngo bo bzung du zin kyang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis med pa'i ngo bo bzung du zin kyang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Thus, even if the nature of non-duality is grasped, it is as if it is not grasped.

original: 'di tsam gyis rtogs pa'i ngo bo yang spyir chos can tsam du ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis rtogs pa'i ngo bo yang spyir chos can tsam du ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: By this much alone, the nature of realization is not generally established as merely the subject.

original: de ltar na chos can rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na chos can rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, the distinction of realizing the subject is the nature of duality and non-duality.

original: bye brag gi ngo bor nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag gi ngo bor nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no certainty as to the specific nature of the subject.

original: chos can tsam yang nges pa med pa yin no zhes sems dang bcas pas brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can tsam yang nges pa med pa yin no zhes sems dang bcas pas brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not possible to say that even the mere subject is not ascertained.

original: de ltar na sgra la sogs pa la yang spyir chos can grub pa la skad cig ma dang / skad cig ma ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi sgo nas brtsad pa na phyis rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sgra la sogs pa la yang spyir chos can grub pa la skad cig ma dang / skad cig ma ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi sgo nas brtsad pa na phyis rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when sound and so on are established in general as the subject, and then are disputed in terms of their specific nature as being momentary or non-momentary, later on, inference will engage.

original: rjes su dpag pa las sngar skad cig ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par ma grub ba nyid phyir chos can tsam yang ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las sngar skad cig ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par ma grub ba nyid phyir chos can tsam yang ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus na /
translated: If it is not possible to say that the mere subject is not established because the specific nature of the momentary and so on is not established prior to inference,

original: gang las gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur /
translated: then how could the reason be nonestablished due to the basis being nonestablished?

original: rjes su dpag pa thams cad la yang spyir chos can grub par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thams cad la yang spyir chos can grub par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: It should be accepted that in all inferences, the subject is established in general.

original: de ltar yin na rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i chos kyang /
analyzed: de ltar yin na rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i chos kyang /
translated: If that is so, then the subject that is the basis of the debate

original: gang gi tshe chos can nges pa'i dus nyid na nges par 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshul gsum pa'i rtags don du gnyer ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos can nges pa'i dus nyid na nges par 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshul gsum pa'i rtags don du gnyer ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the subject is ascertained, it is ascertained. At that time, the three modes of the reason are sought for the sake of the goal, but it is pointless.

original: de'i phyir 'dir yang spyir dga' ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos can rtogs pa mngon sum gyis rab tu grub mod kyi 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir gnyis med pa'i ngo bo ma nges na yang de sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug par
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir yang spyir dga' ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos can rtogs pa mngon sum gyis rab tu grub mod kyi 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir gnyis med pa'i ngo bo ma nges na yang de sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug par
translated: Therefore, here also, in general, the subject possessing pleasure, etc. is understood by perception, and it is well established. However, because error exists, if the nature of non-duality is not ascertained, inference will engage for the sake of establishing that.

original: 'gyur ro // sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang gi ngo bo la gnod pa de ni de'i ngo bos dben pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang gi ngo bo la gnod pa de ni de'i ngo bos dben pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is also this: Whatever is contradictory to the nature of something is devoid of the nature of that,

original: dper na grang ba'i ngo bo la gnod pa dro ba grang ba'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grang ba'i ngo bo la gnod pa dro ba grang ba'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, heat, which is contradictory to the nature of cold, is devoid of the nature of cold.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas nyis kyi ngo bo nyid la gnod pa @205a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas nyis kyi ngo bo nyid la gnod pa @205a * //
translated: The nature of understanding is also contradictory to the nature of duality in the manner explained.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYes‚Äù is the observation of the contradiction of the pervader.

original: de bas na rang rig pa nyid tsam ji skad du bshad pa'i gnyis kyis dben pa'i chos rnams bdag med pa yin gyi dngos po thams cad kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na rang rig pa nyid tsam ji skad du bshad pa'i gnyis kyis dben pa'i chos rnams bdag med pa yin gyi dngos po thams cad kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that only reflexive awareness, as explained, is the emptiness of selflessness of phenomena that are devoid of the two, but not of all things.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dang der chos rnams gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo 'gog par ston pa dang / de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa 'gog par byed pa gang yin pa de yang kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bzung nas yin gyi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo gnyis med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dang der chos rnams gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo 'gog par ston pa dang / de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa 'gog par byed pa gang yin pa de yang kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bzung nas yin gyi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo gnyis med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom and so on, the teaching of the negation of the nature of unity and multiplicity of phenomena and likewise the negation of arising and so on is done by taking the imagined nature, but not the nondual dependent nature.

original: de ltar na gnyis su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa kho nas skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag byed kyi rang rig pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa kho nas skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag byed kyi rang rig pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, only the consciousness that appears as dualistic does the various things such as arising, but not reflexive awareness alone.

original: gnyis su snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir des rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yang brdzun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir des rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yang brdzun pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because the appearance of duality is false, the nature established by it is also false.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir de ni bslad pa nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yul dang yul can gyi rnam pa'i rten gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs yul gyi rnam par gzhag cing /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir de ni bslad pa nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yul dang yul can gyi rnam pa'i rten gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs yul gyi rnam par gzhag cing /
translated: In order to teach just that extensively, he says, ‚ÄúEven though it is polluted,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIn terms of the aspect of object and subject, form and feeling, and so on, are established as the basis.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yul can gyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yul can gyi rnam par ro //
translated: Form is established as the object, and feeling and so on are established as the subject.

original: gang gis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i byed pa po'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: gang gis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i byed pa po'i ngo bos so //
translated: By what is apprehended means by the nature of the superimposing agent.

original: gang dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ba bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gang dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ba bzung ba'o //
translated: By what is apprehended means that it is grasped as appearing like an external object.

original: de'i tshe skye ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rten can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa yin pa de'i tshe de lta bur gyur pa'i skye ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rten can med do zhesüîΩbya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rten can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa yin pa de'i tshe de lta bur gyur pa'i skye ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rten can med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, arising, etc. are not based on the objective realm. This means that when there is error in the form of grasped and grasper, at that time arising, etc. which are of that nature are not based on the objective realm.

original: 'dis ni brtags pa nyid med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni brtags pa nyid med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that they are only imagined.

original: rnam bar shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa zhes ba ba la sogs pas 'dzin pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rnam bar shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa zhes ba ba la sogs pas 'dzin pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúbecause it causes consciousness,‚Äù etc. shows the characteristic of the superimposition of the nature of grasper.

original: gzugs la sogs pa cung zad yul du gyur pa zhes bya ba la gzhig cing gzhom du rung bas na gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa cung zad yul du gyur pa zhes bya ba la gzhig cing gzhom du rung bas na gzugs so //
translated: ‚ÄúA little form, etc. which is the objective realm‚Äù means that form is that which can be destroyed and overcome.

original: mnyan bar bya ba yin pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: mnyan bar bya ba yin pas na sgra'o //
translated: Sound is that which can be heard.

original: 'dis ni gzung ba nyid du sgro btags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzung ba nyid du sgro btags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows the characteristic of the superimposition of the nature of grasped.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDue to the aspect of apprehended object and apprehending subject‚Äù means due to the opposite of the aspect of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pas dpen pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pas dpen pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not characterized by the existence of the connection between apprehended object and apprehending subject.üîΩIt is characterized by being characterized by the connection between apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gung ba'am 'dzin pa dang 'brel pas mtshon par bya ba rnam par gzhag pa yin pas na /üîΩ@205b mtshan nyid yin te rnam pa gzhan du gzhag par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyi ro //
analyzed: gung ba'am 'dzin pa dang 'brel pas mtshon par bya ba rnam par gzhag pa yin pas na / @205b mtshan nyid yin te rnam pa gzhan du gzhag par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyi ro //
translated: It is characterized by being characterized by the connection between apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gyis stod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan gyis mtshon par bya ba rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gyis stod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan gyis mtshon par bya ba rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid de /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause that characteristic is empty of its own intrinsic reality‚Äù means that the nature that is characterized by being characterized by another consciousness is a characteristic.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin des stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin des stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is empty of that kind of intrinsic reality.

original: de rang rig pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rang rig pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it cannot be characterized by another consciousness.

original: mched par byed pas na zhes bya bas ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi skye ba mched par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mched par byed pas na zhes bya bas ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi skye ba mched par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase because it causes the increase means that it causes the increase of the origination of mind and the mental factors.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Non-defiled nescience is the adherence to the belief in the reality of the grasped and the grasper.

original: ci'i phyir yul nges pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa yin na yul dang dus la sogs pa thams cad du rnam par rig pa thob po snyam du sems so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yul nges pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa yin na yul dang dus la sogs pa thams cad du rnam par rig pa thob po snyam du sems so //
translated: Why does it occur in terms of the determination of the object, etc.? If it is independent of external objects, it is thought that consciousness is obtained in regard to all objects, times, etc.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rigs mthun pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rigs mthun pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Because it has the same nature as mind and the mental factors. The mind and the mental factors that occur later are of the same type as the mind and the mental factors that have occurred previously.

original: rang gi rgyud la rag las pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i skad cig ma snga ma'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la rag las pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i skad cig ma snga ma'o //
translated: It depends on its own continuum, which is the prior moment of mind and mental factors.

original: sa bon gang la de'i ngo bo nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon gang la de'i ngo bo nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of a seed is called that.

original: de skad du sa bon zhes bya ba gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs pa'i ngo bo khyad par can snga ma snga ma nyid yin pa de bas na rang rig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad du sa bon zhes bya ba gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtogs pa'i ngo bo khyad par can snga ma snga ma nyid yin pa de bas na rang rig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not the case that there is some other so-called seed, but rather it is the prior special nature of the cognition. Therefore, because it is reflexive awareness,

original: 'di 'di zhes bstan par mi nus so zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di 'di zhes bstan par mi nus so zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: it cannot be indicated as this or that.

original: gal te bstan par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩ'di 'di zhes bstan par mi nus so zhes smra pas de dpyad par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin par khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te bstan par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'di 'di zhes bstan par mi nus so zhes smra pas de dpyad par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin par khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the nature of reflexive awareness cannot be indicated,

original: dpyad par nus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni ji ltar ston par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dpyad par nus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni ji ltar ston par mi 'gyur /
translated: then you are accepting that it is not an object of analysis, but if it is an object of analysis, how could it not be indicated?

original: bstan par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin de ji ltar yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: bstan par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin de ji ltar yod pa ma yin /
translated: How could that nature which cannot be taught exist?

original: yod pa rnam par gzhag pa yang pa yang bstan pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa rnam par gzhag pa yang pa yang bstan pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Because the presentation of existence is preceded by teaching.

original: gal te de med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: gal te de med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: If it were nonexistent, it would be like the horn of a donkey.üîΩThis is the opinion of the proponent of tenets.

original: 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te bde ba la sogs pa so so rang gis rig pa ni 'di nyid du bstan par nus pa can nam tha snyad du 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te bde ba la sogs pa so so rang gis rig pa ni 'di nyid du bstan par nus pa can nam tha snyad du 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: This is what is taught: The individual reflexive awareness of pleasure and so on is not something that can be taught in this life or is suitable to be conventionally expressed.

original: de ni de tsam du med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de tsam du med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it does not exist in that way.

original: @206a * // 'khrul pa'i sa bon yang rnam par shes pa nyid sngon du song ba can yin la de med na rtogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @206a * // 'khrul pa'i sa bon yang rnam par shes pa nyid sngon du song ba can yin la de med na rtogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The seed of error is preceded by consciousness itself, and without it, realization would not occur.

original: de bas na rang rig pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir dang phyi rol yang shin tu med pa'i phyir dang 'di thams cad ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rang rig pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir dang phyi rol yang shin tu med pa'i phyir dang 'di thams cad ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because mere reflexive awareness does not exist, and because external objects do not exist, all of this would be like the horn of a rabbit.

original: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ji ltar rmi lam na dmigs pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi rmi lam na gang 'ga' zhig skye ba dang 'chi bar dmigs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag gis dman pa dang khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob par dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni rmi lam na dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ji ltar rmi lam na dmigs pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi rmi lam na gang 'ga' zhig skye ba dang 'chi bar dmigs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag gis dman pa dang khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob par dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni rmi lam na dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since there is no difference between non-existence, how is it that in a dream, some people see the birth and death of people, and likewise, some see the attainment of a lower or higher state?üîΩThose are the objects of perception in a dream.

original: rmi lam na ste rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na ji srid du skyes bu mthong ba po de ma sad pa de srid du de la de ltar skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa dmigs pa de ltar skyes bu mthong ba po sad pa na yang /
analyzed: rmi lam na ste rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na ji srid du skyes bu mthong ba po de ma sad pa de srid du de la de ltar skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa dmigs pa de ltar skyes bu mthong ba po sad pa na yang /
translated: As long as the person who sees the dream has not awakened, for that long, the objects of perception such as birth and death appear in that way.

original: de dag gi rmi lam na dmigs pa'i skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rmi lam na dmigs pa'i skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when the person who sees the dream awakens, all the conventions of birth and death that are perceived in the dream are transcended.

original: skyes bu mthong ba po bzhin te /
analyzed: skyes bu mthong ba po bzhin te /
translated: It is just like the person who sees the dream.

original: skyes bu rmi lam mthong ba po de'i ji ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa de ltar rmi lam gyi skyes bu mthong ba po rnams kyang sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: skyes bu rmi lam mthong ba po de'i ji ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa de ltar rmi lam gyi skyes bu mthong ba po rnams kyang sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning is that just as the conventions of birth, death, etc. are used in the waking state of the person who sees the dream, so they would be in the waking state of the persons who see the dream.

original: to // med pa 'di dag la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na dmigs pa dang skyes bu mthong ba po dag gi la'o //
analyzed: to // med pa 'di dag la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na dmigs pa dang skyes bu mthong ba po dag gi la'o //
translated: ‚Äú These non-existents‚Äù refers to the objects perceived in the dream and the persons who see the dream.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Like the person who is actually desired‚Äù refers to

original: gang skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'dod pa'o //
translated: the person who is actually desired to be born and die, etc.

original: 'di yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: 'di yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú This is not so‚Äù refers to the person who is actually desired.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba la yang brgal ba 'di mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba la yang brgal ba 'di mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: This objection is the same for the one who maintains that the object of knowledge is internal.

original: 'di ltar de'i sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa phyi dang nang na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa phyi dang nang na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the blue, yellow, etc. do not exist either externally or internally.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de'i phyir don dam shes pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam shes pa la //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate is not a gross appearance.

original: rags snang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rags snang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained by the passage beginning with ‚Äúnot a gross appearance.‚Äù

original: phyi dang nang na med pa nyid kyi phyir ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi dang nang na med pa nyid kyi phyir ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin no //
