translated: It is like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist either externally or internally.

original: de la med pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin na ci'i phyir sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa yul dang dus nges pa can skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo gsal bar snang bar 'gyur gyi ri bong gi rva laüîΩsogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la med pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin na ci'i phyir sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa yul dang dus nges pa can skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo gsal bar snang bar 'gyur gyi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the same in not existing, why does blue, yellow, etc., which is limited to a particular place and time, appear clearly as a nature distinguished by arising, ceasing, and enduring, but not the horn of a rabbit, etc.?

original: brgal ba 'di mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brgal ba 'di mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: This objection is not the same.

original: 'di ltar phyin ci log tu snang ba can gyi 'khrul pa'i @206b sa bon sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo don dam par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyin ci log tu snang ba can gyi 'khrul pa'i @206b sa bon sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo don dam par yod pa yin te /
translated: The seed of error, which is a mistaken appearance, is the ultimate existence of a nature that is the same as mind and mental functions.

original: de yang nus pa so sor nges pa can yin no //
analyzed: de yang nus pa so sor nges pa can yin no //
translated: And that is limited to a particular capacity.

original: nus pa so sor nges pa de las kyang phyin ci log gi 'khrul pa skye ba don dam par rang rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can yin na yang /
analyzed: nus pa so sor nges pa de las kyang phyin ci log gi 'khrul pa skye ba don dam par rang rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can yin na yang /
translated: And from that, the arising of the error of the opposite is also due to the power of internal corruption.

original: nang gi bslad pa'i dbang gis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa med du zin kyang phyi rol na gnas pa bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa bzhin du ston gyi sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa la phyi rol
analyzed: nang gi bslad pa'i dbang gis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa med du zin kyang phyi rol na gnas pa bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa bzhin du ston gyi sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa la phyi rol
translated: Even though blue, yellow, etc. do not exist, they are shown to be endowed with arising, destruction, etc. as if they existed externally, because of the power of internal corruption.

original: gyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But blue, yellow, etc. are not endowed with external arising and destruction.

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa yang de lta bur gyur pa ston par byed kyi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa yang de lta bur gyur pa ston par byed kyi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And it is blue, etc. that are shown to be such, not the horns of a donkey, etc.

original: 'khrul pa ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because error has just such a nature.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa'i sa bon las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa'i sa bon las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And just such a nature arises from just such a seed.

original: med pa ston par byed pa'i 'khrul pa ni ji ltar 'ga' zhig med pa de ston par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ston par byed pa'i 'khrul pa ni ji ltar 'ga' zhig med pa de ston par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: The error of teaching nonexistence is like someone teaching nonexistence, but not everything.

original: dper na rab rib la sogs pas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba de ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib la sogs pas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba de ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is well known that error is produced by cataracts and so on.

original: 'di ni gang la 'khrul pa med cing 'khrul pa'i yul yang med do zhes thams cad med par smra ba la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gang la 'khrul pa med cing 'khrul pa'i yul yang med do zhes thams cad med par smra ba la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case for the one who advocates the nonexistence of everything, for whom there is no error and no object of error.

original: re zhig gzhan shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba kha cig gis de ltar khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gzhan shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba kha cig gis de ltar khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: This is what some who advocate that the object of knowledge is internal accept.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa gzhan dag ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa thams cad med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa gzhan dag ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa thams cad med pa ma yin te /
translated: Other Yogacaras say that blue, yellow, and so on are not nonexistent,

original: dga' ba la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are clearly experienced, like pleasure and so on.

original: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: However, blue and so on do not exist as external entities.

original: shes pa 'dzin par 'dod pa gcig gi yang cha gnyis par gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa 'dzin par 'dod pa gcig gi yang cha gnyis par gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no second part of a single cognition that is asserted to be the apprehender.

original: dgongs pa 'dis ni shes pa la rags pa'i rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'dis ni shes pa la rags pa'i rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this intention, the explanation of the appearance of a coarse aspect in cognition is given.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa la zhes bya ba'i 'dun pas 'dzin pa'i cha so sor bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa la zhes bya ba'i 'dun pas 'dzin pa'i cha so sor bstan te /
translated: For that very reason, the part of the apprehender is taught separately by the word ‚Äúin‚Äù in ‚Äúin cognition.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nang gi bde ba la sogs pa rang nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dzin pa gzhan gyi char gyur pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: ji ltar nang gi bde ba la sogs pa rang nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dzin pa gzhan gyi char gyur pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: Just as internal pleasure and so on, which have the nature of being realized by themselves, are not a part of another apprehender,

original: nyams su myong ba tsam gyi bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam gyi bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are just the nature of experience.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nyid kyis gnyis med pa yin no //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nyid kyis gnyis med pa yin no //
translated: It is nondual because it is free from the imagined aspects of apprehended and apprehender.

original: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang rang nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin gyi gzhan gyi char gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang rang nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin gyi gzhan gyi char gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, blue and so on are also the nature of being realized by themselves and are not a part of another.

original: bde ba la @207a * //
analyzed: bde ba la @207a * //
translated: Because they are just the nature of experience.

original: sogs pa bzhin du rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa bzhin du rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas gnyis dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas gnyis dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: It is nondual because it is free from duality in the manner that has been explained.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon chos kyi grags pas sngon po'i nyams su myong ba la sngon po nyams su myong bzhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon chos kyi grags pas sngon po'i nyams su myong ba la sngon po nyams su myong bzhes mi brjod do //
translated: As Dharmakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúWhen blue is experienced, it is not called ‚Äòthe experience of blue.‚Äô

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it called?üîΩIt is called ‚Äòthe experience of blue.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: sngon po kho na nyams su myong ba sngon po nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / shes las tha dad ma yin na //
analyzed: sngon po kho na nyams su myong ba sngon po nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / shes las tha dad ma yin na //
translated: And, ‚ÄúIf it is not different from consciousness,

original: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
translated: how can it be an object that is different?

original: gal te spyi ni shes ngo bo'i //
analyzed: gal te spyi ni shes ngo bo'i //
translated: If the universal is the nature of the object of consciousness,

original: don nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it follows that it is an object.

original: de ltar 'dod phyir skyon yod min //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod phyir skyon yod min //
translated: This is not a problem for us, because we accept that.

original: zhes bya ba dang / cig car dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / cig car dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir //
translated: And, ‚ÄúBecause it is ascertained that the object is apprehended simultaneously,

original: sngon po de blo tha dad med //
analyzed: sngon po de blo tha dad med //
translated: blue is not different from the cognition of blue.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.üîΩ

original: tha dad pa dgag pa tsam de bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi tha dad pa med do zhes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dgag pa tsam de bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi tha dad pa med do zhes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mere negation of difference is the probandum, not the negation of the nonexistence of difference.

original: de yang bshad na bstan bcos mdzad pa mi mkhas par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bshad na bstan bcos mdzad pa mi mkhas par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: If we explain it in this way, it would show that the author of the treatise is not skilled.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de dag kyang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin na de'i tha dad pa bgag pa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de dag kyang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin na de'i tha dad pa bgag pa ci zhig bya /
translated: If those blue things, etc. are like the horns of a rabbit, what is the point of negating their difference?

original: yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: We should say that they do not exist at all.

original: ji ltar na shin tu dmigs pa gcig dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na shin tu dmigs pa gcig dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can a single, very evident thing be an object?

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang //
translated: The Acarya Dignaga also says:

original: nang gi shes bya'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: nang gi shes bya'i ngo bo ni //
translated: The internal object is

original: phyi rol ltar snang gang yin de //
analyzed: phyi rol ltar snang gang yin de //
translated: That which appears as if external.

original: don yin rnam shes ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: don yin rnam shes ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the nature of consciousness,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the object.

original: de bas na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang rang dbang nyid du rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang rang dbang nyid du rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, like pleasure, etc., blue, etc. are the nature of the realization of independence.

original: gal te 'o na du ma cig car shes pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'o na du ma cig car shes pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you accept that, then the fault that you have stated does not exist, because you yourself accept that many cognitions are obtained simultaneously.

original: 'o na ji ltar na sems can rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na sems can rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig pa can yin zhe na /
translated: But how can sentient beings have a single continuum of consciousness?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction, because the statement is made with reference to the consciousness that is the result of evolution.

original: gal te 'o na shes pa gcig ces bya ba ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na shes pa gcig ces bya ba ci yin zhe na /
translated: But what is a single cognition?

original: 'di ltar rnam par phye ba byas na yang shes pa gzhan nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par phye ba byas na yang shes pa gzhan nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de ni gcig yin no //
translated: Even if it is divided, it is still a single cognition, because another cognition is not experienced.

original: de la shes pa gzhan yod do zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de la shes pa gzhan yod do zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that another cognition exists in that cognition,

original: shes pa nyams su myong ba med pa la yod pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir dang / shes pa ni nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyams su myong ba med pa la yod pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir dang / shes pa ni nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for something to exist in a cognition that is not experienced, and because a cognition does not have the essential nature of an experience.

original: go rims 'di phyi rol la yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: go rims 'di phyi rol la yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This order does not exist for external things.

original: phyi rol nyams su myong ba med pa la yod yod pa nyid khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol nyams su myong ba med pa la yod yod pa nyid khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that external objects are experienced when they are not present.

original: gal te 'o na @207b bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na @207b bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: If blue, etc. are the nature of consciousness, like pleasure, etc.

original: ci'i phyir phyi rol bzhin du snang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyi rol bzhin du snang zhe na /
translated: why do they appear as external?

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: This is due to the nature of error.

original: de ni 'di nyid rig can min //
analyzed: de ni 'di nyid rig can min //
translated: It is not aware of itself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de kho na nyid gnyis su med pa nyid ngo bo rig pa ma yin zhing /üîΩmngon sum du byas pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de kho na nyid gnyis su med pa nyid ngo bo rig pa ma yin zhing / mngon sum du byas pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is not aware of itself, i.e., of reality, which is nondual.üîΩThis is what is meant by ‚Äúit is not aware of itself.‚Äù

original: gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: By whom?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa yang dag par chad pa mchog mthong ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa yang dag par chad pa mchog mthong ste /
translated: The supreme seeing of the cessation of the adherence to the grasped and the grasper.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supreme because it is superior.

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pa so so'i skye bo gang dag la mchog mthong ba med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pa so so'i skye bo gang dag la mchog mthong ba med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because it is free from the characteristics of that, it is said that ‚Äúthe supreme is not seen by ordinary beings who have not abandoned the adherence to the apprehended and apprehender.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni sangs rgyas las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid ni sangs rgyas las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúonly the Buddhas, etc.‚Äù

original: thams cad smos pas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi yang de rnam pa thams cad du spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad smos pas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi yang de rnam pa thams cad du spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: By mentioning all, it is shown that it is not the domain of the Hearers and Solitary Realizers in any way.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyin ci log gi rnam par phye ba mnga' bde la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyin ci log gi rnam par phye ba mnga' bde la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Buddhas, the Venerable Ones, are said to have the discernment of the inverted.üîΩIn that way, because they are other than the Buddhas, they are in a state of corruption.

original: de skad du gang gi phyir sangs rgyas las gzhan pa bslad pa'i gnas skabs can yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad du gang gi phyir sangs rgyas las gzhan pa bslad pa'i gnas skabs can yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: mang po dag gi mthong ba'i ngor mdzad nas /
analyzed: mang po dag gi mthong ba'i ngor mdzad nas /
translated: having made it visible to many,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa mdzad kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa mdzad kyi /
translated: The Buddha, the Transcendent Lord, posits things as he sees them,

original: kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: but not as they are in reality.

original: de ltar 'khrul pas mthong ba'i dor mdzad nas bstan pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhen pa mi mnga' ba'i rgyu bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pas mthong ba'i dor mdzad nas bstan pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir zhen pa mi mnga' ba'i rgyu bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having taught that things are seen through error, he now teaches the cause of non-attachment.

original: 'di gnyis kyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnyis kyis dben pa de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnyis kyis dben pa de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has the characteristic of being devoid of duality.

original: gnyis kyis dben pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba de kho na nyid mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyis dben pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba de kho na nyid mthong ba yin no //
translated: Because reality is devoid of duality, the experience of consciousness that is devoid of duality is the seeing of reality.

original: de bas na gnyis kyis dben pa'i shes pa nyid skyes ba'i dus na de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis kyis dben pa'i shes pa nyid skyes ba'i dus na de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the consciousness that is devoid of duality arises, one sees reality.

original: ji ltar snang ba las bzlog pa la 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs par 'dzin par ro //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba las bzlog pa la 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs par 'dzin par ro //
translated: The phrase in the opposite way to the way they appear means that they are apprehended as a self, etc.

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched rnam par phye nas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi skye mched rnam par phye nas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The phrase in this way refers to the presentation of the sense bases in terms of their internal and external natures.

original: ril por 'dzin pa la sogs pa bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa du ma nyid du bstan pa na /üîΩde la @208a * //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa la sogs pa bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa du ma nyid du bstan pa na / de la @208a * //
translated: The phrase in order to counteract the apprehension of a unitary, etc., self means that, when form, etc., are shown to be multiple,

original: gcig dang rtag pa nyid la sogs par 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzugs sna tshogs pa dang blo sna tshogs pa dag kyang skyon mtshungs pa yin na yang ste /
analyzed: gcig dang rtag pa nyid la sogs par 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro // gzugs sna tshogs pa dang blo sna tshogs pa dag kyang skyon mtshungs pa yin na yang ste /
translated: the apprehension of them as one and permanent, etc., is eliminated.

original: blo gcig tu 'gyur zhing sna tshogs pa dang / de bzhin gzugs gcig tu 'gyur zhing sna tshogs pa yin zhing sngar bshad pa'i rnam pas skyon mtshungs pa yin na'o //
analyzed: blo gcig tu 'gyur zhing sna tshogs pa dang / de bzhin gzugs gcig tu 'gyur zhing sna tshogs pa yin zhing sngar bshad pa'i rnam pas skyon mtshungs pa yin na'o //
translated: The phrase the same fault applies to the diversity of cognition and the diversity of form means that, if cognition is one and form is diverse, or if cognition is diverse and form is one, the same fault that was explained previously applies.

original: de thams cad kyis ni cig car snang bar gyur pa sngon po las shes pa'i bdag nyid can cig car dmigs pa'i sgo nas phan tshun tha dad pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de thams cad kyis ni cig car snang bar gyur pa sngon po las shes pa'i bdag nyid can cig car dmigs pa'i sgo nas phan tshun tha dad pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: All of these prove that blue and consciousness are simultaneously observed, and thus they are mutually different.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa ni de nyid bsgrub par bzhed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa ni de nyid bsgrub par bzhed pa ma yin no //
translated: But the author of the treatise does not accept that.

original: de ltar na phan tshun dben pa'i ngo bo sngon bo dang ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa gcig tu 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang khas blangs nas kyang 'dir rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gcig nyid du khas blangs par nus pa nyid yin gyi phyi'i ni ma yin
analyzed: de ltar na phan tshun dben pa'i ngo bo sngon bo dang ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa gcig tu 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang khas blangs nas kyang 'dir rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gcig nyid du khas blangs par nus pa nyid yin gyi phyi'i ni ma yin
translated: Thus, although blue, yellow, and so on, which are essentially mutually exclusive, are indeed observed as one, still, in this context, it is possible to accept that they are one in some way, but not in terms of external objects.

original: te / rnam pa thams cad du 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di la nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: te / rnam pa thams cad du 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di la nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: This is because they are contradictory in every way. This is why this is presented here.

original: / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /üîΩbam po lnga bcu rtsa drug pa /
analyzed: / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad / bam po lnga bcu rtsa drug pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: shes pa'i bye brag yin te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes pa'i bye brag yin te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a specific consciousness, that is, it has the nature of experience.

original: bdag nyid du gyur pa yang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa las /
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur pa yang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa las /
translated: Nor is that which has become the self arisen from that which has not become the self.

original: bdag nyid gcod par byed pa ma yin no zhes khyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcod par byed pa ma yin no zhes khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: And the self that is the nature of the self does not cut off the self that is the nature of the self.üîΩThis is the distinction.üîΩAnd because the nonappearance of one thing is not the appearance of another,

original: gcig mi snang bas kyang gzhan yang mi snang pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cig car dmigs par gyur pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can sngon po la sogs pa'i nang nas gcig mi snang ba na yang gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig mi snang bas kyang gzhan yang mi snang pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cig car dmigs par gyur pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can sngon po la sogs pa'i nang nas gcig mi snang ba na yang gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: when one thing among the cognitions that simultaneously observe blue and so on does not appear, the other does not appear.

original: gcig bsgribs pa na yang phyi ma snang ba nyid ma yin nam zhen /
analyzed: gcig bsgribs pa na yang phyi ma snang ba nyid ma yin nam zhen /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that when one is obscured, the other appears?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe shes pa gzhan nyid skyes pa yin gyi snga ma'i cha bsgribs pa ni ma yin te shes pa lus can ma yin pa'i cha sgrib par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe shes pa gzhan nyid skyes pa yin gyi snga ma'i cha bsgribs pa ni ma yin te shes pa lus can ma yin pa'i cha sgrib par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because at that time another cognition arises, but the part of the former is not obscured, because it is impossible for the part of the cognition that is not embodied to be obscured.

original: go rims 'di ni phyi rol nyid la 'gyur te /
analyzed: go rims 'di ni phyi rol nyid la 'gyur te /
translated: This order applies to external objects.

original: yul tha dad pa na gnas pa de la yul gcig gis bsgribs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa na gnas pa de la yul gcig gis bsgribs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that one object would obstruct that [object] which is located in a different place.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod na shes pa sna tshogs su snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis rnam par phye nas 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod na shes pa sna tshogs su snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis rnam par phye nas 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: If one wishes to change [the position of the object], then one perceives the various appearances of consciousness by means of another consciousness that is connected with conceptualization.

original: de bas na gcig mi snang bas kyang gzhan yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gcig mi snang bas kyang gzhan yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since even when one [object] does not appear, the other does not appear either, the reason is not established.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @208b so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @208b so ;
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThus, when . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: / shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa de dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
analyzed: / shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa de dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another consciousness‚Äù means by that which is connected with conceptualization.

original: shes pa de tshol bar byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gzhan nyid la der sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa de tshol bar byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gzhan nyid la der sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat consciousness does not seek‚Äù means that it superimposes another image of conceptualization onto that [object].

original: dbang po'i shes pa sna tshogs pa bdag gir mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa sna tshogs pa bdag gir mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the various sense consciousnesses do not appropriate [the object].

original: de ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa phyi mas 'di ni sngon po yin no zhes gzung ba nyid du rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de'i ngo bo can ni dbang po'i shes pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: de ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa phyi mas 'di ni sngon po yin no zhes gzung ba nyid du rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de'i ngo bo can ni dbang po'i shes pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i
translated: Because that is not its nature. The meaning is that the nature of that which is distinguished by the subsequent cognition as ‚Äúthis is blue‚Äù is not the sense consciousness.

original: don to // rnam par phye ba de ni shes pa phyi ma gzung ba'i cha nyid du 'gyur gyi snga ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don to // rnam par phye ba de ni shes pa phyi ma gzung ba'i cha nyid du 'gyur gyi snga ma ni ma yin te /
translated: That distinction would be the subsequent cognition‚Äôs aspect of the apprehended, not the former.

original: rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of mere reflexive awareness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don la 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don la 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚ÄúIt would engage the object, etc.‚Äù

original: don nyid la de'i shes pa 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi cha nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don nyid la de'i shes pa 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi cha nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would cause the cognition of the object itself to engage, which means it would cause the cognition of its own aspect to engage.

original: chod pa zhes bya ba ni bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: chod pa zhes bya ba ni bsgribs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúObstructed‚Äù means covered.

original: de yang phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas gdon mi za bar de ltar khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir brjod pa yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang phyi rol gyi don khas blangs nas gdon mi za bar de ltar khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir brjod pa yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, since one must accept external objects, one must accept that the mind is of one nature, but this is not by the power of things,

original: phyi rol de kho na nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol de kho na nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because external objects are not established in reality.

original: de ltar gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur //
translated: Thus, it becomes of one nature.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to such statements,

original: sems sna tshogs su snang ba gang yin pa de nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur gyi phyi rol sna tshogs su snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma yin no
analyzed: sems sna tshogs su snang ba gang yin pa de nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur gyi phyi rol sna tshogs su snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma yin no
translated: the mind that appears as various things becomes the nature of the experience that is the nature of consciousness, as explained, but it is not the case that whatever appears as external variety becomes that.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa bzhin du rnam par mi 'byed pa ma yin na yang rma bya la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa bzhin du rnam par mi 'byed pa ma yin na yang rma bya la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though it is not the case that it does not apprehend the aspects of various minds, it is like a peacock‚Äôs tail feather, etc.

original: rma bya la sogs pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de 'dzin pa gnag yin pa de ni rnam par 'byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rma bya la sogs pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de 'dzin pa gnag yin pa de ni rnam par 'byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the apprehender of whatever is the nature of a peacock, etc. is not a distinguisher.

original: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dpe yin no //
translated: The example, ‚Äúlike the apprehender of various cognitions,‚Äù has a dissimilarity.

original: 'o na de'i 'dzin pa ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i 'dzin pa ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: Well then, what kind of apprehender is it?

original: sna tshogs pa der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: sna tshogs pa der zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: He says, ‚ÄúVarious, in that . . .‚Äù

original: rma bya la sogs pa la brten pa'i sna tshogs pa der 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rma bya la sogs pa la brten pa'i sna tshogs pa der 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The apprehender of various, in that it is based on a peacock, etc.

original: rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa nyid 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa nyid 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the apprehender is endowed with a distinguisher.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par phye nas 'dzin pa nyid ston to //
translated: He shows that it is endowed with a distinguisher in ‚ÄúThere, . . . ,‚Äù etc.

original: phyi rol gyi ras dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ras dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAn external cloth‚Äù is another‚Äôs.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du gal te yan lag gi @209a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du gal te yan lag gi @209a * //
translated: This is what he means: If the apprehender of a cloth were a distinguisher, then the apprehender of a peacock would not be a distinguisher.

original: ngo bo la ltos nas gang sna tshogs pa rnam par phye bar nus pa can de ni zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ngo bo la ltos nas gang sna tshogs pa rnam par phye bar nus pa can de ni zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you say that which is capable of being differentiated as manifold in terms of its nature,

original: grub pa la sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa'am /
translated: then the reason is unestablished, or else it is contradictory.

original: ci ste yan lag can gyi ngo bo la ltos pa de'i tshe //
analyzed: ci ste yan lag can gyi ngo bo la ltos pa de'i tshe //
translated: But if you say in terms of the nature of the whole,

original: gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa ma grub pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa ma grub pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: then the reason is unestablished and has a contradictory meaning.

original: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //üîΩsna tshogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba ma tshang ba med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi gzugs chod pa na yang yan lag can gyi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no // sna tshogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba ma tshang ba med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi gzugs chod pa na yang yan lag can gyi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the opponent says, then the reason is unestablished.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the whole, the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the reason is unestablished.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the whole, the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the reason is unestablished.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the whole, the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the reason is unestablished.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the whole, the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the reason is unestablished.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the whole, the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the reason is unestablished.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsal byed la sogs pa'i gzhung 'god par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsal byed la sogs pa'i gzhung 'god par byed do //
translated: If you say in terms of the nature of the whole, the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the reason is unestablished.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: If you say in terms of the nature of the whole, the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you say in terms of the nature of the parts, the reason is unestablished.

original: so so tha dad pa la zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'i gnas skas ma yin pa la ste /
analyzed: so so tha dad pa la zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'i gnas skas ma yin pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the absence of a collection‚Äù means in the absence of a collection of parts.

original: so sor nus pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so sor nus pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not individually capable.

original: gal te so sor skyes phul byung //
analyzed: gal te so sor skyes phul byung //
translated: If they were individually capable,

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: this is the s≈´tra.

original: de la so so'i sgra zlos pa'i don yin par bstan pa'i phyir yang so so so sor zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la so so'i sgra zlos pa'i don yin par bstan pa'i phyir yang so so so sor zhes smos so //
translated: In order to show that the word ‚Äúindividually‚Äù is repeated, he says ‚Äúindividually, individually.‚Äù

original: de'i don ni re re zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni re re zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is ‚Äúeach.‚Äù

original: so so so sor skyes phul byung //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //üîΩ'di skad du ma tshogs pa'i gnas na so so nus pa med pa yin zhing tshogs par gyur pa na nus pa skye ste /
analyzed: so so so sor skyes phul byung // zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro // 'di skad du ma tshogs pa'i gnas na so so nus pa med pa yin zhing tshogs par gyur pa na nus pa skye ste /
translated: The meaning of the s≈´tra is that they are individually capable when they are assembled.üîΩThis is what is being said: In the absence of a collection, they are not individually capable, but when they are assembled, they become capable.

original: rdul phra rab rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the atoms are momentary.

original: de dag gi phul du byung ba yang gang las yin zhen /
analyzed: de dag gi phul du byung ba yang gang las yin zhen /
translated: What is their excellence?

original: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba'i rkyen las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba'i rkyen las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúfrom the condition of mutual approach.‚Äù

original: nye bar len pa snga ma snga ma rdul phra rab phan tshun mngon du phyogs pas 'gro ba ni nye bar 'gor ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa snga ma snga ma rdul phra rab phan tshun mngon du phyogs pas 'gro ba ni nye bar 'gor ba'o //
translated: The movement of the prior appropriated entities is the movement of the atoms that face one another.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yul rung ba na gnas pa dang mchod pa'i rkyen de nyid bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yul rung ba na gnas pa dang mchod pa'i rkyen de nyid bzung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the condition of the object being suitable and the condition of worship.

original: rdul phra rab gzhan gyis ma chod pa'i yul la gnas pa rang gi nye bar len pa de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gzhan gyis ma chod pa'i yul la gnas pa rang gi nye bar len pa de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object is that which is situated in a place that is not obstructed by other atoms.

original: gzhan dang gzhan las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa las khyad par de yin no zhes de skad du ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa las khyad par de yin no zhes de skad du ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom another and another‚Äù indicates that this is the difference from the cooperating conditions.

original: rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid ni yul yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid ni yul yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The object is the cause that is capable of positing the object.

original: rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the object just the cognition that has the aspect of the atom?

original: ji ltar na rdul phra rab rang gi rnam par 'jog par nus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rdul phra rab rang gi rnam par 'jog par nus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the atom be capable of positing its own aspect?

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa ni rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa yin gyi zlum po la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa ni rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa yin gyi zlum po la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, blue, etc. are the aspects of atoms, but not round, etc.

original: rdul phra rab ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because atoms are not established.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam @209b pa yang shes pa yin pa de ltar na rdul phra rab yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam @209b pa yang shes pa yin pa de ltar na rdul phra rab yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: The aspect of blue, etc. is consciousness. Thus, atoms are the object.

original: du ma cig car 'dzin pa med do zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: du ma cig car 'dzin pa med do zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But hasn't it been explained that there is no simultaneous apprehension of many?

original: de'i phyir du ma ci car bzung ba ma yin zhes bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma ci car bzung ba ma yin zhes bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, It is not explained that many are not simultaneously apprehended.üîΩWhen one part becomes distinct, the whole marked by that part is also apprehended.

original: gang gi tshe yan lag khyad par du 'gyur pa gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nang gi tshe yan lag gcig gis khyad par du byas pa'i yan lag can yan lag rdzogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yan lag khyad par du 'gyur pa gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nang gi tshe yan lag gcig gis khyad par du byas pa'i yan lag can yan lag rdzogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one part becomes distinct, the whole marked by that part is also apprehended. This is the meaning.

original: khyad pa du ma'i 'brel ba cig car ces bya ba ni khyad par du ma yan lag can gyi 'brel ba gang yin pa de'i nges pa cig car byed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad pa du ma'i 'brel ba cig car ces bya ba ni khyad par du ma yan lag can gyi 'brel ba gang yin pa de'i nges pa cig car byed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúsimultaneously, in the case of the relation of many differences‚Äù means that it is impossible to ascertain simultaneously the relation of many differences to the whole.

original: de ltar na khyad par phan tshun bye brag tu gyur pa ma yin pa de lta bu dag ni cig car 'dzin pa gzhan gyis mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na khyad par phan tshun bye brag tu gyur pa ma yin pa de lta bu dag ni cig car 'dzin pa gzhan gyis mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, in the case of differences that are not mutually distinct, other people do not accept their simultaneous apprehension.

original: de nyid ni de ltar na yan lag de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni de ltar na yan lag de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In this regard, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, those parts, etc.‚Äù

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi phan tshun yan lag rnams khyad par med pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi phan tshun yan lag rnams khyad par med pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: ‚ÄúWe do accept that they are apprehended, even though the parts are not mutually distinct,

original: yan lag can gcig la khyad par nyid khas len pa'i phyir 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: yan lag can gcig la khyad par nyid khas len pa'i phyir 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: because we accept that the whole itself is distinct.‚Äù

original: de phyir yan lag can yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir yan lag can yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, the whole, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe yan lag khyad par du gyur pa gcig nyid kyis shes par 'gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe yan lag khyad par du gyur pa gcig nyid kyis shes par 'gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di'i skabs yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the context of the statement, ‚ÄúIn that case, when the parts are mutually distinct, the cognition of the whole is not tenable.‚Äù

original: yan lag rnams la yon tan la sogs pa rdzas zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams la yan lag dang 'brel ba can gyi yon tan dang las la sogs pa 'du ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnams la yon tan la sogs pa rdzas zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams la yan lag dang 'brel ba can gyi yon tan dang las la sogs pa 'du ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The substance of qualities, etc. in the parts is the collection and possession of qualities, actions, etc. that are related to the parts.

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas kyang yan lag re re la yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas kyang yan lag re re la yin te /
translated: The substance of the whole is in each part,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the whole is present in each part.üîΩIt is said that one grasps something by something,

original: gang 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa 'du ba dang ldan pa'i yon tan gyi yan lag can du gtogs pa'i las kyang 'dzin par 'gyur gyi las kyi yon tan yang yin no //
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa 'du ba dang ldan pa'i yon tan gyi yan lag can du gtogs pa'i las kyang 'dzin par 'gyur gyi las kyi yon tan yang yin no //
translated: that is, one grasps the substance of the whole that is related to the collection and possession of the parts, such as the ear, etc. The action that is included in the substance of the whole is also the quality of action.

original: brgyud bas 'brel pa rtogs pa na //
analyzed: brgyud bas 'brel pa rtogs pa na //
translated: When there is the cognition of the relation through the series,üîΩthe action of the whole is in the parts,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yan lag can gyi las yan lag can la 'du ba dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yan lag can gyi las yan lag can la 'du ba dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: because the action of the whole is related to the parts through the series.

original: yan lag can yang yan lag rnams la yin pa de ltar na brgyud pas yan lag can la gnas pa'i las kyang 'du ba dang ldan pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba las yan lag la 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can yang yan lag rnams la yin pa de ltar na brgyud pas yan lag can la gnas pa'i las kyang 'du ba dang ldan pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba las yan lag la 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The whole is in the parts, and in the same way, the action that resides in the whole is related to the parts, through the medium of the conjunctions and disjunctions that are in the parts.

original: gang gi tshe rva'i 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ba lang nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rva'i 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ba lang nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the cow.

original: cig car du ma 'dzin pa'i phyogs kyi skyon gzhan ni gang gi tshe cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: cig car du ma 'dzin pa'i phyogs kyi skyon gzhan ni gang gi tshe cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Another fault of the theory that one does not perceive a plurality simultaneously is stated in the words, ‚ÄúWhen one perceives a plurality simultaneously. . . . ‚Äù

original: cig car du ma @210a * //
analyzed: cig car du ma @210a * //
translated: One does not perceive a plurality simultaneously.

original: mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs la snam bu la sogs par cig car 'dzin par gzhan mi 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs la snam bu la sogs par cig car 'dzin par gzhan mi 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the opponent does not maintain that one perceives a cloth, etc., simultaneously?

original: gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba'i yang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po cig car zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba'i yang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po cig car zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: And why is it said that one perceives a plurality simultaneously, such as a pot, etc.?

original: 'di skad du rang las bum pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad pa gzhan mi 'dod pa de bas na don gyis gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di skad du rang las bum pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad pa gzhan mi 'dod pa de bas na don gyis gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: He means to say that since they do not assert that the conventional, such as a pot, is different from itself, they would be apprehended simultaneously because they would be identical in fact.üîΩOr else, this is to be applied to the verse that goes:

original: yang na cig car blo gcig 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na cig car blo gcig 'gyur // zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOr else, there would be a single cognition simultaneously.‚Äù

original: cig car smos pa ni ma lus pa mtshon pa'i don yin te rdzas thams cad la blo gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig car smos pa ni ma lus pa mtshon pa'i don yin te rdzas thams cad la blo gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúsimultaneously‚Äù means ‚Äúin its entirety,‚Äù so the meaning is that there would be a single cognition of all substances.

original: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dag kyang 'dzin par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de la skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dag kyang 'dzin par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de la skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This fault does not apply to those who do not assert that a particular and its basis are apprehended.

original: yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa rdzas tha dad pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba can yang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang la rdzas tha dad pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa rdzas tha dad pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba can yang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang la rdzas tha dad pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which has the conjunction of qualities, universals, and so on that are different substances‚Äù means that which has the conjunction of different substances.

original: de ltar na gzhan la yon tan chen po 'du ba dang ldan pa dang gzhan dag la chung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan la yon tan chen po 'du ba dang ldan pa dang gzhan dag la chung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the universal is possessed of great qualities in one thing and of small qualities in another.

original: de lta bzhin du rdzas gzhan la ba lang gi spyi nyid dang gzhan la rta nyid la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bzhin du rdzas gzhan la ba lang gi spyi nyid dang gzhan la rta nyid la sogs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the universal of cow is one thing and the universal of horse is another.

original: sgra la sogs pa ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa yon tan gsum yongs su gyur pa nyid yin na yang bkod pa gcig tu gnas pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs can gcig nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa yon tan gsum yongs su gyur pa nyid yin na yang bkod pa gcig tu gnas pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs can gcig nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that sound and so on are one entity because, although they are the transformation of the three qualities, they are the same in that they abide in one arrangement.

original: sna tshogs snang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni mdo yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe appearance of diversity‚Äù is the s≈´tra.

original: chos can gcig la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: chos can gcig la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains it with ‚ÄúEven in one thing . . .‚Äù

original: des ni spyi dngos por yod pa bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyod yul nyid du yod pa yin na phyi rol gyi don nye bar mi ltos pa nyid yin par smra bas /
analyzed: des ni spyi dngos por yod pa bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyod yul nyid du yod pa yin na phyi rol gyi don nye bar mi ltos pa nyid yin par smra bas /
translated: He says that this refutes the existence of universals as things. Since they exist as objects, they are said to not depend on external objects.

original: spyi dngos po nyid ma yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi dngos po nyid ma yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be taught that the universal is not a real entity.

original: de ni spyi khas blangs nas /üîΩgal te 'ang dkar po nyid la sogs //
analyzed: de ni spyi khas blangs nas / gal te 'ang dkar po nyid la sogs //
translated: Having accepted the universal,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBut if whiteness, etc.,üîΩis not different from the white, etc.,üîΩThese two appear differently,

original: 'di gnyis snang ba tha dad pa yin zhing zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du mi gsal ba dang gsal bar snang ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis snang ba tha dad pa yin zhing zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du mi gsal ba dang gsal bar snang ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear, respectively, as unclear and clear.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid la de las tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo can gyi shes par gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid la de las tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo can gyi shes par gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The nature of that is not different from it, and it is pervaded by the nature of being apprehended by consciousness.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang tha dad pa'i ngo bo can gyi shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa de lta na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang tha dad pa'i ngo bo can gyi shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa de lta na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And that which is contradictory to it is the nature of being apprehended by consciousness that is different from it. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: gzhan gyi yid nyid @210b yin pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi blo ni yid kyi rten yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yid nyid @210b yin pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi blo ni yid kyi rten yin no //
translated: The mind of another is the basis of the mind.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it conforms to some aspect,

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra las shes pa mi gsal ba skye ba na yang sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba'i rjes su byed pa can skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra las shes pa mi gsal ba skye ba na yang sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba'i rjes su byed pa can skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even when a cognition of blue, etc., is produced from the word blue, etc., it arises as if it were an experience of blue, etc.

original: gzhan ni sgra las 'byung ba yin te zhes bya ba ni ngo bo mi gsal ba'o //üîΩgal te sgra las byung ba dang dbang po'i shes pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni sgra las 'byung ba yin te zhes bya ba ni ngo bo mi gsal ba'o // gal te sgra las byung ba dang dbang po'i shes pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The other is derived from the word, i.e., it is not clear in its nature.üîΩIf it is said that the cognition derived from the word and the sense cognition are both derived from the word, then the cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.

original: rva la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don gang yin pa de ba lang zhes bya ba de ltar sgra las byung ba'i shes pas rtogs pa po gang yin pas de lta bur gyur pa'i bstan pa las gang gi tshe rtogs pa de nyid sgra las byung ba'i rtogüîΩpa bsal ba'i bye brag mthong ba dang ldan pa skyes bu de'i mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rva la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don gang yin pa de ba lang zhes bya ba de ltar sgra las byung ba'i shes pas rtogs pa po gang yin pas de lta bur gyur pa'i bstan pa las gang gi tshe rtogs pa de nyid sgra las byung ba'i rtog pa bsal ba'i bye brag mthong ba dang ldan pa skyes bu de'i mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.üîΩThe cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature, but the sense cognition is clear in its nature.

original: mthong ba las ni bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: mthong ba las ni bzlog pa yin //
translated: The cognition derived from the word is not clear in its nature

original: mthong ba'i rang bzhin las ngo shes pa tha dad par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rang bzhin las ngo shes pa tha dad par byas pa yin te /
translated: The nature of seeing is distinguished from recognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid nyid du sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid nyid du sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has already been taught that it is of the nature of conceptual consciousness.

original: mthong bas de ltar shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong bas de ltar shes par 'gyur //
translated: One knows that by seeing.

original: zhes bya ba ni don thos pa dang mthong bas zhes bya ba de ltar gang las shes par gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don thos pa dang mthong bas zhes bya ba de ltar gang las shes par gyur /
translated: One knows that by hearing and seeing the meaning.

original: ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: It is not so.

original: sgras rang gi mtshan nyid la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgras rang gi mtshan nyid la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a word does not touch its own characteristic.

original: ci sgras don de zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i yul gyi don yin te /üîΩston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci sgras don de zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i yul gyi don yin te / ston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Does a word indicate that meaning?üîΩThe meaning is that it does not indicate the meaning that is the object of the sense faculties.

original: sgras bsten par gyur pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ci dbang po'i yul du gyur pa ngo shes pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ram zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgras bsten par gyur pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ci dbang po'i yul du gyur pa ngo shes pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ram zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Does a word indicate the meaning that is attended to?

original: rjes su byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rjes su byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it does not indicate the meaning that is attended to.

original: don yod pa sgra nyid kyis ma bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don yod pa sgra nyid kyis ma bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning is not taught by the sound itself.

original: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa rjod pa'i spyi yul yin par khas blangs nas de dbang po'i yul nyid yin pa bkag nas /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa rjod pa'i spyi yul yin par khas blangs nas de dbang po'i yul nyid yin pa bkag nas /
translated: Having accepted that the universal which is the content of a conceptual cognition that is concomitant with verbal expression is the object of the sense faculties, he refutes that it is the object of the sense faculties.

original: de ni de nyid bsal ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni de nyid bsal ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to eliminate that, he says, ‚ÄúThis conceptual cognition that is concomitant with verbal expression also . . .‚Äù

original: yul de dang de shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yul de dang de shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat object and that cognition will occur‚Äù is supplied.

original: sgra dang dri la sogs pa'i yul de dang de nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra dang dri la sogs pa'i yul de dang de nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ‚Äúthat object, sound, smell, and so on, will be experienced.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi don dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can nam zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi don dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can nam zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat arises simultaneously with the object of the sense consciousness‚Äù means that it arises simultaneously with the consciousness that apprehends it.

original: de ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung gi rjes 'brangs nas brjod do //
analyzed: de ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung gi rjes 'brangs nas brjod do //
translated: This is stated following the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika scriptures.

original: dus sngar 'byung ba'i @211a * //üîΩngang tshul can yin par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus sngar 'byung ba'i @211a * // ngang tshul can yin par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the earlier time is the prior state.üîΩ

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las dus sngar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin par ro //üîΩde ni mdo sde'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las dus sngar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin par ro // de ni mdo sde'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: and that it is the nature of the eye, etc., to arise prior to the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe Sautrantikas, following the scriptural authority of the sutras, maintain that the eye, etc., and the visual consciousness, etc., are simultaneous.

original: de dag ni 'di skad du sngar mig dang gzugs dang phyis mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes khas len to //
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du sngar mig dang gzugs dang phyis mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes khas len to //
translated: The Sautrantikas say that the eye and form are prior to the visual consciousness, but they do not say that the eye and form are prior to the visual consciousness, etc.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga yang bskal pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga yang bskal pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that both alternatives are impossible,

original: re zhig gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las sngar gzugs la sogs pa yin zhing skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe skad cig ma dang por gzugs la sogs pa dang gnyis par mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang gsum pa
analyzed: re zhig gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las sngar gzugs la sogs pa yin zhing skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe skad cig ma dang por gzugs la sogs pa dang gnyis par mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang gsum pa
translated: because the eye, etc., and the visual consciousness, etc., are simultaneous.

original: la yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa de ltar na skad cig ma gnyis pa 'das pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i yul gyi don bskal pa yin no //
analyzed: la yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa de ltar na skad cig ma gnyis pa 'das pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i yul gyi don bskal pa yin no //
translated: If the second moment is mental consciousness, then the object of the sense faculty is past, because the first moment has already ceased.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la skad cig ma dang po la mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la skad cig ma dang po la mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid yin la /
translated: In the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system, the first moment is eye consciousness and the second moment is mental consciousness.

original: gnyis pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa de ltar na yang skad cig ma gcig 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i yul bskal pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa de ltar na yang skad cig ma gcig 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i yul bskal pa yin no //
translated: Even so, the object of the sense faculty is past, because the first moment has already ceased.üîΩIn the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system, the object of the sense faculty ceases and generates mental consciousness that has its aspect.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la dbang po'i yul 'gags par gyur ba rang gi rnam ba can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed nas 'gag par 'gyur ba de bas na shes pa la rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid rigs paüîΩma yin nam zhe na de ni bden te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la dbang po'i yul 'gags par gyur ba rang gi rnam ba can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed nas 'gag par 'gyur ba de bas na shes pa la rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na de ni bden te /
translated: Therefore, since it is the cause that is able to establish consciousness, it is logical that the object is the cause.

original: 'on kyang bye brag tu smra ba de ni de ltar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang bye brag tu smra ba de ni de ltar mi 'dod do //
translated: That is true, but the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas do not assert that.

original: khas len na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul yang de ltar 'gyur na phyed rgas pa'i tshul du 'dis thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khas len na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yul yang de ltar 'gyur na phyed rgas pa'i tshul du 'dis thob pa ma yin no //
translated: If you accept that, then the objects of eye consciousness and so on would also be like that, but this is not the case.

original: bya ba sgrub par byed pa la khyad par du byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang khyad par du mi byed pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub par byed pa la khyad par du byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang khyad par du mi byed pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is that the qualifier is necessarily the agent of the action, and the contradictory of that is not being the qualifier. Thus, the pervasion is the observation of the contradictory of the pervader.

original: brtan pa'i dngos po de las zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: brtan pa'i dngos po de las zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma yin pa las so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom that stable thing‚Äù means from the momentary thing.

original: de yang res 'ga' ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de yang res 'ga' ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: And that is sometimes the case, that is, the co-operating cause.

original: gang la 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is not the effect of that.

original: bya bar mi nus pa'i khyad par phul du byung ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bya bar mi nus pa'i khyad par phul du byung ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the special capacity that is incapable of being done, which is the characteristic of the special capacity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phul du byung bar byar med pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phul du byung bar byar med pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: For that very reason, it is said that there is nothing special about it.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi tshig gis so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi tshig gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù is the word for the immediately preceding condition.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid yin pa bsal lo //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid yin pa bsal lo //
translated: ‚ÄúOf that‚Äù excludes the objective condition of the sense consciousness.

original: de'i rkyen gyis kyang zhes kyang @211b ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis so //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis kyang zhes kyang @211b ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that condition‚Äù is by the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousness.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul las yul gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni dbang po'i don gyi de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul las yul gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni dbang po'i don gyi de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of the sense consciousness is a different object‚Äù means that the form, etc., that immediately follows the sense object has a different nature.

original: de ltar 'dir yang 'di'i don rtogs pa'i don ni dbang po'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa'i yul can gyi yid de'i rten ni dbang po'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir yang 'di'i don rtogs pa'i don ni dbang po'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa'i yul can gyi yid de'i rten ni dbang po'i shes pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way, here too, the meaning of ‚Äòthat‚Äô is the sense consciousness,‚Äù meaning that the mind that is the subject of the second moment of form, etc., has the sense consciousness as its basis.

original: de yang long ba la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba las long ba la sogs pa la de 'dra ba'i yid skye ba med do //
analyzed: de yang long ba la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba las long ba la sogs pa la de 'dra ba'i yid skye ba med do //
translated: Moreover, it does not exist for the blind, etc. Therefore, because the cause is incomplete, such a mental consciousness does not arise for the blind, etc.

original: de bas na de dag gis gzugs la sogs pa mthong bar thal ba'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis gzugs la sogs pa mthong bar thal ba'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of the consequence that they see form, etc. This is the summarized meaning.

original: gal te dbang po nyid sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang po nyid sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúIf the sense faculty itself‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i ngo bo gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i ngo bo gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: It is explained by ‚ÄúThe first moment of the consciousness of the sense faculty‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po dang don gyi skad cig ma dang po dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma dang po la dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / skad cig ma gnyis pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don gyi skad cig ma dang /
analyzed: dbang po dang don gyi skad cig ma dang po dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma dang po la dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / skad cig ma gnyis pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don gyi skad cig ma dang /
translated: Because the first moment of the sense faculty and the object are simultaneous, in the first moment there is a consciousness of the sense faculty and in the second moment there is a mental consciousness that has as its object the object of the first moment.

original: de nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa med pa can no //
analyzed: de nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa med pa can no //
translated: Then, the object of the mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousness, and it does not have the same time as the agent.

original: dus mtshungs pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang shes dus can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang shes dus can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the lack of the same time, he says, ‚Äúhaving the time of its own consciousness.‚Äù

original: rang shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Its own consciousness is the mental consciousness.

original: de ni dus kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dus kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: That has a second moment of time.

original: gang la der 'byung ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la der 'byung ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has its occurrence there is called that.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la byung ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la byung ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has the nature of occurring in the second moment.
