original: 'di ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi don to //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi don to //
translated: This is not present at the time of the sense consciousness, which is the meaning of the object of the mental consciousness.

original: 'gag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi dus na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi dus na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it has already ceased, that is, because the sense consciousness has already ceased at the time of the object of mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang don ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir sngar yod pa yin la zhes bya ba ni /üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang don ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir sngar yod pa yin la zhes bya ba ni / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the object of the sense consciousness and the object of mental consciousness are prior to the mental consciousness, because they are the cause of the mental consciousness.üîΩBecause they are the cause of the mental consciousness, the object of the sense consciousness and the object of mental consciousness are prior to the mental consciousness.üîΩThus, the object of the sense consciousness and the object of mental consciousness are prior to the mental consciousness.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don de dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang don de dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las sngar yod pa yin no //üîΩde skad @212a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don de dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang don de dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las sngar yod pa yin no //üîΩde skad @212a * //
translated: Thus, the object of the sense consciousness and the object of mental consciousness are prior to the mental consciousness.üîΩThus, the object of the sense consciousness and the object of mental consciousness are prior to the mental consciousness.

original: du skad cig ma dang po la mig dang gzugs dang / gnyis pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don yin pa de bas na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni dus mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid du rigsüîΩpa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du skad cig ma dang po la mig dang gzugs dang / gnyis pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don yin pa de bas na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni dus mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid du rigs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first moment, the eye sense faculty and visible form are the object and the eye consciousness is the subject. In the second moment, the object is the object of the eye consciousness and the object of the mental consciousness. Therefore, it is logical that the object of the sense consciousness and the object of the mental consciousness are coexistent and are co-arisen.üîΩIf that were not so, it would not be a cause.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyur mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid dang dus mtshungs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyur mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir de yul yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyur mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul don yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid dang dus mtshungs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyur mi 'gyur ro // de'i phyir de yul yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the object of the mental consciousness were simultaneous with the mental consciousness itself, it would not be a cause.üîΩTherefore it would not be an object.üîΩIt would not be an object because it is not a cause.

original: de yul du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yul du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be an object because it is not a cause.

original: ji ltar dus mtshungs pa rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar dus mtshungs pa rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Just as simultaneity is not tenable as a cause, so it is taught: ‚ÄúThus, in this case, etc.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu yang de dang mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang cig car zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de dang mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang cig car zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is also like that‚Äù means that it is simultaneous with that cause.

original: de'i rnam par skyes pa nyid don gzung bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par skyes pa nyid don gzung bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the arising of that is the very apprehension of the object, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, etc.‚Äù

original: de med pa'am bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gcig 'gags pa na gnyi ga yang 'gags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdon dang lhan cig 'jug pa na //
analyzed: de med pa'am bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gcig 'gags pa na gnyi ga yang 'gags pa'i phyir ro // don dang lhan cig 'jug pa na //
translated: ‚ÄúIts nonexistence or pleasure, etc.‚Äù means that because they are not different, when one ceases, both cease.üîΩWhen the object is engaged,

original: don bcas dang ni 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: don bcas dang ni 'jug pa ste //
translated: it is engaged together with the object.

original: don dang bcas pa'i dbang po rung ba nyid yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dang bcas pa'i dbang po rung ba nyid yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: when there is the suitability of the sense faculty together with the object.

original: 'dus byas pa la sogs pa nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa las skyes pa dang shes pa'i rgyu ste bdag gi yon tan 'dus byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa la sogs pa nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa las skyes pa dang shes pa'i rgyu ste bdag gi yon tan 'dus byas pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is a quality of the self, the cause of consciousness, and the cause of consciousness.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni 'bad rtsol dang chos yin pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni 'bad rtsol dang chos yin pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes effort, being a quality, etc.

original: phan tshun bde ba la sogs pa de dag rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun bde ba la sogs pa de dag rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If those such as pleasure are mutually different, they would not be different.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmutually‚Äù is merely an illustration.

original: sems las kyang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems so //
analyzed: sems las kyang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems so //
translated: It is thought that they would not be different from the mind.

original: rang bzhin gang gis tshogs pa des sems dang sems las byung ba gcig skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis sems gzhan dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis tshogs pa des sems dang sems las byung ba gcig skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis sems gzhan dag kyang yin no //
translated: By whatever nature the collection generates one mind and mental factor, by that very nature it generates other minds.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po la cig car rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ma yin pa gang gis cig car rang bzhin gcig gis skyed par 'gyur zhing gzhan gzhan gyis yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po la cig car rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ma yin pa gang gis cig car rang bzhin gcig gis skyed par 'gyur zhing gzhan gzhan gyis yin /
translated: Because two natures do not exist simultaneously in a thing, by what is there simultaneous generation by one nature and by another?

original: de bas na rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu rnams tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu rnams tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, effects are different due to the difference of causes.

original: gal te rgyu tha dad pa med na yang @212b 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur na rgyu med ba can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu tha dad pa med na yang @212b 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur na rgyu med ba can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If effects were different even without the difference of causes, the consequence would be that they have no cause.

original: ji ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo'am sems dang sems las byung ba tha dad par 'dod pa de ltar rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin pas byas ba yang tha dad par 'dod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo'am sems dang sems las byung ba tha dad par 'dod pa de ltar rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin pas byas ba yang tha dad par 'dod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Just as you assert that the nature of pleasure and pain or mind and mental factors are different, so you would have to assert that the effects of understanding and misunderstanding are different.

original: nang gi rgyu'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid las phul du byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nang gi rgyu'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid las phul du byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Due to the difference of internal causes means due to the difference of the nature of the sense faculties, objects, and attention.

original: 'di skad du bdag phul du byung ba gang gis tshogs pas bde ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rtogs pa skyed pa de las phul du byung ba gzhan gyis skad cig ma gzhan du rnam par gnas pas sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid skyed pa de ltar rtogs pa gzhan
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag phul du byung ba gang gis tshogs pas bde ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rtogs pa skyed pa de las phul du byung ba gzhan gyis skad cig ma gzhan du rnam par gnas pas sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid skyed pa de ltar rtogs pa gzhan
translated: The other that generates the nature of pleasure from that which is superior is not superior to that, because it generates the nature of pain in another moment through abiding as a different nature in each moment.

original: yin te / skad cig ma re rer rang bzhin tha dad par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩskad cig ma re re la tha dad pa yin na yang rtogs pa skyed pa'i thun mong gi nus pa las ma 'das par 'jug pas 'bras bu tha dad pa yang skyed par byed pa na rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo
analyzed: yin te / skad cig ma re rer rang bzhin tha dad par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro // skad cig ma re re la tha dad pa yin na yang rtogs pa skyed pa'i thun mong gi nus pa las ma 'das par 'jug pas 'bras bu tha dad pa yang skyed par byed pa na rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo
translated: That is because it abides as a different nature in each moment.

original: ma yin pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is different in each moment, it engages without exceeding the common capacity to generate understanding. Therefore, when it generates a different effect, it generates the nature of understanding, but it does not generate that which is not the nature of understanding.

original: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon zhing la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis phul du byung ba dang ldan pas phul du byung ba dang bcas pa'i myu gu skyed par byed pa na yang s'a lu'i myu gu nyid skyed par byed kyi nas kyi myu gu ni ma yin
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon zhing la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis phul du byung ba dang ldan pas phul du byung ba dang bcas pa'i myu gu skyed par byed pa na yang s'a lu'i myu gu nyid skyed par byed kyi nas kyi myu gu ni ma yin
translated: For example, when a rice seed produces a rice sprout endowed with excellence due to the excellence of the field and so on, it produces a rice sprout and not a barley sprout,

original: te / nus pa mtshungs pa las ma 'das par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te / nus pa mtshungs pa las ma 'das par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it operates without exceeding its capacity.

original: de nyid ston par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe 'god par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ston par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe 'god par byed pa yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he posits an example, beginning with ‚ÄúFor example . . .‚Äù

original: gal te dus tha dad pa can gyi bde ba la sogs pa la 'di lan yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: gal te dus tha dad pa can gyi bde ba la sogs pa la 'di lan yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: If it is acceptable that this is the reply to the question regarding pleasure, etc., which are of different times,

original: 'on kyang dus gcig la gnas pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba gang yin pa de dag ci ltar phan tshun tha dad pa yin zhe na 'di yang brjod bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus gcig la gnas pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba gang yin pa de dag ci ltar phan tshun tha dad pa yin zhe na 'di yang brjod bar bya ste /
translated: then how can those minds and mental factors that are of the same time and nature be mutually different? This should be stated.

original: tshogs pa de nyid ni nang gi khyad par gyis byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa de nyid ni nang gi khyad par gyis byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the collection itself is produced by internal distinctions.

original: de ltar na tshogs pa rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed par byed pa nges pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyad par dang ldan ba de las rtogs pa tha dad pa skyed par 'gyur ba de ltar na 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de ltar na tshogs pa rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed par byed pa nges pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyad par dang ldan ba de las rtogs pa tha dad pa skyed par 'gyur ba de ltar na 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Thus, when the collection, which is of a different nature, is the cause that definitely has the nature of possessing distinctions, then a different cognition will be produced from it. In that case, what contradiction is there?

original: rgyu 'bras bu du ma las so sor nges ba'i rang bzhin can 'bras bu so so la tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras bu du ma las so sor nges ba'i rang bzhin can 'bras bu so so la tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The effect, which has a nature that is individually ascertained from many causes, will have a nature that is different for each effect.

original: 'di ltar rgyu rang gi rang bzhin 'pho ba nas 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu rang gi rang bzhin 'pho ba nas 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the cause does not transfer its own nature to the effect and then produce the effect.

original: gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin dor ba 'bras bur 'gyur ba de'i tshe ci ltar na rang bzhin gcig gis du ma skyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i brgal ba der 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin dor ba 'bras bur 'gyur ba de'i tshe ci ltar na rang bzhin gcig gis du ma skyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i brgal ba der 'gyur /
translated: If the effect were the cause‚Äôs nature that is discarded, then how could a single nature produce many? This is the argument that would ensue.

original: @213a * // rang bzhin gcig 'bras bu gcig la 'phos pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gcig po ci ltar 'bras bu gzhan las 'pho bar 'gyur /
analyzed: @213a * // rang bzhin gcig 'bras bu gcig la 'phos pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gcig po ci ltar 'bras bu gzhan las 'pho bar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is a single nature be transferred to another effect?

original: 'pho ba nyid yin na 'bras bu rang bzhin gcig pa can du 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi tshe rgyu 'bras bu gcig kyang skyed par gyur na de skyed bar byed pa'i rang bzhin nye btsam gyis skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu du ma skyed par byed pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin nye ba tsam gyis 'bras bu du ma skyed
analyzed: 'pho ba nyid yin na 'bras bu rang bzhin gcig pa can du 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe rgyu 'bras bu gcig kyang skyed par gyur na de skyed bar byed pa'i rang bzhin nye btsam gyis skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu du ma skyed par byed pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin nye ba tsam gyis 'bras bu du ma skyed
translated: If it were transferred, then the effect would have a single nature.üîΩWhen a cause produces an effect that is different from itself, then it produces that effect by merely approaching the nature of a producer.

original: par 'gyur ba gang gis bzlog par 'gyur /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba gang gis bzlog par 'gyur /
translated: When that is so, then by merely approaching the nature of a definite producer of many effects, it would produce many effects. Who can stop it?üîΩThe difference and non-difference of the effect is just the difference and non-difference of the cause.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag gi 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa gang yin pa 'di nyid tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa skyed par byed pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin las 'bras bu tha
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag gi 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa gang yin pa 'di nyid tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa skyed par byed pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin las 'bras bu tha
translated: The difference and non-difference of the effect is just the difference and non-difference of the cause.

original: dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the nature of the effect is not different from the nature of the cause.

original: gal te tha dad pa skyed par byed pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa med pa'i skye ba de'i tshe rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa skyed par byed pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa med pa'i skye ba de'i tshe rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect is produced from a cause that is essentially different from it, then the effect would be uncaused.

original: gal te rang bzhin gcig ci ltar du ma skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gcig ci ltar du ma skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the cause is of the same nature as the effect, how could it produce many effects?

original: de ni 'di lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of being such.üîΩOtherwise, how could a single cause produce a single effect?

original: de lta ma yin na gcig kyang ci ltar skye bar 'gyur 'dir yang ci ltar na rang bzhin 'phos nas rgyu 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig kyang ci ltar skye bar 'gyur 'dir yang ci ltar na rang bzhin 'phos nas rgyu 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin zhes bshad zin to //
translated: And how could a cause that has changed its nature produce an effect?

original: gal te 'o na rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin ba'i rang bzhin ci'i phyir tshogs pas skyed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin ba'i rang bzhin ci'i phyir tshogs pas skyed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the cause is not different from the effect, why doesn‚Äôt the collection of causes and conditions produce understanding and non-understanding?

original: ma yin te de ni rtogs pa skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de ni rtogs pa skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the cause is definitely of the nature to produce understanding.

original: gal te de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid gang las yin zhe na rang gi rgyu las yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid gang las yin zhe na rang gi rgyu las yin no //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature that is like that from?‚Äù it is from its own cause.

original: de'i yang rang gi rgyu gzhan las yin pa de ltar na rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de'i yang rang gi rgyu gzhan las yin pa de ltar na rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa can yin no //
translated: And that also is from another cause. In that way, the continuum of causes is beginningless.

original: de bas na rtogs pa skyed par byed pa'i nges pa yod na rtogs pa tha dad par skyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gzhan gyi khyad par dang ldan pas rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid skye bar byed kyi /
analyzed: de bas na rtogs pa skyed par byed pa'i nges pa yod na rtogs pa tha dad par skyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gzhan gyi khyad par dang ldan pas rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid skye bar byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, if there is certainty that generates understanding, it generates different understandings because it has the characteristic of a nature that generates different understandings.

original: rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ltar na nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ltar na nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is not a nature that is understanding or not understanding. In that way, it is certainty.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough with the digression.

original: blo dang ni /
analyzed: blo dang ni /
translated: And mind,

original: bde sogs de nyid skyed yin na //
analyzed: bde sogs de nyid skyed yin na //
translated: and the generation of pleasure, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la blo dang bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la blo dang bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: In ‚Äúmind and pleasure, etc.,‚Äù the term ‚Äúand‚Äù is a conjunction.

original: rim gyis 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i blos gzugs mngon sum du byed pa de las dus phyis yid kyi shes pas bde ba la sogs pa yongs su gcod par byed pa de ltar na rim gyis 'dzin pa zhes
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i blos gzugs mngon sum du byed pa de las dus phyis yid kyi shes pas bde ba la sogs pa yongs su gcod par byed pa de ltar na rim gyis 'dzin pa zhes
translated: That which is called gradual apprehension is the mental consciousness that subsequently ascertains pleasure and so on from the form that is directly perceived by the mind that is simultaneously born with pleasure and so on.üîΩ

original: bya ba 'dis rim gyis 'dzin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig @213b bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba 'dis rim gyis 'dzin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig @213b bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúGrasping in sequence‚Äù means that the eye consciousness arises simultaneously with pleasure, etc., and then later the mental consciousness determines pleasure, etc. Thus, this is the explanation of the words ‚Äúgrasping in sequence‚Äù in the s≈´tra.

original: rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ma yin te /
translated: The explanation that form is not the object of the consciousness that arises simultaneously with pleasure, etc., because it is not its cause is not correct.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis rnam par shes pa skyed pa la bde ba la sogs ba nus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis rnam par shes pa skyed pa la bde ba la sogs ba nus pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is because pleasure, etc., have the power to generate consciousness through being coemergent causes.

original: de bas na yul nyid du yang 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ldog pa las kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas na yul nyid du yang 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ldog pa las kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúNor is it the case that they are not objects because of the absence of grasping,‚Äù

original: de med na nges par med pa ni ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de med na nges par med pa ni ldog pa yin no //
translated: because if they do not exist, they definitely do not exist. This is the absence of grasping.

original: yul 'dzin pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te sngo sogs bzhin /
analyzed: yul 'dzin pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te sngo sogs bzhin /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúwithout apprehending objects,‚ÄùüîΩ

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la bde ba la sogs pa nus pa nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa myong ba med pa la sngon po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu myong bar 'gyur ba de
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la bde ba la sogs pa nus pa nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa myong ba med pa la sngon po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu myong bar 'gyur ba de
translated: As for the line ‚ÄúIf there is no apprehension of objects,‚Äù and so on, if pleasure and so on are capable of producing the sense consciousness, just like blue and so on, then just as blue and so on are experienced in some circumstances,

original: bzhin du dbang po dang yul las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig kyang rnam par shes pas myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin du dbang po dang yul las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig kyang rnam par shes pas myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: pleasure and so on, which are produced from the sense faculty and object, are also experienced by consciousness.

original: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa las bde ba la sogs pa'i nus pa tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa las bde ba la sogs pa'i nus pa tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the potency of pleasure and so on would be understood to be different from that of blue and so on.

original: nus pa tha dad pa nges pa na yang yul dang lhan cig pa'i nus pa rtog par byed pa na yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa nges pa na yang yul dang lhan cig pa'i nus pa rtog par byed pa na yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: And if the potency is understood to be different, then there is no contradiction in conceiving the potency to be simultaneous with the object.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa so so la yang nus pa dmigs pa'i phyir tshogs pa la yang nus pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa so so la yang nus pa dmigs pa'i phyir tshogs pa la yang nus pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the capacity is observed in each, such as blue and yellow, the capacity is not contradicted in the collection.

original: de nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa re re la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa re re la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That very thing is stated in ‚Äúin each, such as blue, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig myong ba khas blangs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig myong ba khas blangs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is accepted that only pleasure, etc. are experienced,

original: de ltar na yang khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na yang khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then it is stated, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa med par zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med par ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa med par zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout realization‚Äù means without an object.

original: de ltar na yang 'di las bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni don 'di las bde ba la sogs pa 'de'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'di las bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni don 'di las bde ba la sogs pa 'de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, from this‚Äù means from this meaning, pleasure, etc. are grasped.

original: dbang po'i don rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dbang po'i don rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúAt the time of realizing the object of the sense faculty,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te dbang pos bde ba la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur na dbang po'i don rtogs pa'i dus na bde ba la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gal te dbang pos bde ba la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur na dbang po'i don rtogs pa'i dus na bde ba la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If the sense faculty does not realize pleasure, etc., then at the time of realizing the object of the sense faculty, pleasure, etc. would not be realized. This is the intended meaning.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to pleasure, etc.

original: bdag dang yid ldan pa las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag dang yid ldan pa las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the nature of arising from the self and the mind, i.e., it is mental consciousness.

original: dbang po'i yul nyid las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i stobs kyis skyed pa dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can no //üîΩde ltar na yul la dmigs @214a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul nyid las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i stobs kyis skyed pa dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can no // de ltar na yul la dmigs @214a * //
translated: It arises from the object of the sense faculty, i.e., it has the nature of arising by the power of external form, etc., and it occurs simultaneously with the sense consciousness.

original: pa yang bdag dang yul dang dbang po'i phrad pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa med par zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa yang bdag dang yul dang dbang po'i phrad pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa med par zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the object is perceived, but there is no consciousness that has the nature of arising from the contact of the self, the object, and the sense faculty. This means that there is no sense consciousness.

original: shes pa de yang zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa de yang zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat consciousness‚Äù refers to the sense consciousness.

original: yid gnyis pa ni yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa dag dang yid ldan pa las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis pa ni yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa dag dang yid ldan pa las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no second mind‚Äù means that they do not accept that two cognitions occur simultaneously, one having the nature of arising from the sense consciousness and the other having the nature of being associated with the mental faculty.

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa yod pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa yod pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is a cognition that occurs later‚Äù means when there is a cognition that is asserted to apprehend pleasure and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, pleasure and so on do not exist because they have ceased simultaneously with the sense consciousness.

original: de dag las gcig ni zhes bya ba la de dag las zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las gcig ni zhes bya ba la de dag las zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i drug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne of them‚Äù means one of those two.

original: gcig ni don 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i blos so //
analyzed: gcig ni don 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i blos so //
translated: One of them is the apprehension of the object by the sense consciousness.

original: gzhan ni bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni yid kyi blos so //
analyzed: gzhan ni bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni yid kyi blos so //
translated: The other is the experience of pleasure and so on.

original: gang zhig gang dang rigs mthun pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa yin na zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang rigs mthun pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa yin na zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa'i skabs su bstan zin to //
translated: And that which is similar to something is its appropriation, this also has been explained in the context of the establishment of the other world.

original: de myong phyir na don yang dag par myong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i don dang 'dra ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de myong phyir na don yang dag par myong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i don dang 'dra ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is experienced, the object is truly experienced, because it is experienced as similar to the object that is of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: 'gis ni bde ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid du nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba de bstan to //
analyzed: 'gis ni bde ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid du nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba de bstan to //
translated: This shows that pleasure, etc. are of the nature of the experience of reality.

original: de ni phyi rol du gyur ba'i don dag la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ni nyams su myong ba dag las tha dad pa'i don dag la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol du gyur ba'i don dag la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ni nyams su myong ba dag las tha dad pa'i don dag la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist in external objects, the nature of experience does not exist in objects that are separate from experiences.

original: de myong ba la yang zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa myong par khas len pa na myong ba'i mtshan nyid 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de myong ba la yang zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa myong par khas len pa na myong ba'i mtshan nyid 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: And in the experience of that, if you accept that the experience is of something else, the characteristic of experience is not tenable.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: nyams su myong ba ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause experience is the nature of reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid ma gtogs par nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid gzhan ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid ma gtogs par nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid gzhan ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Apart from the nature of reflexive awareness, it is impossible to express the nature of experience.

original: de rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the nature of realization and because conceptual thought is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: gzhan myong ba yin na ni bdag myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan myong ba yin na ni bdag myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were experienced by another, it would not be experienced by itself.

original: gzhan myong ba nyid ni bdag myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan myong ba nyid ni bdag myong ba ma yin te /
translated: The experience of another is not the experience of itself.

original: rang dang gzhan tha dad pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan tha dad pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has a nature that is different from itself.

original: de nyid ni rang dang gzhan @214b gyi bdag nyid rig pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni rang dang gzhan @214b gyi bdag nyid rig pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is contradictory for something to be both itself and something else.‚Äù

original: shes pa la rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa'i khyad par gyis ngo bo gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa la rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa'i khyad par gyis ngo bo gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness does not have two natures that are distinguished by reflexive awareness and awareness of something else.

original: shes pa ni gcig gi bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni gcig gi bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness is of the nature of a unity.

original: de la gzhan myong bar khas len na rang rig pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur zhing de khas len par byed na gzhan myong ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhan myong bar khas len na rang rig pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur zhing de khas len par byed na gzhan myong ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you accept that it experiences something else, it is not the nature of reflexive awareness; and if you accept that it is the nature of reflexive awareness, it does not experience something else.

original: gal te 'on kyang shes pa gzhan rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid du yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'on kyang shes pa gzhan rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid du yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that consciousness exists as the nature of the awareness of something else,

original: rang rig pa yang gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang rig pa yang gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then it is necessary to say that reflexive awareness exists.

original: gzhan nyams su myong ba nyid ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i dmigs pa can gyi don mthong ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhas bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan nyams su myong ba nyid ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i dmigs pa can gyi don mthong ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhas bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe experience of something else is not established‚Äù is that it is impossible to see an object that is not directly perceived.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag gis shes pa bzhin du tha dad par snang bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag gis shes pa bzhin du tha dad par snang bar 'dod do //
translated: We do accept that, but we maintain that pleasure and so on appear to be different from consciousness, in the aspect of object and subject.

original: de bas na gcig pa tha dad par snang ba'i gzung ba nyid gnas pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gcig pa tha dad par snang ba'i gzung ba nyid gnas pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the object itself, which appears as identical or different, exists, it is not ascertained.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThe aspects of pleasure, etc., are also the object, etc.‚Äù

original: yul gyi rnam pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the object is the aspect of the apprehended.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rnam pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rnam pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of intense joy is the aspect of the apprehender.

original: kho bo cag gis rnam pa de dag ni don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba la gnyis med par bsgrub pa de yang rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rnam pa de dag ni don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba la gnyis med par bsgrub pa de yang rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: We have extensively demonstrated that those aspects are ultimate reality, and that they are established as nondual.

original: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the wish for something.

original: mi 'dod pa ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: Aversion is turning away from something.

original: btang snyoms su gnas pa ni bar mar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms su gnas pa ni bar mar gnas pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is remaining in a neutral state.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i bye brag dang btang snyoms su gnas pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i bye brag dang btang snyoms su gnas pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The distinction between desire and aversion is the contrast between the two.

original: de dag nyid ni sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de dag nyid ni sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Those are the natures of sentient beings.

original: goms pa gang la rang bzhin de nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: goms pa gang la rang bzhin de nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is habituated to that very nature which is characterized as such is so-called.

original: dir snang ba can ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyi rol khyad par can ma yin par snang ba can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dir snang ba can ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyi rol khyad par can ma yin par snang ba can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the appearance of that, i.e., it does not appear as the special external object.

original: phyi rol nyid dang de las khyad par med par snang ba can nyid la phyir rol khyad par med na sgom pa khyad par can yin na yang khyad par can nyid ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid dang de las khyad par med par snang ba can nyid la phyir rol khyad par med na sgom pa khyad par can yin na yang khyad par can nyid ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: The appearance of the external object itself, without distinction from it, is the external object. If there is no distinction in the external object, then even if there is a special meditation, it is not a special appearance.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang khyad par can nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang khyad par can nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the contradiction of that is a special appearance. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: 'di la yon tan nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de'i sems kyi ngo bo bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yon tan nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de'i sems kyi ngo bo bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not have the quality of that, i.e., the nature of that person‚Äôs mind is not the quality of pleasure, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni yul gyi stobs las yul gyi rnam pa can du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni yul gyi stobs las yul gyi rnam pa can du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called cause and effect are the cognition that arises in the form of the object due to the power of the object.

original: de bas na blo @215a * //
analyzed: de bas na blo @215a * //
translated: Therefore, the cognition

original: ni 'bras bu yin la yul ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ni 'bras bu yin la yul ni rgyu yin no //
translated: is the effect, and the object is the cause.üîΩAnd that is also present in the person,

original: de ni skyes bu la yang yod pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu la yang yod pa yin pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, the object‚Äôs form.

original: de ltar na blo la gnas pa'i yul gyi rnam pa skyes bu la 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na blo la gnas pa'i yul gyi rnam pa skyes bu la 'jog par byed do //
translated: Thus, the form of the object present in the cognition is placed in the person.

original: de bas na de ni za ba po nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir skyes bus blo nges par byas pa'i don shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de ni za ba po nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir skyes bus blo nges par byas pa'i don shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is the experiencer. For this very reason, it is taught that the person, having determined the cognition, comes to know the object.

original: de bas na skyes bu yang blo dang 'dra bar yul yul rnams kyi 'bras bu yin zhing de dag las kyang rigs mi mthun pa yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu yang blo dang 'dra bar yul yul rnams kyi 'bras bu yin zhing de dag las kyang rigs mi mthun pa yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the person, like the cognition, is the effect of the objects, and it is also of a different type from them. Thus, it is indeterminate.

original: gal te de rang bzhin min la /
analyzed: gal te de rang bzhin min la /
translated: If it is not of that nature,

original: nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems nyid do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúExperience‚Äù is the mind itself, which is not of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: yul dang sems dag gi bar na yul gyi rnam pa can gyi don sems ma yin pa ni blo yin te de'i 'di ni blo gnas so //
analyzed: yul dang sems dag gi bar na yul gyi rnam pa can gyi don sems ma yin pa ni blo yin te de'i 'di ni blo gnas so //
translated: The ‚Äúintellect‚Äù is that which has the form of the object between the object and the mind, and it is not the mind. This is the abode of the intellect.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains ‚Äúpleasure, etc.‚Äù with ‚Äúpleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: blo dang sems dag la yang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /üîΩmngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: blo dang sems dag la yang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na / mngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: If the mind and the intellect are not different,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúThe memory of an experience is a recollection of the experience.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa can dang dran pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa can dang dran pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has the form of perception and the form of memory.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa yin la /
translated: The form of perception is the mode of appearance of the clear and distinct.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: The mode of activity of memory is conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad ni dran pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad ni dran pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all consciousnesses that are conceptual are of the nature of memory.

original: dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa can bshad do //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa can bshad do //
translated: The mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, pain, etc. is direct perception.

original: dran pa'i rnam pa can te zhes bya ba myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i rnam pa can te zhes bya ba myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The mode of activity of memory is the experience of the object that is remembered.

original: 'dis ni dran ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba de bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dran ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba de bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the mode of activity of memory.üîΩHow is it that the mode of activity of memory and the mode of activity of direct perception are included in the experience of pleasure, etc.?üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.

original: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa myong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dran pa'i rnam pa can dang mngon sum gyi rnam pa can ngo bo nyid kyis myong ba 'jug pa bsdus nas gnyis nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa myong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dran pa'i rnam pa can dang mngon sum gyi rnam pa can ngo bo nyid kyis myong ba 'jug pa bsdus nas gnyis nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: The mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is directly perceived.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa can gyi mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa can gyi mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: The mode of activity of the experience of pleasure, etc. is the experience of the object that is remembered.üîΩThe mode of activity of the experience of pleasure

original: bde ba kho na la yid bde ba'i sgras bstan te /
analyzed: bde ba kho na la yid bde ba'i sgras bstan te /
translated: Only pleasure is indicated by the term mental satisfaction,

original: bde ba lus kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyis rtogs pa med pa'i mngon sum gyi rnam pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba lus kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyis rtogs pa med pa'i mngon sum gyi rnam pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the only one that is directly perceived in the form of non-discernment, since it is established by the body consciousness.

original: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike a piece of iron and fire‚Äù is a compound.

original: lcags shin tu 'bar ba'i gzugs la nag po @215b yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lcags shin tu 'bar ba'i gzugs la nag po @215b yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: A piece of iron that is extremely hot does have the quality of blackness.

original: ma nges pa yin par smra'o zhes bya ba ni me las tha dad pa dmigs pa'i lcags gong gi ngo bo yang yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa yin par smra'o zhes bya ba ni me las tha dad pa dmigs pa'i lcags gong gi ngo bo yang yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opponent says that this is not a conclusive example, because he accepts that the nature of a piece of iron that is perceived as separate from fire does exist.

original: gal te de ltar yin pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: The proponent of the tenets says, ‚ÄúIf that is so,‚Äù

original: lcags gong la yang me dang 'brel ba las mdog nag po zhig nas gzugs gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: lcags gong la yang me dang 'brel ba las mdog nag po zhig nas gzugs gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: because the color of a piece of iron that is extremely hot does change when it comes into contact with fire.

original: de la mdog nag po yang med cing yod na yang 'dres pa'i phyir ma dmigs pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de la mdog nag po yang med cing yod na yang 'dres pa'i phyir ma dmigs pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: It is not black, and even if it were, it would be mixed with other colors.

original: cig car sems las byung ba mang po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cig car sems las byung ba mang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMany mental factors arise simultaneously‚Äù meansüîΩfeeling, conception, intention,

original: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dun dang rig dang blo gros dran //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa cig car skye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dun dang rig dang blo gros dran // zhes bya ba la sogs pa cig car skye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: contact, discernment, memory,üîΩconcentration, and discernment.

original: nyi mas zhes bya ba ni 'od zer stong ldan gyis so //
analyzed: nyi mas zhes bya ba ni 'od zer stong ldan gyis so //
translated: The sun is the one with a thousand rays.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba gang gi rkyen yul la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba gang gi rkyen yul la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccording to the conditions‚Äù means according to the conditions of the mental factors, such as the object, which are desirable or undesirable.

original: ston ka'i mar do'i mtshan phyed kyi //
analyzed: ston ka'i mar do'i mtshan phyed kyi //
translated: At the end of autumn, at midnight,

original: zhes bya ba ni ston ka'i mtshan gyi cha phyi ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ston ka'i mtshan gyi cha phyi ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is ‚Äúat the end of the autumn night.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe skar ma'i khyad par gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe skar ma'i khyad par gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the special stars will be clearly understood.

original: du ma nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i dus na sems pas rig pa yin no //
analyzed: du ma nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i dus na sems pas rig pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the mind is actively forming, it is cognition.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe dmigs pa brtan por 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can ni mos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe dmigs pa brtan por 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can ni mos pa yin no //
translated: At some time, it is aspiration, which has the characteristic of firmly grasping the object.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang rig pa ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang rig pa ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the others should be explained as appropriate.

original: gcig tshe zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni zil gyis gnon pa'i dus na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig tshe zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni zil gyis gnon pa'i dus na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: At one time means at the time of the bases of mastery.

original: de bas na gcig tshe gsal bas bsgribs pa yang zil gyis gnon pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de bas na gcig tshe gsal bas bsgribs pa yang zil gyis gnon pa'i dus na /
translated: Therefore, at the time of the bases of mastery, the obscured is also clear.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i tha dad rnam gzhag grub pa yin zhes dang zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i tha dad rnam gzhag grub pa yin zhes dang zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The presentation of the differences of pleasure and so on is established.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni myur du bskor ba dang / 'chi ltas la sogs pa bzung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni myur du bskor ba dang / 'chi ltas la sogs pa bzung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase and so on refers to quickly turning the eyes and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'khor lo bzhin du lus myur du bskor ba las dngos po g-yo ba med pa yang g-yo ba bzhin du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba'ang 'chi ba'i dus na lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig 'chi ltas kyi ming can dngos po yang dag paüîΩma yin pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor lo bzhin du lus myur du bskor ba las dngos po g-yo ba med pa yang g-yo ba bzhin du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba'ang 'chi ba'i dus na lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig 'chi ltas kyi ming can dngos po yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of death, some state of the body and mind is seen as an unreal thing called a sign of death.

original: de dang rjes su mthun par sgrub pa la zhes bya ba ni rnam par gsal ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtsom pa dang / dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i mtshan nyid la'o //üîΩbrda'i rten can ni rnam par rtog pa yin la zhes bya ba ni brda la ma byang ba'i rnam @216a * //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun par sgrub pa la zhes bya ba ni rnam par gsal ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtsom pa dang / dga' ba dang mi dga' ba'i mtshan nyid la'o // brda'i rten can ni rnam par rtog pa yin la zhes bya ba ni brda la ma byang ba'i rnam @216a * //
translated: In accordance with that, in the practice means in the composition that accords with clarity, and in the characteristics of joy and sorrow.

original: par rtog pa ni brda'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: par rtog pa ni brda'i rten can yin no //
translated: Conceptual thought is based on conventional symbols means that conceptual thought that is not skilled in conventional symbols is based on conventional symbols.

original: de ltar spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa brda byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa brda byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, conceptual thought with a general aspect is based on the conventional symbol.üîΩThe conventional symbol is the basis for the arising of conceptual thought means that the conventional symbol is the basis for the arising of conceptual thought.

original: brda'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa brda la byang ba dag gi ni 'di la brda'i rten yod bas na brda'i rten can no //
analyzed: brda'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa brda la byang ba dag gi ni 'di la brda'i rten yod bas na brda'i rten can no //
translated: The conceptual thought that occurs later at the time of the sign is the one that is skilled in the sign.

original: don gnyis po de yang bzlas pas yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don gnyis po de yang bzlas pas yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And that object is seen to be repeated.

original: rmi lam na yang dran pa dran //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang dran pa dran //
translated: One remembers even in a dream.

original: de ni de 'dra'i don ldan min //
analyzed: de ni de 'dra'i don ldan min //
translated: But that is not the way it is.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang dran pa'i shes pa byung ba gang yin pa de sad pas dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang dran pa'i shes pa byung ba gang yin pa de sad pas dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one awakens, one remembers the occurrence of a memory-consciousness even in the state of dreaming.

original: dran pa de yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa skye ba don dang ldan par dran pa ji 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i don dang ldan pa dran par mi 'gyur te /

translated: It is a convention in terms of the exclusion of the non-possessor of the property of being a pot. üîΩ It is a convention in terms of the exclusion of the non-possessor of the property of being a cow. üîΩ It is a convention in terms of the exclusion of the non-possessor of the property of being a horse. üîΩ It is a convention in terms of the exclusion of the non-possessor of the property of being a man. üîΩ It is a convention in terms of the exclusion of the non-possessor of the property of being a woman.

translated: If it is said that water is distinguished from what is not water, then it is said that ‚Äúit is based on the convention of water.‚Äù That is, one understands it based on the substance that is the basis of the convention, just as one understands a pot based on the convention of a pot.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa 'byung ba 'dus pa gzhan la yang 'gyur ro //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chu la brten nas 'byung ba 'dus pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la brda la brten nas zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbden pa'i chu la chu'i sgra'i brda gang yin pa de la brten nas so //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa 'byung ba 'dus pa gzhan la yang 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chu la brten nas 'byung ba 'dus pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la brda la brten nas zhes bya ba ni / bden pa'i chu la chu'i sgra'i brda gang yin pa de la brten nas so //
translated: It would also occur in other collections of elements, such as a mirage.üîΩTherefore it says, ‚ÄúBased on the unreal water,‚Äù and so on. ‚Äú Based on the convention‚Äù means based on the convention of the word water for real water.

analyzed: 'byung ba 'dus pa de la zhes bya ba ni chu'i brda'i rten ma yin pa smig rgyu la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that collection of elements‚Äù means in a mirage, which is not the basis of the convention of water.

original: de ltar na sngon nyams su myong ba'i chu dran pa sngon du song ba can de la 'khrul pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon nyams su myong ba'i chu dran pa sngon du song ba can de la 'khrul pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the error occurs in regard to the water that is remembered from previous experience.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du 'chad de /

analyzed: 'di la chu'i sgra'i brdar byed pas na bden pa'i chu'i brda'o //

analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa ni 'byung ba 'dus pa yin pa de ltar na de la brten pas bzung nas so //

analyzed: brda la brten pa de las chu la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi don yin no //
translated: The conventional symbol is the basis. The error occurs in regard to that which is similar to water, etc., because of the similarity of attributes. This is the meaning of that passage.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa dang rtags can gyi shes pa la ni rjes su dpag pa la 'byung ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa dang rtags can gyi shes pa la ni rjes su dpag pa la 'byung ba zhes bshad do //
translated: The knowledge of the sign that has three modes is inference. The knowledge of the object that possesses the sign is called the occurrence of inference.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don sngar mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus na don mthong ba'i sgo nas gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir de skad du tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don sngar mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus na don mthong ba'i sgo nas gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir de skad du tha snyad gdags so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpreviously seeing a hidden object‚Äù is used because at the time of apprehending a relation, one engages in superimposing a unity on the basis of seeing an object.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa dang de'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa dang de'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
translated: Inference is a cognition that is based on a logical reason, and the result of inference is a cognition that is based on a result.

original: ci'i phyir sgra'i rtags pa kho na rnam pa gsum du rnam par phye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgra'i rtags pa kho na rnam pa gsum du rnam par phye zhe na /
translated: Why are only the reasons that are based on words divided into three types?

original: de'i phyir de la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la /
translated: In response to this question, the root text states:

analyzed: dbang skyes min pa bsgrub don du // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la / snga ma gnyis po las @217a * //
translated: In order to prove that it is not produced by a sense faculty,

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brda la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang don gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe former two‚Äù refers to the conceptual cognition that is based on a sign and the conceptual cognition that superimposes a different object.

original: de nyid rnam par gcod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par gcod pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to eliminate that,

original: zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu'i shes pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu'i shes pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to eliminate that‚Äù means in order to eliminate the cognition that is based on a mirage.

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par 'khrul pa med pa can zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don 'phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa las mngon sum bstan du med pa 'khrul pa med pa can rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par 'khrul pa med pa can zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don 'phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa las mngon sum bstan du med pa 'khrul pa med pa can rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya
translated: This means that perception is the nature of the cognition that is non-erroneous and non-conceptual, which arises from the contact of a sense faculty and an object.

original: bar ro // 'o na lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtog pa'i shes pa rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gsum ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: bar ro // 'o na lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtog pa'i shes pa rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa gsum ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Now, why are the three‚Äîinference, etc.‚Äîmentioned in regard to a hidden object?

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúInference, etc., are for the sake of that.‚Äù

analyzed: nyid ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub phyir zhes pa'i mdo'i cha de las drangs la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of that‚Äù is connected in the following order.

analyzed: snga ma gnyis nyid ces bya ba 'dir blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // dran pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni ngo bo ste /

original: dran pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of memory, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzung ngo //

translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe memory of a sign is the reason for the cognition of a pot, etc.‚Äù should be understood as meaning ‚Äúthe memory of a sign is the reason for the cognition of a pot, etc.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid yin la /
translated: The memory of a sign is contradictory to direct perception, and it is not direct perception.

original: des khyab pa ni sngon nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yin ba de ltar na 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: des khyab pa ni sngon nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yin ba de ltar na 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is pervaded by that, because it arises through the power of the memory of something previously experienced. Thus, the contradiction is the observation of a pervasion.

original: dmigs kyis bkar ba yin par rig par bya ba'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bkar ba yin par rig par bya ba'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit should be understood that it is a specific identification‚Äù means that it is a specific identification.

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba spyir btang ba 'di la dmigs kyis bkar ba de byas shing yul de yongs su spangs pas spyir btang ba 'jug pas rtogs pa dang bral zhing 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum mo zhes don gyisüîΩbstan par 'gyur ro //

translated: The term ‚Äúperception‚Äù is a general statement, and the specific identification of it is made by the phrase ‚Äúthat which is completely devoid of the object.‚Äù Thus, the meaning of the statement is that perception is a cognition that is free from conceptuality and is not in error.

analyzed: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis mtshan nyid lhag ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan to //

analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang yid kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not produced from a sense faculty, but rather from the mind alone‚Äù is a conceptual thought.

original: de ltar na rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa nyid kyis zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa gsal ba nyid kyi phyir dmigs kyis bkar ba'i tshig ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa nyid kyis zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa gsal ba nyid kyi phyir dmigs kyis bkar ba'i tshig ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, the specific identification of perception is not appropriate in any way by the statement ‚Äúfree from conceptuality,‚Äù because the cognition of a double moon, etc., is clear.

original: ci snang ba gang la shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: ci snang ba gang la shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: What is the object of the cognition called ‚Äúperception‚Äù? It is form, etc.

original: de dag ni de la skabs su bab pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de la skabs su bab pa yin no //
translated: These are the relevant passages.üîΩHow could it contradict the statement that it is based on a sense faculty?

original: gang gis na dbang po la brten pa brjod pas @217b 'gal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus par zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dbang po nyid la brten pa brjod pa ste /

translated: In the Compendium of Valid Knowledge, it is stated that the consciousness of two moons and so on is based on a sense faculty.

analyzed: dbang po la brten pa nyid du brjod pas 'dir yid nyid du dam bcas pa dang 'gal ba yin /

analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /

analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa bdun pa /
translated: Fifty-sevenüîΩIf it were not so, it would be unreasonable to think that this is an exception to the fourth.

analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dir bzhi pa ni dmigs kyis bkar zhes bya ba la 'di la log par rtogs pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yid nyid yin na yang rtog pa med pa
translated: If the consciousness of two moons and so on is mental but nonconceptual,

analyzed: nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba can zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di tsam gyis zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ma bkag pa'i phyir /
